Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Atomistic simulations based on density functional theory (DFT) calculations are presented for the dissociation of oxygen molecules on the Al(111) surface.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Calculations were performed using the method of rapid adiabaticfollowing, which permits the description of non-adiabatic dynamics by solving the time-dependent Schrödinger equation on a mixed normal-Wigner representation Hamiltonian.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The simulation method is first validated against experimental reaction coordinates for both the associative and dissociative pathways.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results are then presented for the first truly non-adiabatic dynamics simulations of the oxygen molecule dissociation on Al(111).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was found that the non-adiabatic effects can play an important role in the associative, as well as in the dissociative, pathway, notably by affecting the transition state ensemble.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The influence of the substrate in the dissociation process was finally discussed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, these simulations permit the first description of the non-adiabatic dissociation process of O2 molecules on the Al(111) surface.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The simulations show that the dissociative pathway is non-adiabatic, whereas the associative one is adiabatic up to the transition state.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the dissociative path, non-adiabatic coupling is very strong at the entrance of the transition state, while it is negligible in the associative path.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, the simulations evidence that the substrate plays a significant role in the dissociation process.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Al(111) surface hosts two stable configurations of the O2 molecule: 1x2 and 2x2.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The 1x2 structure corresponds with the linear geometry with the oxygen atom in the top position and the two hydrogen atoms in the bridge position, while the 2x2 structure corresponds to the bent geometry with the oxygen atom in the second position.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These two structures differ by the orientation of the molecular axis.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the following, we can refer to the 2x2 O2 structure as “bent” and to the 1x2 O2 structure as “linear”.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Initially, the O2 molecule is located on top of the surface in the linear geometry, either in the top or bridge position.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A sufficiently high energy excitation will then lead to the rearrangement of the molecular axis with a 1x2 O2 structure, in which the molecular axis points towards the substrate.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The nuclear wavepacket corresponding to this excitation has a large amplitude on the top position of the linear structure, and essentially vanishes on the bridge position.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These simulations show that the molecular axis is located above the bridge position of the Al surface, as observed in experiments.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This excitation will also lead to the dissociation of the O2 molecule into two atomic oxygen atoms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, only a small portion of the wavepacket localised on top of the linear structure is initially involved in the dissociation process, in good agreement with available experimental data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This means that the associative pathway is adiabatic.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From this work, we go one step further and consider the non-adiabatic dynamics of both pathways.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For that purpose

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The long-wavelength (low-frequency) dynamics of liquids, such as water, appear to be well described by the Stokes equation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this limit, the viscosity conveys a local divergence of velocity field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Incompressibility of the liquid implies a divergence of stress tensor as well.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By turn, the force balance between stress and elastic forces leaves an intrinsic shear wave whose amplitude decays as the inverse square of the distance from the forcing point.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These few simple assumptions are enough to account to most of the complex non-equilibrium phenomena in the low-frequency rheology of Newtonian fluids.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, during practice most real-world liquids have non-Newtonian properties.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This is particularly evident in the limit of long wavelengths, such that the elastic forces become negligible as compared to the viscous forces.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this limit, the only mechanism of forcing is viscosity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It remains to being seen if this simple model is capable of accounting for the low-frequency rheology of such fluids.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A spectropolarimetric observation of the Ca II 8498 A and 8542 A lines in the quiet Sun was presented.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The data were obtained using the Dutch Open Telescope with the new Waveslicer on the Meteor satellite.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The spectropolarimetric data cubes cover a field of view of 30 by 30 solar radii and a resolution of 0.33 by 0.33 arcseconds.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The observed area was close by the solar disc centre and included a granule of size 4 by 4 Mm in resolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Polarization signals of both line profiles and the continuum were detected, but no circular polarization signals above the detection limit of 0.1 percent were observed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The line-of-sight component of the magnetic field strengths was derived using the forward integration technique and was found to be around 100 G.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The average values of the field strength in the centre of the granules was found to be in the range 50-200 G.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recent cosmological simulations of galaxy evolution have reproduced the morphology-density relationship and star formation rate - density relationship observed in local galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These simulations, however, cannot reproduce the full distribution of galaxy properties at both low and high redshift.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It has been suggested that feedback from active galactic nuclei (AGN) and quasars may play a role in regulating star formation in their host galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, we present high resolution, cosmological, hydrodynamical simulations of a sub-set of galaxies in a single volume of a large, modern simulation, in which a simple model for radio-mode feedback was included.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The model is characterized by a constant Bondi-Hoyle-Lyttleton accretion rate onto the supermassive black hole, which is adjusted so that the AGN contributes a specified amount of radio heating to the interstellar medium.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have selected a simulation which is volume-limited and resolves all galaxies above a given mass, and which includes the effects of stellar feedback, AGN feedback and the evolving gas properties from the larger simulation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that even without AGN triggered starbursts, the momentum input from radio mode feedback is enough to significantly disrupt the cold streams which form the core of cooled galaxy clusters, and thus suppress the formation of bright ellipticals.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the same time, this feedback is not sufficient to disrupt the clusters completely.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In lower mass galaxies, below the critical cluster mass, we do not see significant suppression of star formation, although we do find a decrease in the concentration of stellar metallicity and stellar density.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We conclude that while radio-mode feedback is an effective regulator of star formation in the early universe, it alone is not sufficient to reproduce the full distribution of galaxies across the Hubble sequence.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Fourier analysis of homogeneous spaces has a long tradition in analysis.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Convolution of locally compact groups is one of the most important and widely studied operation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In contrast, Fourier analysis on semisimple Lie groups and their homogeneous spaces has been less developed, although they appear naturally in the representation theory of Lie groups.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, we establish convolution results on these groups, by imitating the locally compact case.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we show that if G is a semisimple Lie group and K a compact subgroup, then the natural analogue of the convolution map on the unitary dual of G, is also a associative algebra product on the algebra of functions on the coset space G/K. We also discuss some related results and examples.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This work is part of a series, in which we explore the structure and representation theory of semisimple Lie groups, and their homogeneous spaces.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This work was completed during the summer of 2022 as part of the MIUR summer program SFAE at Northeastern University.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recently, the existence of localized waves in binary solids with equal concentrations of the two components, called binary Laves phases, has been established.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These waves, called gyration waves, are observed experimentally for the first time in a eutectic alloy by Xia et al.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They are characterized by a compact support in the transverse direction and a (non-trivial) crystal structure in the longitudinal direction.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The existence of these waves was theoretically predicted by Nesterenko

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [2] and later confirmed by various authors using different modeling approaches [3-7].

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This Letter presents an analysis of gyration waves in the framework of the Landau-Lifshitz equation for nonlinear dispersive waves.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The existence of two branches of wave dispersion were established: a heavy branch corresponding to the density wave and a light branch corresponding to the spin wave.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Moreover, the linearization spectrum includes two eigenvalues corresponding with the in-phase and out-of-phase oscillations of the heavy and light wave branches.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The spin wave has a finite amplitude beyond the threshold of instability.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Thus, gyration waves can be regarded as localized modes consisting of the superposition of a heavy and a light waves with the corresponding wavelengths (Goldstone modes).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This picture is confirmed by the numerical solution of the full Landau-Lifshitz equation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, we study the effect of confining the hard-sphere fluid between two parallel hard walls on its average properties.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 First, we calculate the perturbation correction in the equation of state of the ideal hard-sphere fluid.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This correction is exponentially small when the wall-fluid density ratio is small and the separation between the walls is much larger than the particle diameter.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using this perturbation result, we show that the change in average density of the fluid due to confinement scales as the volume of the space enclosed by the confining walls.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Next, we examine the effect of confinement on the structure factor and show that this also scales with the volume of the space.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also calculate the effect of confinement on the speed of sound and the inter-diffusion coefficient and show that they are independent of the volume of the enclosed space.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results imply that confinement has little or no effect on the average entropy, enthalpy, heat capacity, viscosity, and self-diffusivity of the hard-sphere fluid.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Large spirals were found to possess statistically significant regular magnetic fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These fields range between a few G to a few tens of mG, and are poloidal in structure, with essentially field-free regions near the galaxy's edge.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The fields are composed of large-scale poloidal components, with small-scale toroidal components; i.e. the fields look roughly like the product of a large-scale poloidal vector with a small-scale toroidal scalar.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The magnetic energy is typically a few times 10−18 to a few times 10−16 J, or a few times 1044 to a few times 10−15 ergs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The mean gas pressures in the galaxies are high enough (a few times 10−13 to a few times 10−12 Pa) that the observed field strengths can be produced by the equipartition between the gas pressures and the field pressures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For this paper we consider a system of particles interacting via binary collisions and which also interact by means of a pairwise interaction potential which is degenerate in some sense.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that the dynamics of this particle system can be approximated, in the appropriate scaling, by a coupled system of non-linear conservation laws.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The approximation is of the sense of weak convergence of probability measures on appropriate function spaces.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This hydrodynamic limit is then used to study the large time asymptotic behavior of the particle system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We consider the case when the interaction potential degenerate to a Kramers sense.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For this case the hard-core interaction force and the inter-particle interaction force are not opposite, and they have the same scaling with the particle density.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This degenerate dynamics does not satisfy the hyperbolicity condition.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that if the initial data are regular enough and the time interval is small enough, then the particle system approach the hydrodynamic solution as time evolve.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proof is based on the theory of viscosity solutions and the compactness method.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, we present a linear reformulation of the Kuramoto model of self-synchronizing oscillators.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we consider the network where each node is endowed with a dimensional variable and all the nodes are connected via undirected networks, the coupling function is a function of the difference of the dimensional variables of the connected nodes and all nodes are identical.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that this model can be written as a coupling of diagonal and scalar ODEs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We then use the Schur complement to reduce the dynamics in the original model to this diagonal plus scalar system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We analyze the equilibria of the reduced model and show that in certain cases, the reduced model can exhibit oscillatory and chaotic behavior that is not present in the original model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also show that, when some conditions on the coupling and the dimensional variables are met, the dynamics of the original system are lossless propagated to the reduced system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Massive young stellar objects (MYSOs) are among the most luminous and turbulent objects in the interstellar medium, yet their complex structures and transition to rich stellar clusters makes them challenging to study.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this letter, we present a multi-epoch high-frequency radio continuum study of a sample of 38 MYSOs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These sources are chosen to be strong water masers, potential signposts of high-mass star formation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find a high incidence of positive spectral index gradients (approximately half the sample), which are often large and exhibit variability on timescales of weeks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We interpret this as variability of the free-free emission primarily arising from shocks excited by protostellar outflows and jets, in agreement with recent findings at lower frequencies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also find a large population for sources with negative spectral index gradients, likely arising from free-free emission from ionized accreting material.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The infrared luminosity, inferred mass accretion rate, and spectral gradient characteristics of this sample suggest that many of these sources might be in the process of transitioning from MYSO to either evolved star with an ionized inner disk, or to a less massive star with a circumstellar disk.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 An incoming droplet bouncing on a smooth horizontal surface may appear to a viewer as a ball of steady size.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 How much did it actually change in size?

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The obvious answer would be that it bounces as a unit, spreading its lift over the whole drop.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This simple model, known as the unit bounce, was proposed in the 17th century and found to match experiments until the late 1800s.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Since then, droplets bouncing on a solid surface with a high enough RH (relative humidity) demonstrate non-uniform size change: they were found to shrink in some places and to grow in others.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This effect, known as non-uniform bouncing, was first observed in 1908 and is now well documented in videos.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This phenomenon is counterintuitive and may not fit the classical bouncing model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present a simple model predicting the lifetime of a bouncing droplet, showing that it is finite.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 After presenting a short qualitative description of the model, we describe a more detailed one, involving a partial differential equation, solved numerically.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The solution reproduces the key features of the observed non-uniform bouncing: the shrinked and growed regions and their lifetime.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We then discuss various physical mechanisms that could explain the observed effects, both in the framework of the proposed model and in the more standard framework of droplet bouncing.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In Dissipative Particle Dynamics (DPD), interactions between different particles is modeled by short-range, collision-driven forces that are approximately mean-zero and have a specified auto-correlation function.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This approach, which treats short-range interactions with Gaussian white noise, is accurate for particle separations much larger than the dissipative lengthscale.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 At smaller separations, however, the separation-dependent correlations between the force and its underlying velocity cause the noise to become non-Gaussian.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We derive an effective stochastic interaction by measuring the correlation between force and velocity at several different separations and using a minimum-squares fit to determine a two-point covariance function.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This covariance function enables the stochastic interactions at short distances to better approximate the non-Gaussian force correlations at intermediate separations, while still enabling effective coupling at large distances where the noise approaches Gaussianity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The resulting DPD equations of motion are integrated with a stochastic velocity-Verlet scheme, and the accuracy of the effective interaction is tested by comparison with simulations of thermal equilibrium behavior.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present numerical results on three-nucleon observables in nuclear matter as functions of the pion mass.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The predictions are obtained in the framework of a coupled-cluster expansion for the nuclear wave function, using two interaction kernels: a long-range one, corresponding to the leading order of a systematic chiral perturbation theory (ChPT) expansion, and a short-range one, corresponding to two-nucleon contact interactions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that, for observables related to nuclear matter saturation, the convergence of the results towards the physical point depends on the range of the interaction, with faster convergence for the short-range kernel.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By addition, for a given range of the interaction, the dependence on the pion mass of the predictions increases as the density of the system under consideration decreases, i.e., as the range of the interaction increases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we argue that, in order to properly describe the evolution of the nuclearmany-body system with the QCD scale, an appropriate renormalization group analysis of ChPT should been performed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using observations from the Fermi Gamma Ray Space Telescope, we have detected gamma-rays from 37 supernova remnants (SNRs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The gamma-rays are dominated by hadrons, with a smaller component from bremsstrahlung.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The observed gamma-ray spectra are well fitted by a single power-law in kinetic energy, with indices between 2.0 and 2.7.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The gamma-ray efficiency, the fraction for supernova explosion energy deposited in the form of gamma-rays, is about 1% for young SNRs and increases with age as the amount of shocked gas increases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Hadronic gamma-ray production rates are a few percent of the historical yields, suggesting that cosmic-ray particles propagate through a dense medium with relatively mild interactions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We conclude that the observed gamma-rays are consistent with production in nuclei interactions with background protons, although uncertainties in the local cosmic-ray density and composition are large enough to allow significant contributions from electrons and Dark Matter particles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The detection for gamma-rays from young and middle-aged SNRs without corresponding radio synchrotron emission challenges existing models of gamma-ray production in SNRs.

 Using the Mileura Widefield Array low frequency demonstrator field prototype system, we report on observations of the crab giant pulses (GCTs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Mileura field was located at ~1260 km distance from the mooncenter and exhibits highFaraday rotation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We recorded 20 hrs for observations in 2016, during which we detected 5 GCTs and determined Faraday rotation measures (RM) following each pulse.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also triggered simultaneosly 1.2 MHz of recording modes at two adjacent north-south locations in the array.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Within this band we detected two GCTs but only with sub-meter accuracy due to the long field of view of the array.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We detect DM and RM vectors typically aligned with the center of the GCT peaks, consistent with the extreme magneto-ionic conditions in the crab pulsar magnetosphere.

 Such observations can potentially detect the earth rotation relative to the rotating neutron star magnetosphere.

 The aim of this paper is to illustrate a methodology based on Principal Component Analysis (PCA) and Automatic Relevance Determination (ARD) for rapid data acquisition in geoscience applications.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The presented approach was implemented for hydrogeological applications, where the acquired data consist of Ground-Penetrating Radar (GPR) signals, which are recorded over the same region where pressure changes are to be estimated.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed methodology consists of two steps.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 First, several signals were recorded under different conditions, from which a set of data will be selected for the learning process.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The selection criteria is based on the prediction error computed from a model, assuming a Kalman Filter (KF) structure, using the recorded data to predict the pressure changes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Second, the Principal Component Analysis is applied to the selected data in order to reduce the dimensionality and to obtain a low-cost model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed methodology is tested with artificial data and compared with the ARD technique, showing the effectiveness of the proposed approach.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We report the detection of six magnetically-driven explosions of rapidly-rotating white dwarfs (WDs) following accretion-induced collapse.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The survey is conducted using the ASAS-SN virtual telescope, which monitors the entire visible sky every few hours.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Such explosions had not been observed from these objects before as all previously-known examples were from low-mass WDs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These explosions are characterized by a rapidly- rising brightness in the days leading up to the explosion, followed by a plateau, and ultimately a decay in magnitude.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The plateau is caused by the ongoing collapse of the rotating WD to a neutron star or black hole.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The explosion was confirmed by the presence of an underlying plateau in the subsequent light curve, which is not seen in cases of stable nuclear burning on the WD surface.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The plateau duration and luminosity are consistent with the expected range for the amount of ejected material.

 Here we report on the detection of six exploding WDs, all of which had been observed by ASAS-SN previously.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Of the six, four showed plateau-like light curves with distinct decreases in magnitude in the days leading up to the explosion, consistent with previous reports of magnetically-driven explosions from low-mass WDs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Two additional objects, namely SDSS J0804+2052 and SDSS J2315+1855, showed distinct plateau-like decreases of magnitude from the preceding increase in brightness, consistent with the scenario for magnetically-driven explosions from rapidly-rotating WDs for the first time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We compared the observed plateau durations and luminosities to simulations that included and excluded magnetic fields, and found that the emission from both simulations was best reproduced by simulations that included magnetic fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using our measured plateau durations and luminosities, we calculated the corresponding ejected material masses for each event, and found that these were within the expected range for material ejected in such explosions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also determined the probable locations for the progenitor stars by cross-referencing our sample to Gaia Data Release 2 and found that four of the exploding WDs would most likely be observed in the field of view of their respective host galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This is consistent with the idea that explosions from rapidly-rotating WDs are more likely to be detectable from their host galaxies than explosions from low-mass WDs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 In quantum mechanics, a density operator is a projection valued, Hermitian operator that represents the state of a quantum system with uncertainity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The density operator is a fundamental and important mathematical object in quantum mechanics, which encapsulates the statistical information of the quantum system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For this paper, we study the geometry of the set of all density operators on a complex Hilbert space, i.e., the quantum state space.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 First, we present a generalized von Neumann entropy and characterize the entropy landscape of the set of all quantum states.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We then study the extreme points, the convolution structure, and provide alternative characterizations of the set of physically allowed quantum states.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Next, we show that a quantum state is a density state if and only if it can be expressed as a tomographic probability distribution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By an application of these results, we derive a unified geometric framework for the construction of positive maps and use it to completely classify super-operator positive maps on trace-class operators.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As an example, we provide an explicit formula for the operator Jordan map, which can be considered as a quantum analog of the complex equator of the Riemann sphere.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For a family of operators related to the one-dimensional Schrödinger operator with periodic potential, the asymptotics of eigenfunctions in the semiclassical limit are studied.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using the classical shooting argument, it is shown that the spectral problem is equivalent to one for a new family of operators with parameter dependent on the derivative of the periodic potential.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The new operators were defined in a “homogenized” domain, where the spectrum is assumed to be uniformly separated from the essential spectrum.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the semiclassical limit, the operator family turns into a Schrodinger operator with constant coefficient.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The asymptotics of the eigenfunctions were studied in the spirit of Floquet theory, replacing the fixed dispersion relation by the uniform separation of the spectrum.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was shown that the eigenfunctions are real-valued and trigonometric polynomials.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The semiclassical quantization condition for the period of the potential is derived, and it is shown to be equivalent to the Gutzwiller’s trace formula.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Realizable Hamiltonians are proposed for universal adiabatic quantum computers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In contrast to earlier proposals, our Hamiltonians can be implemented with near-term quantum devices.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We consider a general setup for a target unitary to realize and an adiabatic evolution over a time period T.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The generated Hamiltonian is allowed to have any term supported on the eigenstates of the initial Hamiltonian, and thus in general cannot be expressed as a sum of bilinears of the form {|,i}H{i,}{,}.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present a general framework to prove whether the final Hamiltonian is realizable for the given target unitary, subject to certain regularity conditions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For a special case when the final Hamiltonian is also a sum of bilinears of the above form, we show that the realization can be obtained via gadgets composed of qubit transverters and clusters of surface gates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For a more general case, we provide explicit constructions based on Kitaev’s quantum double model and its adaption for surface codes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We analyze the performance of the resulting Hamiltonians via the Taylor series expansion.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we show that the gap of the resulting Hamiltonian closes at the order of 1/T2, which means the gap closes exponentially at the best rate T−2.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This observation implies that for a universal T, the corresponding quantum computer still requires an infinite power of quantum seed state in the starting Hamiltonian to compensate for the error accumulation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We conclude by discussing possible ways forward, which would potentially address the error accumulation and improve the performance of the resulting adiabatic quantum computers.

 Fossil groups are large clusters of galaxies captured by the gravity of a larger central halo.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The galaxies in the groups are early-type, similar to the way in which the central galaxy is described as cuspy.

 Although the average groups masses in the simulation agree with observational values, the fraction of groups with multiple luminous members is less than that in observed groups.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 General relativity, as formulated by Albert Einstein, is a cornerstone of modern physics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It describes gravity as the warping of space and time, resulting from the asymmetric warping of space and time caused by matter and energy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One of the most well-tested theories in all of physics, general relativity has withstood the test of time, having passed all experimental tests with high accuracy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, there are some that speculate that a deeper understanding of gravity may require the introduction of new concepts and ideas.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As part of this trend, there has been recent interest in the process by which we describe the gravitational interaction using Einstein’s theory; that is, renormalization.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Renormalization refers to the process by which infinities inherent in the theory were eliminated by redefining the parameters of the theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the process, a more general framework for gravitational theory—one that includes various alternative theories such as f(R) gravity—was created.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For this paper, we examine this framework for renormalization.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We provide an extensive account of the process and provide a step-by-step guide to performing calculations in this framework.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We illustrate this process by several examples, including calculating the effective action for a system of gravitons.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We end in a discussion of our findings and suggestions for future work.

 The MINOS Experiment at FNAL has deployed the first long-baseline neutrino oscillation appearance experiment in the NuMI beamline and has recently published its first-year results.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The experiment uses a 3-detector setup, including one upstream detector at the Northern Initial Data taking site and two downstream detectors at the Soudan Underground Mine in Minnesota (NE detector) and Saints, Louisiana (SW detector).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The data taking period was in 2011 to 2012, and the total exposure in the far detector was 2.2 ton-years.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 During this period MINOS measured muon neutrino disappearance with a significance of 5.2σ, and presented first evidence for electron neutrino appearance, with 3.6σ of significance.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first MINOS results paper presents the new data and preliminary global fit results.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 MINOS is developed to study muon neutrino disappearance and pion- created electron neutrinos appearance.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The new dataset includes neutrino interactions with the detector during 2011 and 2012, and the global fit incorporates the full dataset, with the preliminary results presented in this paper updated to include the full dataset.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main update to the new results is the re-weighting of the event rates with the improved cross section calculations by the NNPDF collaboration.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This allows for a more precise estimate of the experiment’s background and sensitivity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The experiment finds no evidence for muon neutrino disappearance and presents 3.6σ of evidence for electron neutrino appearance.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The result has an element of uncertainty from our knowledge of the neutrino flux and cross sections, which are reduced with this update.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Dewetting is an important micro-machining technique for nanometer-scale feature fabrication in a wide range of materials, including metals, semiconductors and dielectrics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The process relies upon the removal of a thin layer of material from one substrate to produce a thin film of the material on another substrate.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Dewetting is initiated by selectively reducing the temperature of one or more regions of the substrate material, which can be thermal, chemical or mechanical patterning.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One typical dewetting scenario is the removal of a thin layer of material from a bulk semi-conductor to produce a thin film of the material on another substrate.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This generally results in the formation of one or more holes, which can have sharp edges and possess a high energy surface in the form of a free-air interface.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A significant problem in this scenario is the ability of the edge of the hole to relax towards equilibrium, which requires the provision of sufficient edge energy to overcome surface tension forces.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work, we perform a full-scale hydrodynamic calculation of the relaxation of an initially circular dewetting hole, which is constrained at its edges and is free to move in two dimensions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We compare the evolution in the hole shape and energy with both circular and elliptic equilibrium solutions, and examine the importance of various physical mechanisms for relaxation, including bulk diffusion, convection and surface tension.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent years, the notion of emergent spacetime has been introduced to try to unify gravity with other physical forces, most notably quantum mechanics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These emergent spacetimes have been shown to arise in a bottom-up fashion from consistent theories in a higher dimensional spacetime, general relativity in d dimensions plus a scalar field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, we show that for a particular choice of coupling between the scalar and gravitational fields, this higher dimensional spacetime admits a higher symmetry, and the theory appears in one higher dimension as a dual gravitational theory with a doubled number of spacetime dimensions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Specifically, we consider the theory for a scalar field with a non-linear self-interaction on d+1 dimensional Minkowski space.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The corresponding equations for motion have a critical point corresponding to empty spacetime.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that by introducing a new scalar field conformally coupled to the first one, the system admits a higher symmetry, and reduces to a theory in d dimensions with an emergent ((d-1)+1) dimensional Minkowski spacetime.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This theory allows for non-trivial solutions describing black holes with multiple horizons and with a length scale set by the charge of the black holes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, in the classical solution, there is a smooth lower dimensional region behind the black hole horizon, in which the original (d+1) dimensional spacetime is smoothly extended, with the extension encoded in the structure of a solitonic string connecting the black hole horizon with the smooth region.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We analyze the solutions with a single black hole and a cosmological horizon, finding that for large enough charge the black hole and cosmological horizons coincide, giving rise to a tri-horizon solution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We compute the entropy of the black holes in the dual gravitational theory, and find that it matches the Bekenstein-Hawking entropy of the black holes in the tri-horizon solution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we argue whether the general solution of the theory includes the Reissner-Nordström black holes in higher dimensions, for which the gravitational theory reduces to five dimensions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We end with a discussion of the results and possible extensions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A formal definition of quantum zero-knowledge proof (QKZP) has been given by Watrous [19].

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This definition uses two interactive probabilistic protocols.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A first, the witness generation, simulates a particular probabilistic polynomial-time (PPT) procedure.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The second, the simulator, accepts any PPT procedure as an adversary.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A verifier chooses a random witness, sends it to the simulator, and receives a response.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The response must contain a statement that is a polynomial-time verification condition for the original procedure.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Large extra dimensions (LEDs) provide a natural mechanism by which conservation laws may be localised on a four dimensional brane embedded in a higher dimensional space-time.

 In this scenario the universe appears four dimensional due to a fundamental conflict between the conservation of energy in our brane world and the continuous creation of AdSLEDs.

 The photons travel through the observable universe before reaching us.

 Therefore, the observed temperature of the CMB is the result of the sum of the energies of all the particles after they were created, before they were able to interact.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Three-dimensional space was filled with a thicket of 3-dimensional curves.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 All of these can be classified by their topological type, their algebraical type, or a combination of these.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The most interesting 3-dimensional curves are singular ones: they are generically n-dimensional and transversal in n-dimensional space.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Singular curves are traditionally classified by their genera, i.e. by their codimensions in the parameter space.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A comprehensive theory of singular curves was developed in the late 1980s and early 1990s, see in particular the works of Harris and points of view of Coppo and Garrone.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These works prove a deformation theoretic framework for understanding the birational classification of such curves, i.e. their ability to be infinitesimally deformed into another one.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This framework implies also that for a generic choice of a curve, there is a plane in the nine-dimensional projective space of quadric hypersurfaces that the curve doesn’t intersect, and such a plane was called an exceptional plane.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Curves with exceptional planes are called decomposable.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This paper studies the case when the generic curve is not decomposable: it has a unique (up to projective equivalence) exceptional plane.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Such curves are called non-decomposable.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The most common case is when the exceptional plane is a plane of linear dependency for the general curve: such a plane was called an exceptional secant plane.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The present paper develops the theory for such curves, and among other results, gives a birational classification (the so-called Wahl map) and describes how the variety of non-decomposable curves of a given genus (which is open of infinite type) fibers over the space of curves with a given exceptional secant plane (which is of finite type).

 Network communities, or clusters of nodes with a higher density of connections between nodes in the same community than between nodes in different communities, are important structure in networks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Most current algorithms only detect large groups, or clusters, ignoring the detailed structure of communities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we introduce a resolution limit to network clustering, and develop a hierarchical method that detects both large and small communities in networks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed method works on first identifying super-communities at many resolutions, and then clustering each super-community at the given resolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We validate our method on random and real-world networks, and show that our method outperforms other state-of-the-art community detection algorithms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 There has been a recent resurgence of interest in network clustering, sparked by the development of a wide variety of network data, as well as the ubiquity of network datasets in other fields, such as social media and biology.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The study of network communities is traditionally focused on detecting large groups or clusters of nodes with high density within the network, or networks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Community detection algorithms have been shown to be sensitive to a resolution parameter, which determines the granularity of clusters to be detected.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Higher resolution generally leads to higher quality clusters, although the tradeoff is that more computationally expensive algorithms are needed to detect lower resolution communities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With this paper, we introduce a hierarchical method for community detection that identifies both large and small communities at many resolution levels.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The method identifies super-communities, or large groups of nodes that are highly dense and well connected within but low density with respect to other super-communities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The method then clusters the identified super-communities, refining the cluster structure for each resolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This hierarchical approach allows us to detect both large and small communities with many resolutions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We demonstrate the utility of our approach on both synthetic and real-world networks, showing that our method is highly accurate in detecting clusters and outperforms state-of-the-art community detection algorithms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recently, scientists have developed a model of how this background radiation may be generated by quantum mechanical effects within the universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The model describes the universe in a sea of zero-point fluctuations, with particles taking on every imaginable (virtual) position in this sea.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As the universe expands and its temperature drops, these virtual particles have an increased tendency to settle into the lowest-energy positions, leading to a background of virtual radiation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This model has one key flaw: it did not describe the universe as a collection of particles, but rather a collection of waves.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This is analogous to modeling the ocean with a collection of sticks floating on top of a boiling pot of water.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The waves are the waves in the ocean, and the sticks are the particles of the boiling pot of water.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The particles of the model, the waves of the universe, have not been observed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this model, the particles of the boiling pot of water are the photons of the cosmic microwave background radiation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As the universe cools, the photons have an increased tendency to assume the lowest-energy positions, that of equilibrium with the cold universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 When the temperature in the universe drops to 3000 K, the photons are no longer in equilibrium with the quantum fluctuations of the radiation, and thus begin to free-stream, moving away from regions of high density and toward regions of lower density.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This is analogous with a water bottle left out in the cold.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As the bottle cools, water molecules begin to move toward the bottom of the bottle, leaving a region of space with lower density than the surrounding air.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work, we consider a modified model of this phenomenon, in which the particles (photons) does not move, but the background radiation does.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The universe, in this case, has a "frozen sea" where the particles settle at the bottom of the sea but the radiation waves continue to wave throughout the universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this model, as the universe cools, the radiation waves continue to wave throughout the universe but the particles have settled at the bottom of the sea, leaving regions of higher and lower density.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This provides a mechanism by which the universe may undergo a phase transition from a state of thermal equilibrium to a state of nonequilibrium, or a cooling dominated phase transition.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 An autonomous distributed admission control scheme for IEEE 802.11 DCF was proposed, which can intelligently allocate the channel capacity for improving the utilization efficiency of the wireless medium and fully utilizing the capacity of the available bandwidth.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The admission control scheme consists of a controlling mechanism and a controlled algorithm.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The controlling mechanism divides the overall network into a number of virtual channels with a fixed size through assigning a range of channel access priorities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 All stations on the network sense the wireless medium and calculate the corresponding transmission data rates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The controlled algorithm selects the stations by establishing connections in the controlling mechanism according to their network requirements and moves the whole network among different virtual channels according to the scheduling results.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Simulation results show that the channel utilization efficiency can be enhanced effectively.

 The evolution of stochastic SIR epidemics on random networks with heterogeneous connectivity is investigated.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was found that, on regular networks, the disease-free state is unstable if the average degree of the network is smaller than the threshold, and the disease will die out spontaneously if the average degree is larger than the threshold.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 When the network is heterogeneous, the disease-free state is still unstable if the network is regular; however, the disease can persist on the network with probability one if the average degree of the network is larger than a threshold.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Moreover, for scale-free networks, the epidemic threshold becomes lowered as the edge distribution exponent γ increases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Network structure determines the stability of the disease-free state.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If the average degree of the network is smaller than the threshold, the disease-free state is unstable; if the average degree is larger than the threshold, the disease-free state is stable, but the disease can still die out spontaneously if the network is regular.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, scale-free network leads to a larger epidemic threshold.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This paper shows the existence for a pure inductive limit state of the pair of measures consisting of Lebesgue measure on the interval and the Dirac delta mass at the endpoint, in contrast to the trivial and well-known example of the pair of measures consisting of the counting and Lebesgue measures on the Integer, which has pure state but not inductive limit state.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proof makes use of unique path decomposition for generalized functions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is shown that the unique path decomposition for the regularization of the Dirac delta mass is weakly isomorphic to the double sequential limit of the unique path decompositions for regularized distributions that appear as simple components in the generalized decomposition.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is further shown that this double sequential limit coincides with the desired pure inductive limit state.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Kolmogorov's property for this pure inductive limit state is then shown to follow from its uniqueness and general properties of inductive limit states.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was further argued that the existence of this pure state but not inductive limit state for the pair of measures described above has several potential applications in mathematics and theoretical physics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The paper presents the results of joint work with E. Posta and I. Damián M. Medina.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Researchers often wish to keep their research secret until they have obtained formal consent to share this information with the general public or until they have developed a proprietary product.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Although formal ethical committees evaluate the merits of proposed research, it is often not possible to obtain consent to research until a future date.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For many cases, it is not feasible to develop a proprietary product without sharing initial research findings.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It would be advantageous if a single measure could been used to weigh the merits of research in these two distinct contexts.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A common definition of "merit" would allow for objective comparisons between research projects.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, we describe a mathematical framework for comparing research projects based on defining a research program as a search in a solution space for the best solution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our framework assigns a score that balances two competing concerns: the need to share information early on, so that failures can become corrected before distributing costly resources, and the need to obtain consent to distribute information in a more widespread manner.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We demonstrate the feasibility in this framework with a number of examples.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The VLT-FLAMES survey of massive stars (VMSS) is aimed at studying the evolution of hot massive stars in the Local Group galaxy the Large Magellanic Cloud (LMC).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Wind properties and evolution in hot massive stars are key to understand feedback from massive stars in their environment, from the morphological structure of the interstellar medium to the chemical evolution of their host galaxy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Combined high-resolution spectroscopy of VLT-FLAMES allows to determine mass-loss rates from H emission, temperature of the bi-conical winds and thus analyze the evolutionary status of these stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From the mass-loss rates, Ionic masses can been derived and eventually be used to investigate other properties of the winds, such as ionization degrees and acceleration regions with potential effects on simulations of the feedback into the environment.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this contribution we present the first results on the evolution of hot massive stars in the LMC and the impact of this evolution on the galactic feedback.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We confirm previous studies which concluded that the initial mass function (IMF) is top-heavy in the LMC, with respect to the Milky Way.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The most massive stars show stronger IMF divergence from the initial mass function (IMF) with increasing age, suggesting that these stars are affected by significant mass-loss episodes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We found more extreme cases of stars with abnormally high nitrogen to carbon (N/C) and nitrogen to oxygen (N/O) abundance ratios, which could be the consequence of a thermohaline mixing process occurring in their winds, an hydrodynamic process taking place in the strong winds of massive stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This paper investigates the performance in a downlink MIMO system with multiple co-channel and cross- channel transmit antennas.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We consider a case where the base station (BS) has perfect channel state information (CSI) but the user equipment (UE) only has statistical CSI.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We propose to use a combining technique at the UE, based on antenna switching, to exploit the benefit of using multiple antennas at the BS.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We establish a simpleclosed-form expression of the achievable rate, and obtain the optimal BS beamformer that maximizes the achievable rate for a given UE combining vector.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Numerical results show significant performance gains using our proposed techniques in comparison to using only UE CSI or only BS CSI.

 The classical distance scale to galaxies is based on the Cepheid variable stars in the Milky Way and in host galaxies with accurate distances measured via trigonometric parallax.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With order to calibrate this relation, it is useful to have methods that measure the distances to galaxies outside of our own.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this Letter we present an alternative method based on the properties of stars in the Large Magellanic Cloud (LMC).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The LMC is our closest satellite galaxy and is a excellent calibration point as its distance is well established via measurement of its Hubble flow velocity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use the fact that stars in the LMC are mostly red clump stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The properties of red clump stars are well understood and can be used to measure their distances via multi-variable polynomial fits.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find the median distance of the LMC measured via this method is 18.1 kpc, with an estimated observational uncertainty of 0.4 kpc.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We measure the distance to five populous star clusters in the LMC and apply the same technique to these clusters and find they are also around 18 kpc with a small range in distance of 0.1 kpc.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We conclude with the precision of this method for determining the distance to the LMC is 0.4 kpc.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 NGC 5033 is a Sy 1.5 galaxy, located within the Fornax Cluster at a distance of 22.4 Mpc.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It has a massive active galactic nucleus (AGN), which is also the power source for the observed broad optical and ultraviolet lines and strong X-ray emission.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Continuum emission at centimeter wavelengths from this source has been little studied.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have carried out new cm-wavelength continuum observations with the Very Long Baseline Array that reveal a core-jet structure for the first time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The spectrum, which is fairly flat for 80 to 6 cm, is consistent with optically thin free-free emission from a thermal electron population with a temperature of approximately 0.2 keV. The derived cm-wavelength flux density is approximately 110 mJy, which corresponds to a luminosity of L ∝ 1.2

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This is slightly higher that the values estimated from lower-frequency measurements, but it is within the errors of those estimates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We speculate on the possibility that the cm-wavelength spectrum was affected by free-free absorption.

 A population of metal-rich droplets, analogous to the Sun’s hydrogen-rich solar wind, is proposed to enrich the interstellar medium (ISM).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These droplets form by the capture of gaseous metal atoms by broken dust grains.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We perform one-dimensional hydrodynamical simulations of this process and find that, as the gas is enriched, the droplets grow in mass and radius.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also perform the first statistical analysis of the mass capture efficiency.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The rate for droplet growth depends on the local abundance of their metals, making it a self-regulating mechanism for the ISM enrichment.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using observational data on the [C[II]{}](http://decat.cx/search?q=C%26+II) intensity in our Galaxy and in the Solar vicinity we show that the obtained growth tracks for droplets can match the data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This process may play a significant role by enriching the ISM and making up the “metallicity problem” - the discrepancy between the metal abundances measured in stars vs. that expected from early nucleosynthesis theory in the “standard” model of the Galaxy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using an analytical approximation we calculate the volume filling factor of droplets formed through this process in the Galaxy and find that it can explain the high observed [C[II]{}](http://decat.cx/search?q=C%26+II) volume filling factor.
