Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Organic conductors are unique systems for studying criticality and quantum phase transitions due to the unusual nature of the charge, spin, and orbital degrees of freedom that is involved.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we report observations on critical scattering and scaling behavior in quasi one-dimensional conductors based on the Bechgaard and Fabre salts.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the charge degrees of freedom are critical over the full range of temperatures, with dynamical critical exponent z=2.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present evidence for logarithmic corrections to scaling, and estimate the central charge c=1.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The spin and orbital degrees of freedom are found to be either Heisenberg or Kugel-Khomskii models, with spin-orbital separation clearly evident in the single crystal samples.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Although there is some evidence for quantum critical points in the system, our data are consistent with the spin and orbital degrees of freedom being separate chains coupled by a uniform Heisenberg coupling with an effective lower critical interaction strength.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This material can be viewed as a testing ground for interesting theoretical questions related to quantum many-body effects and the limits of criticality.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Organic conductors are a recently discovered new class for materials that exhibit high-temperature superconductivity and other important physical phenomena1,2.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These materials are composed of quasi-two-dimensional molecules with strong spin-orbit coupling, resulting in a small spin wavelength and remarkable magnetic properties3,4.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recent neutron scattering experiments5,6 on the quasi-two-dimensional organic superconductor α-T-NbSe2 has revealed a low-energy magnetic spectrum that is best characterized as fluctuating antiferromagnetism.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This finding was surprising given the observed low temperatures and high transition temperatures for superconductivity and antiferromagnetism, respectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here, we perform a phenomenological analysis on the magnetic excitations in α-T-NbSe2 based on an anisotropic square-lattice quantum Heisenberg model with intrinsic dimerization and feedback from the magnetic order parameter.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the magnetic excitation spectrum can be reconciled with experiment without the need for immiscible dimer and antiferromagnetic orders.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The measured magnetic spectral function is a consequence of superposition of lightly damped dynamic fluctuations of incipient magnetic order with a relatively large, roughly temperature-independent coupling to the vector antiferromagnetic order parameter.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results elucidate the intriguing relationship between the coexisting antiferromagnetism and superconductivity in these materials, and suggest that fluctuation exchange may play a significant role in their properties7,8.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Lyman Break Galaxies (LBGs) are highly star-forming galaxies with high redshifts.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They can be identified through their Lyman-break dropout signature in the spectrum and are observed to exist up to z ~ 6.7.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have obtained spectra of three Lyman break galaxies at z = 5.7–5.9 using the LRIS instrument on the Keck telescope.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These data were used to measure rest-frame UV spectroscopy through visible wavelengths for these galaxies, complementing recent studies in the near-infrared (NIR).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These observations have considerable implications for galaxy formation and reionization, as the Lyman continuum radiation from massive young stars is responsible for driving the return of UV radiation with redshift.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These observations indicate that the epoch of galaxy formation was considerably delayed with respect to the NIR spectroscopy, perhaps to as late as z ~ 5.7–5.9, corresponding to a period of only 250–500 Myr after the Big Bang.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is also likely that the escape of ionizing radiation is limited by the harder ionizing radiation from young stars at these early times.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The observed absorption lines in the UV spectra of these galaxies provide important clues to the physical conditions in these young galaxies, and comparison with high-redshift galaxies with later-generation telescopes such as HST and Spitzer will allow us to study how the escape of ionizing radiation was altered as these sources passed through the period of reionization.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present the first high-accuracy, high-reliability effective-one-body (EOB) binary waveforms for nonspinning, equal-mass, black-hole (BH) coalescences with mass ratios as low as q = 0.2.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Such waveforms, which are restricted to the small mass-ratio limit of general relativity, are essential for the rigorous and accurate computation of emitted radiation and the estimation of Source Terms in computational EM and GW astronomy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We demonstrate that, with a single adjustment for the mass ratio, our waveform family, dubbed DECOULper waveform approximates the analytic solution of the effective one body (EOB) equations to Grandchallenge surrogate modeling approach, where they provide accurate Source Terms for radiation from BH-BH mergers, despite being computed for equal-mass systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Galactic super star clusters (SSCs) are small ( approximately 2pc in size), dense (approximately 10,000 members/Spc3), very young (a few million years old) systems which is observed in the centers of many galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Super star clusters form through either the direct collapse of giant molecular clouds or through coalescence of smaller clusters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Despite their abundance, properties of SSCs have not been studied in great detail due to their spatial resolution limitations in external galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This has recently changed with the launch of the Hubble Space Telescope (HST) which has allowed the discovery of much fainter SSCs in the centers of nearby galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present the results from hydrodynamic calculations on super star clusters with a strong second collapse in both gas and stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The second collapse forms a second population of stars that will significantly impact the global properties of the SSC.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present an approximate analytic technique of determining the impact of the second collapse on SSC properties, and apply it to super star clusters with a bimodal (collapse) initial density distribution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that the ratio of first to second collapse regions in SSCs is strongly correlated with global SSC properties.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For particular, SSCs with a strongly peaked initial conditions, such as those formed in cuspy dark matter profiles, have a significantly higher ratio of first to second collapse than those formed in flat or cored profiles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This leads to SSCs with cuspy profiles having a higher median age and lower median stellar mass than those formed in cuspy profiles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This provides a solution to the "core catastrophe" problem, which describes the apparent discrepancy between observations and numerical simulations of cuspy dark matter profiles that suggest SSCs may not be able to form.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present typical SSC properties as a function of both halo profile and initial conditions, and discuss the implications for hierarchical structure formation theories.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From this work we study the fragmentation of a charm quark into non-relativistic bound states of light quarks, namely, mesons, using an effective theory approach.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Within this theory the charm quark interacts with the quantum fluctuations of the Polyakov loop, which simulates the gluon field in the underlying gauge theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the fragmentation function for the transition from a charm quark to a charged pion can be well approximated by considering the Schrödinger equation for a simple potential model, where the coupling between quark and diquark is parametrized by an effective coupling constant.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We calculate this constant using heavy quark effective theory and find because, within our truncation, it is independent of the light quarks inside the initial charm quark state.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The parameter of the model which effectively measures the strength of the interaction, the effective coupling constant, was determined from the experimental pion spectrum.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also calculate the fragmentation function for the transition from a charm quark to a kaon.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We compare with recent LHCb data and find a much larger effective coupling constant for the transition to a kaon compared to that for a charged pion.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We discuss the implication in this finding for the possible explanation of the surprising enhancement of the number of produced K+ over that of K- at the LHC.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Mechanistic home range analysis (MHRA) is a widely used method of estimating home range size.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The method has two steps: 1) space use is modeled as a function of candidate home range spatial variables, and 2) rapid numerical optimization is used to identify the home range that best fits the observed space use data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the first step, the method was most commonly applied to summary statistics of space use (i.e., point patterns), and a large and growing body of knowledge about space use patterns was used to inform candidate home range spatial variables.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Many of these variables are functions of home range size, and fast algorithms have been developed to test combinations of these spatial variables against the observed space use patterns.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Although these algorithms quickly screen many spatial variable combinations, all spatial variables were tested simultaneously and many spatial variable combinations never used.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A second step is a global search algorithm that uses the home range spatial variable screening results to rapidly identify the home range spatial variable combination that best fits the observed space use data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 MHRA is often used to estimate home range size for large sample sizes, but the slow home range spatial variable screening step can limit the method's usability.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In example, to estimate home range size for 10 individuals requires 45 model runs (assuming each model run uses a different combination of spatial variables).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 MHRA therefore requires large computing resources and extensive modeling time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here, we develop an analytic steady-state space use pattern model that can estimate the area utilized at steady state.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Steady-state space use is the area used when space use is continuously measured over a long time period.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Analytic steady-state space use pattern models are similar to mechanistic movement models, but the latter does not estimate space use.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Analytic models estimate the flux of particles around a central point (home range) while assuming spherical symmetry, and many such models have been developed for different spatial environments (e.g., closed versus open habitats).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We couple this model to a global search optimization algorithm to create an algorithm that rapidly estimates the home range area that best fits steady-state space use patterns.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The area estimated using steady-state space use is different than the area estimated using MHRA, but they are related and both indices of space use.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For small sample sizes, MHRA requires 45 model runs, but steady-state space use area can be estimated using a single model run.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The estimated steady-state space use area is more accurate than MHRA area, and it is computed in seconds rather than minutes or hours.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We demonstrate the utility for the steady-state space use area by comparing it to the area estimated using MHRA and by using it to reduce the number of model runs necessary to estimate home range size.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The astronomical community regularly holds discussions on proposals for new telescopes, and this cycle has now been going on for more than a decade without a new large optical telescope being funded.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This lack of new facilities is the result of a misguided approach to proposal evaluation that does not accurately represent the cost of new construction projects, may not fully account for the risk of cost overruns, and ultimately does not reflect the needs of the astronomical community.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We propose a different approach that better represents the costs of projects and places greater emphasis on the benefits of new facilities, including the opportunities for international collaboration and improved technical capabilities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We hope that the astronomical community will embrace this new and more appropriate process for future construction projects, and that established telescopes will be expanded to meet the growing needs of the astronomical community.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Since 2006, proposals for new telescopes have been submitted to the astronomy community for evaluation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These proposals cover a broad range of cost and technical specifications, and the Evaluation Board for New Telescopes (EBT) have evaluated each proposal based on an evaluation template that has remained essentially the same since 2005.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The evaluation process includes several key areas of consideration, including cost, technical design, and management.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The cost component is broken down into two main areas: 1) the cost of the initial capital outlay for the facility, and 2) ongoing operating expenses, including operations and maintenance, maintenance, and personnel costs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The technical evaluation focuses on the design and capability of the telescope, with the submission assessed on its ability to achieve its science goals.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The management evaluation looks at the management, including board and committee structures, and compliance with the Open Periodic Table (OPT) principles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The EBT has published evaluation templates for each of these areas, and each submission was evaluated based on the availability of relevant skills and facilities, the likelihood of cost and technical success, and other administrative considerations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Although there are some improvements to the evaluation process in the Proposal Revision 1.0 document, there are some aspects of the proposal evaluation that should be reconsidered to better represent the actual costs of new projects and account for risk.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 First, the cost evaluation does not adequately represent the cost of projects, as it does not include inflation adjustments, allow for useful contingency periods, or reflect changes in the purchase price of capital equipment over time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These errors can lead to an overall overestimation of costs, as projects often require additional time to perform system or equipment design reviews, detailed construction drawings, or other activities that drive up the cost.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, inflation may significantly impact project costs, and similar projects completed at different times will often have different costs due to the inclusion of updated prices and shipping delays.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Second, the evaluation did not adequately account for risk and cost overruns.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As a result, the proposal evaluation may not fully represent the true cost of building a telescope, which can be particularly relevant in the case of international projects, where local political or economic factors can lead to

 They are also associated with extended H-alpha emission and excess blue light.

 It is likely that the H-II regions have been recently ionised by a series of star clusters with typical ages of 1-3 Myr, too small to detect individually in current observations.

 The estimated contribution from this to the hot gas mass in the cluster is 20-30%.

 We present a comprehensive analysis of the first observational evidence for a candidate circumbinary planet (CBP) orbiting PP requires a comprehensive analysis of the Swift/XRT data: I. Deep decay segment.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Swift/XRT observed the Swift J164449.3-311543 for 170 days between 2015 February and 2016 August.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The light curve can be roughly divided into three segments: a shallow decay segment (SDS), a normal decay segment (NDS), and a sharp decay segment (SDS).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The SDS can be naturally interpreted as the early super Eddington light from the tidal disruption event (TDE) with a circumbinary planet (CBP).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We carefully study the properties in the SDS using both the simple one-zone reprocessing model and more complex multi-zone reprocessing model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the following physical processes are required to reproduce the observed behavior on the light curve: (1) the stellar debris absorbed energy from internal shock in the SDS; (2) the wind from the accretion disk heated the CBP; (3) the tidal disruption flare (TDF) from the CBP illuminated the CBP; (4) the interaction between the debris and the CBP, and between the debris and the disk contributed to the late-time light excess; (5) continuous energy injection from the central SMBH.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also compare the expected reflection signature from the CBP with the data and put constraints on the distance between the CBP and the black hole (BH).

 Here, we present a comprehensive analysis on the SDS using both the simple one-zone reprocessing model and more complex multi-zone reprocessing model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recent observations of the center of our Galaxy, Sagittarius A* (Sgr A*), have revealed that it was encircled by an enormous, quasi-periodic radio emission cloud known as the Sgr A West radio lobe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This cloud exhibits dramatic variations on multiple time scales, from weeks to millions of years, which are potentially related to the dynamic environment near Sgr A*.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Based on linear analyses, several recent studies have suggested that the lobe may be caused by disk instabilities in the vicinity of the black hole, rather than by supernova explosions or any other single event.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here, we present the results of three-dimensional general relativistic magnetohydrodynamical simulations of disk-generated turbulence and magnetic fields, which indicate that the dynamical environment around Sgr A* is likely a long-term stable and persistent phenomenon.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In our model, the low-frequency radio variations were caused by the fluctuations in the mass inflow rate from the circumnuclear disk to the supermassive black hole, with a periodicity of tens of thousands of years.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result is consistent with several independent lines of observational and theoretical evidence, and may resolve the long-standing problem of the dynamical origin of the Sgr A West radio lobe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The purpose of this work is to characterize the conformational preferences of specific side chains in model polymer systems using experimental methodology and a combination of molecular mechanics and NMR calculations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Aromatic side chains in particular provide a good example of this, since they are likely to adopt π-stacking associations in an organized mesoscale structure.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Such associations, formed via π-π stacking between ring systems, have become identified as critical for many physical properties of practical interest in polymer systems, including crystalline perfection, reactivity, and mechanical behavior.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Because of the strong hydrophobic nature of π-staking, these associations are generally only observed in non-crystalline, fluid-like polymer states, such as glassy or rubbery materials.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this study, we provide experimental methodology for the measurement of side chain rotameric populations in model polymer systems, using 1H NMR spectroscopy and a combination of molecular mechanics and empirical potential calculations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The aromatic side chains 4-fluoronitrobenzene and 4-chloronitrobenzene were examined as a model system, and particular emphasis is given to the quantification of side chain rotameric isomers in crystalline and glassy states.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition to characterizing the impact of side chain identity and conformation on macroscopic physical properties, these results provide useful reference data for the development and validation of more advanced physical modeling approaches for polymer systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For quantum field theories (QFTs), the local symmetry according to which particles have definite values of certain conserved quantum numbers, known as isotopic or conserved charge symmetries, restricts the form of local interactions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, isotopic spin, isotopic isospin and hypercharge symmetries each require different types of interactions between particles with different symmetries, and consequently QFTs with these symmetries are constrained to have different particle content.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, the low energy effective field theories (EFTs) of quantum gravity, denoted General Covariance (GC), is expected to are described by the general covariance (diffeomorphism) EFT (diffeomorphism EFT), in which all particles are coupled to the metric and gravity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, there are several known scenarios in which isotopic or other charge symmetries are spontaneously broken, resulting in a dimensional reduction (DR) whereby local symmetry implies a lower symmetry, resulting in a less constrained local interactions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Several classes of such scenarios are based on extended gravity, including Kaluza-Klein reduction (KKR), as well as minimal de Sitter and Projective Special relativity (dS/PSR) scenarios.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These all share a common feature that there exists a background field, namely a gauge field (a connection), whose field strength is nonzero and consequently a local symmetry is explicitly broken to a global one.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, the effects on the symmetry breaking are independent of the local symmetry transformation parameters, and so in particular the symmetry transformation parameter becomes a Goldstone boson.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This can be used to deduce universal features of DR schemes, independent of the explicit details of the symmetry breaking mechanism.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, it is expected that all spontaneously broken isotopic or other charge symmetries will result in a reduced local symmetry, with the local symmetry transformation parameter corresponding to a Goldstone boson.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, for the minimal de Sitter and Projective Special relativity scenarios, there is an exact symmetry between the local de Sitter (dS) and global Poincaré symmetries, resulting in an exact Goldstone boson equivalence.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Furthermore, under certain conditions, it was expected that the spontaneous breaking of isotopic or other charge symmetries results in the universality class of the Conformal, CPT and extended Conformal symmetries.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results imply universal features for DR schemes, independent of the explicit details of the symmetry breaking mechanism.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With this work, we present a spectroscopic and photometric survey of Jupiter Trojans, covering visible wavelengths.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use this unique dataset, acquired from the Spitzer Space Telescope, along with previously published datasets in the near-infrared, to provide a classification of the dynamical families of Jupiter Trojans.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This work extends our initial study of the H=22.5-23.0 km s^-1 and 31.5-33.5 km s^-1 size populations to the full Trojans size range, from H=30.0 km s^-1 to H=37.0 km s^-1.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These dynamical families are named after the major asteroidal orbits into which they are reminiscent: These include (primary) Apollo, (secondary) Hellenic,

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 (tertiary) Aten, (tertiary) Melita, (tertiary) Cassini or (tertiary) Reichhardt, and (secondary) Ake[nsen], Hestia and Opera.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also provide the largest size range classification for the Trojans to date, including 15 families (with 134 members) discovered via their proper orbital elements, and 33 families (with 442 members) discovered via their physical characteristics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Through numerical integrations, we show that many of these families are connected through mutual escaped asteroids, and we provide updated orbits for the entire population of escaped members.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With this dataset, we also assess the taxonomic properties of each family.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We further classify 27 families as S-types and 56 as C-types.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 S-types are consistent to the high albedo populations described in previous studies and likely include the H=30.0-34.0 km s^-1 families named after the major asteroid belt S-type asteroid groups.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 C-types are mostly incompatible with any known asteroid group and likely include families with darker (C-type) surfaces, not observed on Earth.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Based on our data and previous studies, we identify two overlapping populations of Trojans: the S-type and the H=30.0-34.0 km s^-1 family members.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The combined population of these two groups (83 members) is very dynamically similar to the H=30.0-34.0 km s^-1 families, and this may be evidence of a large, previously unidentified family that connects the two groups.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We provide improved orbital elements to these members, which we term the "H=30.0-34.0 km s^-1 plus family".

 Testing general metric theories about gravity with exploding neutron stars (ENTs) has the potential to decisively test gravity in the most extreme environments and to reveal new physics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As the first time, we performed a coordinated network of searches for ENTs in multiple nearby galaxies, identifying 10 potential events in 5 galaxies.

 These include 4 low-spin systems consistent in general relativity (GR), 4 high-spin systems inconsistent with GR, and 2 unmodeled systems.

 If interpreted within the Extended GR framework, this is the first stringent constraint on this class of models.

 Our results represent the most stringent limits to date for ζ using any astrophysical system, providing key tests of strong gravity and fundamental physics.

 In this paper, we study the Susceptible-Infected-Recovered (SIR) epidemic model on dynamic contact networks, in which nodes join and leave the network over time.

 We first introduce an epidemic model on general time-varying graphs, and characterize the final size of the epidemic.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In 2010, the radial velocity method is introduced to search for exoplanets by measuring the wobble of the host star caused by the planet’s gravity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to confirm that the detected wobble is indeed caused by the planet and not other causes such as noise, a confirmation method was developed by measuring the Doppler Shift of the emitted spectrum and thus detecting the motion of the planet around the central star.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The method worked so well that for the next two decades, thousands of exoplanets were confirmed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, in recent years a strange trend was noticed where the number of confirmed exoplanets was declining.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Although the reason for this decline is not clear, scientists have several theories including the possibility of false positives.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, I will explain false positives, why they are a problem, and present a new mathematical confirmation method that can reduce the number of false positives.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 I will also discuss how more observations is needed to confirm whether this decline in confirmed exoplanets is real or not.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The widely accepted and broadly used method to clean a dirty floor is a gravity method.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It starts with piling up the dirty stuff in the middle of the floor and letting it flow to the edges.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The obvious problem here is that this may not completely clean the floor and as more and more dirty stuff accumulates in the middle, the floor may become dirtier.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This article develops an alternative method which is to start by spraying some cleaner around the floor and let it spread around by gravitational force.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This article then develops a probabilistic framework to analyze this method.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 First, it derives a probabilistic model for the amount of dirty stuff on the floor and uses it to calculate the probability that this method completely cleans the floor.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Then it uses this result to answer the more important question of how much dirty stuff the method can clean up.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This analysis reveals that for a moderately dirty floor, this method will completely clean the floor with a high probability, but the amount of dirty stuff it can clean up is only about 50% of the actual amount.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The article then uses this result to propose a more efficient method which starts with twice as much cleaner and instead of spreading it around the floor, directs it to the areas with higher dirt density.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This method will completely clean the floor and also clean up almost all the dirty stuff.

 Modern nanotechnology enables precise fabrication of various kinds of nanometer-scale structures, which have been employed to investigate the interactions of electromagnetic waves with subwavelength structures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With this paper, we investigate the interactions of electromagnetic waves with metallic and semiconducting nanospheres.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By employing both exact and semiclassical descriptions, we demonstrate that both metallic and semiconducting spheres can support both Surface Plasmon Polariton (SPP) and Surface Phonon Polariton (SPhP) resonances, which are separate phenomena.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 SPP resonances require both bulk and surface modifications and are less sensitive to the geometrical size and shape of the particles, while SPhP resonances require only bulk modifications and are more sensitive to those variations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We further demonstrate that the SPhP resonances in semiconducting spheres can have much larger q (wave vector) values than the light in air and therefore have much longer radiative lifetimes.

 A collective state of the odd-mass nuclei was described in the framework of the Interacting Vector Boson Model (IVBM).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the frame work of this model the nucleus was viewed as a condensate of interacting vector bosons.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The boson fields were associated with their individual quasi-particle states.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Interactions between quasi-particles are described by means of the Brueckner reaction matrix.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The model accounts of the ground state band structure and first excitation bands in many even-even as well as in odd-mass nuclei with high accuracy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The interaction with the vector bosons gives rise to the monopole and dipole phonon modes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These phonon modes generate the systematic patterns of the even-even and odd-mass nuclei spectra.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For particular, the high-K electric transition operator excites the vibrational (phonon) states in the even-even nuclei and the wobbling vibration (phonon) states in the odd-mass nuclei.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The wobbling mode in the odd-mass nuclei has been recently observed and discussed in several experimental papers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The theoretical description of the wobbling mode within the IVBM remains an open problem.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From this work we report the theoretical analysis of the wobbling mode based on the IVBM approach and predict the excitation energy and the transition probability for the first excited state of several odd-mass nuclei in the vicinity of the closed shell N

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The calculated excitation energies were compared with the corresponding experimental data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The article contains also a short discussion of the monopole and dipole phonon modes.

 Mass and temperature of the TWA 7 debris disk was measured using Herschel and Spitzer observations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This disk is unusual in that it exhibits at least four clear breaks in its spectral energy distribution (SED), which are suggestive of four spatial regions with distinct temperatures.

 The inner two breaks at radii of 19 and 47 AU can been explained by an irradiation dominated belt and a transitional Kuiper belt, while the outer two breaks at radii of 180 and 500 AU are likely due to the depletion of solids beyond the frostline location at 100-150 AU.

 The temperature in the middle break region was best explained by a compositional gradient in the residual dust grain population, with a temperature of 50 K at 47 AU increasing to 200 K at 180 AU.

 This indicates the presence in a relatively warm region at intermediate disk radii.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The detection of these distinct regions with different temperatures is only possible with Herschel and Spitzer observations, as previous far-IR observations with the Infrared Astronomical Satellite has compromised the ability to discern the multi-temperature nature of the disk.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The dust is most likely optically thin, close to Keplerian, and its presence is maintained by the continual removal of small grains by photo-evaporation.

 The existence of massive neutrinos is one of the most important discoveries in modern astrophysics and particle physics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Of the three known species of neutrinos, the neutral current interactions of electron neutrinos provide a unique tool to study the interior of galaxies and clusters of galaxies, because electron neutrinos scatter off electrons in the nuclei of nuclei, virtually without interacting with the electrons themselves.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This forward scattering process can be observed through the Doppler-shifted weak emission of electron neutrinos, which results in a spectrum that is exponentially suppressed at low energies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The measured intensity of this so-called core-collapse neutrino burst, first detected by the SNO detector in 1998, can been explained only by postulating the existence of nearly massless neutral Majorana neutrinos, which was invented by Ettore Majorana in 1937 and for which evidence was first found forty years later by the KATRIN experiment.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In 2006, the first direct experimental evidence for theneutrino's Majorana character is obtained in the scientific journal 'Nature' by the Super-Kamiokande detector, when the observation of a tiny but finite probability for the neutrino to be its own antiparticle is reported.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Despite its importance, the nature of dark matter is one of the biggest unsolved problems in cosmology and particle physics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The favored model for dark matter, weakly interacting massive particles (WIMPS), can interact via the weak force and therefore is expected to produce the observed signal in conventional neutrino telescopes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, recent observations of galaxy clusters with satellites such as Planck or the Dark Energy Survey have reduced the maximum possible cross-section of WIMPS to within an order of magnitude of the weak force coupling constant.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Since this is orders of magnitude smaller than the neutrino scattering cross-section, this possibility for dark matter has been excluded.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Neutrino oscillations can easily accommodate the measured solar and atmospheric neutrino anomalies, and thus neutrinos offer an attractive alternative to dark matter.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Because the neutrino is a Majorana particle, the gravitational potential of a cluster of galaxies can capture a finite amount of electron neutrinos, thereby solving the dark matter problem.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The process may be analogous to how a lightbulb shines light when electrical current flows through it: The cluster of galaxies acts as a giant lightbulb, and the neutrino beam produces the observed 511-keV radiation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Given the lack of evidence for non-baryonic dark matter and its weak interaction cross-section, we suggest that the observed neutrino burst is actually produced by electron neutrinos scattered off dark matter particles, which might account for approximately 30% of the total dark matter density of the universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We provide an example of how the existence of this weakly interacting massive particle dark matter could be established or disproved by measuring the spectrum of the neutrino burst from a future core-collapse supernova in our galaxy.

 The complexity of many real-world networks has been shown to be well captured by graphs possessing a random layout.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Such random graphs are commonly generated using one of two paradigms: the configuration model, which assumes a uniform probability distribution for all edge establishment, and the community model, which allows for the generation of arbitrary networks with pre-specified properties.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, different real-world networks can exhibit very different distributions of topological characteristics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, it is of interest to consider how the distributions of these characteristics may vary across different random graph models.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we focus upon two such characteristics, the size of the largest planar matching and the largest planar subgraph, both of which have well-understood algorithmic techniques that allow for their exact determination for arbitrary random graphs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By employing a variety of random graph models, we find that the size of the largest planar matching exhibits a power-law distribution for every model considered, while the largest planar subgraph exhibits a power-law distribution in some models and exhibits a different, more exponential-like, distribution in others.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Notably, we find that the power-law exponents for the size of the largest planar matching and the largest planar subgraph is closely correlated with the exponent associated with the degree distribution of the graph.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This suggests that the tail behavior of the distribution of these characteristics are most strongly influenced by the presence or absence of a wide variety of high-degree vertices within the random graph model.

 Nova Geminorum 1912 was the first observed gravitational lens, making it the first known example for strong gravitational lensing.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Many scientists and science-fiction writers have postulated that strong gravitational lenses could be used for technological interference and military purposes, leading to the development of observational programs to find strong gravitational lenses and study their implications.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With this paper, we examine the scientific and cultural significance of Nova Geminorum 1912 and the development of the field of gravitational lensing.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We begin with providing a brief overview of gravitational lensing, including a discussion of critical curves and caustics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Next, we describe how strong gravitational lensing is observed for the first time, and how the observation of Nova Geminorum 1912 led to the discovery and study of gravitational lensing as a distinct phenomenon.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also examine how the observational discovery of Nova Geminorum 1912 led to the development of super-gravity and the wider science fiction genre's interest in strong gravitational lensing as a weapon.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss how subsequent observations of gravitational lenses have led to new understandings of the phenomenon, including the first observations of gravitational waves and the determination of Hubble's constant.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The “missing satellites problem” refers to the observation that, while there are more than 20 billion galaxies in the observable universe, only a small fraction (~105) of these are actively engaged in star formation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Astronomers expect that galaxy clusters, groups, and clusters in galaxies, often referred to as groups and clusters of galaxies, will exist given the abundance of dark matter in the universe, but instead only a small fraction of groups and clusters show signs of galaxy activity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It has been suggested that insufficiently dense environments are preventing galaxies from forming and rendering the missing satellites problem.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We examine this claim by measuring the galaxy stellar masses in groups selected from the SDSS and GMASS clusters surveys.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that while the stellar mass distributions of central and satellite galaxies in these groups are statistically equivalent, the stellar mass distributions of centrals and satellites in pairs are statistically different with a p-value < 10-5.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We conclude that galaxy groups do in fact exist in the universe, and that dynamical friction is not sufficiently effective in sufficiently dense environments at transforming galaxies from a star-forming to a non-star forming state.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the standard model (SM) with its minimal particle content, the electroweak chiral Lagrangian (EWCLL) is the appropriate low-energy effective field theory (LEFT) to describe the strong interactions of the weak bosons.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 During construction, the precision tests of the EWCLL allow to put strong constraints on new physics (NP) scenarios.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here, we use the latest precision measurements of the LHC and electroweak observables to put strong constraints on a generic Higgs-portal type model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the model becomes strongly constrained for a large range of the model parameter space.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, the model predicts charged scalar boson with a mass below 530 GeV at the 95% CL, and the invisible decay width of the Z boson is expected to be larger than 0.2 MeV at the 95% CL.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These bounds could be further improved by using the current and future precise data of the electroweak observables.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present observations on the nearby blazar PKS 2155-304 performed between May 2005 and July 2005 in the near-infrared (NIR) and optical bands.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 NIR data was obtained with the 10.4m GEMINI South Telescope, while optical data were obtained with the Nordic Optical Telescope and the William Herschel Telescope.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also present contemporaneous data for other bands (X-rays, MeV, GeV) from the Whipple, HEGRA, and CATobservatories.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Based on our observations, we suggest that in the optical band PKS 2155-304 was in a high state in early 2005, possibly reaching a flux density of 400 mJy at m_R in April 2005.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The NIR flux density was relatively stable during this period, with no strong variations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 On May 20-25 2005 we detected a sharp rise in both the optical and NIR flux, reaching a peak in June 2005.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The optical spectral index rapidly hardened over this period, possibly reaching a value of α=3.2.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We hypothesize that this sudden brightening in PKS 2155-304 was caused by a rapid enhancement in the external radiation field density (as a result of the eruptinging Galaxy M33) shining through the relativistic jet of PKS 2155-304.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also observe a fast decrease in the X-ray, MeV, and GeV flux densities in the period May-July 2005.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We suggest that this decrease is caused by the jet entering a new region with a weaker magnetic field, perhaps due to the increased transparency of the jet caused by the enhanced external radiation field density.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In a previous paper1, we described the scaling relations between the properties of galaxies and their central supermassive black holes (SMBHs), that have been found to hold at redshifts up to z=0.89.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here, we present a similar analysis of the local (z=0.36) population, and show that these scaling relations are still very much in force there as well.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Specifically, the SMBH masses and the bulge parameters (e.g. velocity dispersion and luminosity) are found to correlate with the properties of the host galaxies, with an offset of roughly 0.75 dex between the SMBH and bulge masses.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, the active black holes were found to be hosted in almost exclusively by early-type galaxies, as opposed to the situation at higher redshifts.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This would have significant consequences for the growth and evolution of supermassive black holes in the Universe.

 The Monitor project is an M-type eclipsing binary system located within the ONC region, the nearest star cluster to the Earth.

 The Monitor system's catalog identification numbers are N01 and N02 in the Onsala Astronomical Observatory (GAO) Star Catalog.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper we prove a general version of the Kalman--Yakubovich--Popov (KYP) inequality for discrete-time passive systems described by linear difference equations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We provide a simple and unified approach of the classical KYP inequality, including results for discrete-time LTI systems, discrete-time linear time-varying (LTV) systems, and continuous-time LTV systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also extend the KYP inequality in the case of partial measurements.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we show that the classical KYP inequality for LTI systems with input constraints is a consequence of our more general result.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The classical KYP inequality, valid for LTI systems, states that the difference between the observability and controllability Gramian matrices is a semi-positive definite quadratic form with respect to the input matrix.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result has been extended to LTI systems with input constraints (i.e., with zero inputs) by various authors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In contrast, here we provide a simple and unified treatment for discrete-time passive systems described by linear difference equations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 More specifically, we show that the observability, controllability and total-squared-root-norm matrices of the discrete-time passive system have symmetric positive semidefinite quadratic forms with respect to the input matrix.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As a consequence, we obtain a general version of the KYP inequality for discrete-time passive systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We provide a simple approach to the classical KYP inequality based on a formula for the input-output map of a discrete-time passive system in terms of its transition matrix.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By this way we obtain a new proof of this result for discrete-time LTI systems, discrete-time LTV systems and continuous-time LTV systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For an example, we also prove the classical KYP inequality for LTI systems with input constraints.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we apply our results to design an observer for a linear time-invariant system with bounded gain, based on the discrete-time output error, and to establish a discrete-time analogue of the Continuous-time LQR Theorem for discrete-time passive systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The superconducting state in doped copper oxides is often separated into two categories, high-temperature superconductivity (above ~100 K) and low temperature superconductivity (T_c<10 K).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The former emerges from poorly understood fermiology, but the origin of the latter has been more clearly established as strong electron-electron interactions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Superconductivity in the underdoped regime of copper oxides is an exception, where strong antiferromagnetic fluctuations have been suggested to suppress the formation of the fermiology needed for superconductivity, leading to a competing state of asob phases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we report inelastic neutron scattering measurements of magnetic fluctuations in n-type Ca(Fe(1-x)Co_x)_2As_2, an isoelectronically substituted superconductor with T_c of 10 K that has become suggested to exhibit fermiology-driven superconductivity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the doping evolution of the low-energy resonance peak reflects that of the superconductivity, rather than that of the antiferromagnetism.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results suggest a competition between fermiology-driven superconductivity and asob phases being preempted by a competing state of incommensurate magnetic fluctuations, and raise the possibility that asob phases is the competing state of copper oxides above the pseudogap temperature T^*.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Ceto/Phorcys: A tidally-evolved binary Centaur is a target of interest for the next OSIRIS-REx mission, which was designed to gather samples for analysis on Earth.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Ceto/Phorcys has a size of 16.2 km x 19.1 km and an albedo of ~0.5.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If its density is comparable to that of water (nine kilograms per cubic meter), then Ceto/Phorcys has a radius of approximately 12 km.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Given these dimensions and the currently-known orbital parameters, it could make several close approaches to Earth in the next few centuries, including a nominal approach with a distance of <0.15 AU in the year 2195.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Masses, composition, and other physical characteristics will are discussed for Ceto and Phorcys, as well as their binary nature and evolution.

 Quantum spin liquid (QSL) states have been the subject of active research in recent years due to their possible relationship to the high-temperature superconductivity and chiral central spin model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Without intensive studies, however, QSL states remain elusive in many materials.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we report a deuterated inorganic kagome lattice material, Zn0.9Cu0.14-OD6Cl2, which exhibits zero magnetic entropy at low temperatures without long-range order, and instead, exhibits fractionalized excitations and a novel QSL state.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results provide clear evidence for QSL states in two-dimensional quantum magnets and open the way to studies of their fundamental physics and potential applications.

 An Infrared Cloud Monitor is developed for the Haleakalaan robotic telescope at the Observatorio del Teide on Tenerife, Spain.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The instrument is designed to image the thermal emission from thin clouds in the atmosphere in the wavelength region between 3.8 μm and 14 μm.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This paper describes the design, development and initial tests of the ICM.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Observations with the ICM of infrared emission from thin cirrus clouds are presented.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The observed clouds had linear dimensions of 1 km and 10 km with a median size of 3.3 km.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They were located at altitudes between 2.2 km and 7.2 km.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Infrared Cloud Monitor is designed, developed and tested over a period of 18 months.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The system was composed of several subsystems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main control and data acquisition system is developed with the VICON motion analysis system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The instrument package for imaging the thermal emission from thin clouds was mounted on a three-axis stage allowing it to be pointed at the cloud of interest.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The ICM obtains data through a series of exposures with an uncooled MCT-LPS sensor and focal plane assembly in order to map the cloud in the desired spectral region.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Each exposure is 10 s long and the data is aquired at a rate of 10 Hz.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The ICM images were constructed from the time series of images and a median filter is applied to remove high frequency noise from the data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A survey of molecular gas in and around the supergiant HII region NGC 604 has been carried out using the James Clerk Maxwell Telescope (JCMT).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The JCMT is an innovative facilities instrument, operating with a dedicated mission in the submillimetre wavelength range.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This allows the study for cold gas, an important phase of the ISM, in extreme environments such as those present in the NGC 604 region.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Two areas of distinct complexity were are observed: the ring-like structure, often called the bow shock, associated with the fast moving cluster of young stars central cluster; and a broader arc-like distribution of high CO(J=3-2)/CO(J=1-0) ratio gas surrounding the central star cluster.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The arc is highly unusual for its small size (a few parsecs) and extremely high brightness temperature (Tb ~ 105 K).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The most plausible explanations of this extreme emission are extremely high densities (n(H) ~ 1023 cm-3) and extremely low temperatures (T < 10K), either due to high volume densities and low volume temperatures (i.e. very high energy densities), or far-ultraviolet radiation from the central cluster.

 The isolated spiral galaxies in the sample are fairly similar to the Magellanic Clouds in the optical appearance.

 They are nearly round with slightly flocculent, ocher-colored spiral arms.

 The flocculent appearance is similar to that of the M33 galaxy, but the isolated spirals are slightly larger.

 Elliptical isophotes are rare.

 Thus these galaxies are probably satellites to the Milky Way.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The similarity between the two galaxies in characteristics also suggest a close physical relationship.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Thus their original shapes would have been more nearly circular than those seen today.

 The effect of tidal forces from the Milky Way is probably to had flattened the original shapes and formed the flocculent appearance.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These galaxies have not been completely dissolved by the Milky Way's gravitational field.

 These large masses indicate that the galaxies are in a fairly late stage of evolution.

 Some of the galaxies will be new systems in the process of formation.

 The infraredASAS survey found no evidence for an active nucleus in any of the isolated spiral galaxies.

 Using the Atacama Large Millimeter/submillimeter Array (ALMA), we have carried out a thorough search for highly-excited molecular lines in the vicinity of the Seyfert 2 nucleus in the nearby galaxy M51 (NGC 5194).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 No evidence of an active galactic nucleus (AGN) is found in the distribution or kinematics of the observed species.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Instead, the spatial distribution, excitation mechanism, and kinematics of the molecular gas are all consistent with a scenario in which the molecular gas is impacted by a radio jet emanating from the active nucleus in the galaxy NGC 5195.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The molecular gas was distributed in two spatially distinct clouds that are offset from the radio source by ~15-20 pc, exhibit similar velocities, and have slightly different physical properties.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results lend further credence to the hypothesis that radio jets are effective at transporting interstellar matter from their host galaxies to distances of several tens of parsecs from the nucleus.

 Co-doped TiO2 films with various Co doping levels were synthesized by sol-gel process and investigated by structural, transport and magnetic measurements as a function of O2 partial pressure during deposition.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The crystalline phase of the films were verified by X-ray diffraction and revealed anatase for all samples.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A transport study revealed that incorporation of Co in TiO2 matrix enhances the charge transport characteristic of the films.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Magnetic measurement revealed superparamagnetic behavior at samples with low doping levels and ferromagnetic ordering at higher doping levels.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results were discussed in the light of the activation energy calculation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Reducing the O2 partial pressure from high to low level during deposition leads to an increase of the activation energy which can be correlated to the change of magnetic behavior from superparamagnetic to ferromagnetic ordering.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 * Cobalt doped TiO2 thin films with various Co doping levels were deposited by sol-gel process under various O2 partial pressures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Structural, transport and magnetic measurements as a function of O2 partial pressure revealed that the formation of Co1-xToxOy solid solution was governed by the Co concentration as well as the O2 partial pressure.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As Co doping level increases, the ferromagnetic ordering becomes observed for the films prepared under low O2 partial pressure.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 An increase of O2 partial pressure leads to an increase of activation energy and the change of magnetic behavior from superparamagnetic to ferromagnetic ordering can be correlated to the change of activation energy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The cosmological constant, also known as the vacuum energy, represents the contribution to the density of energy of the universe from the zero-point energies of the quantum fields, and has been assumed to be positive since the discovery that the universe is flat.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, we show that it can in fact be positive or negative, in contrast to the assumptions of many theories of cosmology and particle physics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If the cosmological constant is positive, then many possible theories that give a natural explanation for its small positive value were excluded.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If the cosmological constant is negative, then some of these theories were reinstated.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These conclusions were reached by using a combination of observational constraints, combined with detailed theoretical calculations in specific models.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We demonstrate that within the standard model of particle physics, the QCD sum rule gives a naturally small and positive value for the cosmological constant.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This reinvestigation into the cosmological constant has implications for the anthropic solution to the problems of the initial conditions of the universe, and for the nature of dark energy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Within this paper, we present a methodology and accompanying system for evaluating user experience in an immersive virtual environment (IVE).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Specifically, we describe the development of a survey, termed the IVE Experience Questionnaire (IVEEQ), and the construction of a set of form-based questions designed to capture specific experiences found to be important by our usability testing.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our system then analyzes user responses to the IVEEQ, along with gathered metadata, to produce numerical scores and qualitative descriptions of the surveyed experience.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To illustrate the utility in this approach, we present the results of our evaluation of forms in an IVE, demonstrating the ability of the IVEEQ to identify form type as a factor influencing user experience.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss future research directions inspired by this work, including extending our evaluation to other aspects of the user experience and applying this approach to different form types."

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Turbulence is one of the most ubiquitous and important phenomena of the universe, present in a large range of different contexts, from water flows in canals, to the movements of gases in the atmosphere, to the rearrangement of stars in a galaxy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Turbulence is caused by molecular or particulate collisions that occur at random, leading to an incoherent distribution of motion.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The theory of turbulence was developed in the 1920s by Norwegian engineerKároly (Karsten) Gustaf Arctander, who founded a university now named after him - the Károlyi University of footballers in Hungary, and a library - the Károlyi Public Library of footballers in Hungary.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the early turbulence theory, mathematical descriptions are used to characterise the properties of turbulence, and basic concepts such as integration, differentiation and different types of differential equations were applied.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The development of experimental techniques to evaluate the properties of turbulence and theoretical developments was combined in the 1930s to create a modern theory of turbulence.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Important results in the modern theory of turbulence were published by American mathematician Robert H. Luther in 1941 and Norwegian-American mathematician Bryce L. Dysthe in 1958.

 The CNGS neutrino beam produced by the Centro Nazionale Granulosatire (CNGS) laboratory in Italy was dedicated to the NOvA and GNO experiments.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The detector installed at the LNGS, in the true neutrino mass scheme, consists of a 150 kilotonnes active detector target, made of a wide cylindrical tank containing 250 tons of liquid argon, inside a 2.67 kilotonnes rock overburden.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The collaboration MODULAr, composed of researchers from Italy, United States, and Slovenia, proposes to build a new, very massive Liquid Argon Imaging Chamber, with the main goal to search for very low energy neutrinos, in a region not explored before by the CNGS beam.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The detector will consist of a 2 level chamber with an internal diameter of 4 meters, and a height of 3 meters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The inner volume will be divided into 18 Verticale slices (VLSI), each hosting 30.48 Kg of liquid argon.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The expected sensitivity is for a region of interest between 1 and 10 eV, where the expected number of signal events depends on the adopted simulated neutrino fluxes, and on the position of the detector in the phase volume.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The unprecedented very massive and compact design of the detector, together to its high sensitivity to very low energy neutrino interactions, make it an ideal candidate to search for spectral distortions, therefore exploring new physics phenomena in the neutrino sector.

 Astronomy is a powerful tool for determining fundamental parameters of stars, and in particular their temperatures, masses and ages.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent years, considerable advances have be made in the spectral domain, with the implementation of new theory and the development of efficient data analysis techniques.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 I describe a method to derive these parameters from high-resolution optical spectra, using current evolutionary tracks and the strengths of certain atomic and molecular lines.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To demonstrate its effectiveness, I present an application of the open cluster IC 4651 and field stars of similar spectral type.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The required observational data were provided, including high-resolution optical spectra and relevant atmospheric parameters, from the literature and my own observations at the Haute-Provence Observatory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main limitation of this approach is the requirement of high-resolution optical spectra, which are not always available for large samples of stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Nevertheless, this methodology can be applied to a wide range of applications, and I present a first application to open clusters and field stars, which can help us understand the properties of these populations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, these results demonstrate that intermediate-resolution spectrographs on large telescopes (such as MuSiC; Probeca) provide high data return and low cost, making them good candidates for surveys of large samples of stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Extreme High Energy (EHE) peaked BL Lacs (HBLs), knowns as the Third Frequency, are largely unobservable at optical wavelengths due to their high Doppler-shifted equivalent widths.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we report on optical spectroscopy of 32 EHE HBLs performed with the Neil Gehrels Swift Observatory (NGSOM) spectrograph.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This is the largest homogeneous sample of EHE HBLs with optical spectroscopy to date.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We observe compelling connections among EHE HBLs and low Doppler-shifted optical magnitudes in a complex web of correlations among equivalent width, full width at half-maximum, continuum spectral slope, redshift, and synchrotron peak frequency.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Higher equivalent widths, higher full width at half-maximum, steeper spectral slopes, and higher redshifts were all associated with the presence of low Doppler-shifted optical components.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Conversely, lower equivalent widths, lower full width at half-maximum, flatter spectral slopes, and lower redshifts were associated with the absence of optical components at or near the host galaxy systemic redshift.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We measure the highest equivalent widths and full widths at half-maximum yet observed in the optical band from EHE HBLs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results of this work have profound implications for EHE HBL central engines, trigger models, and EBL re-processing.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Quark-Gluon Plasma (QGP), the state of matter conjectured by particle physicists several decades ago, is the densest form of matter known to humans.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It exhibits many remarkable properties, like color charge and net-baryon number fluctuations, that can in principle be measured in the LHC.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 While most of the properties of the QGP are confirmed in the LHC Run 1, the observation of the novel phenomenon of photon emission from the QGP, reported by the ALICE collaboration, remains a great mystery.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work, using the kinetic theory of heat and angular momentum transfer, we show that the QGP can emit virtual photons with an intensity that depends only on the temperature and the properties of the plasma, obviating the need for a dynamical calculation within the standard model of particle physics.

 In order to explore this mechanism, we make use of the uniqueness and robustness of the QGP thermodynamics to perform predictions for photon emission from strongly coupled plasma, which we confront against available data from lattice QCD.
