 Dew Point Depression Observations A 630-meter sloping path across the western United States was instrumented to measure the downwind saturation at a number of representative hillslope positions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Hill slope saturation differences correlated linearly with the measured dew point depression, with a strong negative slope indicating that as saturation decreased, dew point depression increased.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The plot of dew point depression vs. hill slope saturation difference is shown as an example of a continuous piecewise linear relationship with two linear regions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The two regions have significantly different slopes, with the upper saturation difference region having a negative slope similar to the lower region.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The estimated dew point depression at saturation difference of zero (i.e., at an isothermal line) was around -75.6° C.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The warm wet storage product with temperature around -75°

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 C can be generated by quickly increasing the saturation difference from near zero to around 0.5.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The estimated saturation difference between -75.6° C dew point depression was around 0.5.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recently, a mysterious parallel sorting algorithm known as dualheap selection has been discovered and demonstrated to be faster than Quicksort on both real and simulated computer systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Dualheap selection works by swapping selected items into a well-balanced dualheaps, which apparently facilitates the sort.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Dualheaps are internally heap structures of which the least-recently-swapped element is at the top.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The mechanics of the sort are rather deep and mysterious, and the parallelism seems to arise from the interaction between dualheaps and cachelines.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The algorithm seems to work well on modern multicore architectures, but it is not obvious how it should get adapted to work on shared-memory systems such as GPUs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Interestingly, dualheap selection was related to a stack-based sorting algorithm known as quick stack.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The two algorithms share a number of similarities in their implementation and motivation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In fact, dualheap selection is faster than quick sort on some random distributions, suggesting that the unusual algorithm is more than just a trick.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Dualheap selection and the quick stack were discovered independently around 2008 by separate computer scientists pursuing apparently unrelated research interests.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 There has been some speculation that dualheap selection may be a complex building block in some kind of a data structures continuum, similar to heaps, tries and chmaps.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Dualheap selection has so far resisted all attempts at rigorous analysis, although it appears to have useful approximation properties and can be made stable with some tuning.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 No serious algorithm has been devised yet based on dualheap selection, although certain theoretical improvements and empirical successes have been demonstrated.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Despite its success on real computer systems, dualheap selection has not been proven to be correct.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, it is not known whether the theory has all the right properties or whether there are exotic inputs that lead to incorrect behaviour.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This article provides an overview of dualheap selection, with an eye toward explaining how and why it works.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also discuss some recent developments in understanding the algorithm and ways in which it might be adapted to work on different computer systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, we consider reflecting Brownian motions in domains with smooth boundary.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By a general criterion for continuous martingales, such a process is a semimartingale and its quadratic variation are given by a continuous local martingale reflecting its boundaries.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For some situations, this boundary is only measurable.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Under some additional conditions, we prove an invariance principle for such semimartingale reflecting Brownian motions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result extends previous known ones for domains with smooth boundaries or with uniformly continuous boundaries.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For particular, it applies to Markovian semimartingale reflecting Brownian motions in domains with piecewise smooth boundaries.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result is interesting on its own right and has potential applications in stochastic geometry and trap models in finance.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We plan to study these applications in a separate paper.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This work is initiated when the author was a postdoc at Vanderbilt University.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 He should like to thank his former mentor, Professor Bálint Tóth, for his encouragement.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 He should also like to thank Professor Mihaela Tătar for pointing out an error in an earlier version of the paper and for helpful discussions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A peculiar structure was identified in the galaxy NGC 1275 (CENTAURUS A): a “hole” with an estimated mass of approximately 1042±409 solar masses, located some 55 million light-years from Earth and about 18,000 light-years in diameter.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This object has become called an “Egg” by some, and a “Hen” by others, and still others have regarded it as an intriguing phenomenon in its own right, devoid of taxonomic classification.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To date, no evident cause for the creation of this “ Hole within a galaxy ” has was identified.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We argue that this structure is most likely the result of the recent violent merging of two galaxies, whose nuclei have fallen inside each other’s gravitational sphere of influence, forming a core-filled nucleus that resembles an Egg.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A galaxy merger can also account for the the steeper than expected velocity dispersion of the stars in the core of the Egg, compared to that of the stars in the surrounding region, as predicted by numerical simulations of this kind of events.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This and the Egg’s small projected mass make it very likely as it has already fallen completely through its merging progenitors, and will continue to do so in the future.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this sense, we consider the Egg to be a transient structure, of a similar nature to Galactic Hotspots, whose name it loosely resembles, though their origins are clearly unrelated.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Perturbation theory is one of the most important techniques in physics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It provides a framework to describe the low energy dynamics in a system using the interactions between its various components or scales.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Examples for such interactions include Coulomb force between electrons in atoms, or the gravity between planets.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In quantum mechanics, the basic theory of almost all particles, perturbation theory is applied to motion of electrons in atoms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 When these interactions are weak, perturbation theory provides a good approximation of the dynamics of the system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Before its success, perturbation theory only considers the first order changes in variables as a function of another variable.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if I sit in a chair and ask you how I is related to the height of the chair, you would only need to consider my height and the height of the floor to accurately answer how I was related to the height of the chair.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 You would not need to consider my weight, or the weight of the Earth, as these were said to be higher order corrections.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Parametric Perturbation Theory (PT) allows us to consider higher order changes in variables when calculating the response of a system to changes in another variable.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, I would sit on a chair and calculate how my weight relates to the height of the chair, as well as the changes in height of the floor and the weight of the Earth.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this way, PT extends the limits of how we can consider changes in variables, or corrections, in systems and their dynamics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Flavor Changing Neutral Currents (FCNC) interactions were forbidden at tree level in the standard model (SM).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, due to higher order corrections these processes are possible at loop level.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first such process, flavor changing neutral current (FCNC) mediated by a W boson, is observed at the CERN Large Electron-Positron collider (LEP) in 1995.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 On this note, we investigate the flavor changing current in the framework of a supersymmetric standard model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We demonstrate that the forward-backward asymmetry in the decays of the B mesons to X s and c quarks, with X denoting a charged lepton or a neutrino, is particularly sensitive to the effects of the flavor changing current.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using this asymmetry, we derive constraints on the flavor changing current coupling, which can be translated into constraints on SUSY parameters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We further show that combining these constraints with measurements of CP violation in B meson mixing, in addition to allowing for a more precise determination of the SUSY parameters, can yield crucial information on the structure of the flavor changing current and hence help us understand the mechanism of flavor violation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we propose to use the Belle II experiment at the superKEKB to improve the experimental constraints on top FCNC interactions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper we study algebraically closed real geodesics on n-dimensional ellipsoids.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We prove that algebraically closed real geodesic loops on ellipsoids are dense in the space of all free loops provided the algebraically closed field is sufficiently large and the loop is sufficiently non-constant.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also study relations of algebraically closed real geodesics on ellipsoids to hyperelliptic tangential coverings of the projective plane and to real Jacobi varieties.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The presented results have many applications, in particular in the theory of integrable systems, Klein geometry and mirror symmetry.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In example, we show that algebraically closed real geodesic loops on ellipsoids correspond to multiple covers of the projective plane with branch loci being real curves of minimal genus.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The paper is organized as follows.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For Section 1 we give some necessary definitions and present some preliminary facts.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For Section 2 we study algebraically closed real geodesics on ellipsoids.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 During Section 3 we discuss relations between algebraically closed real geodesics on ellipsoids and tangential coverings of the projective plane.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In Section 4 we present consequences of our study for real Jacobi varieties.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Solid methane (CH4), also known as coalbed methane, is a form of natural gas that exists in underground layers within decommissioned coal mines.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Methane gas was rarely found in its natural state.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It usually occurs as single molecules or small clusters called clathrates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Solid methane occurs in two solid phases, the alpha (IV) and beta (IV) phases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The alpha phase, which is more stable at atmospheric pressure, is stable below 77K and at greater depths, while the beta phase is stable above 150K and at shallower depths.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Since solid methane occurs in two solid phases with different structures, it presents an opportunity to investigate the relationship between crystal structure and dynamics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Neutron scattering can be used to investigate the crystal structure via the structure factor.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The dynamic structure factor contains information about the intramolecular dynamics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have developed a quantum molecular dynamics model for the dynamics of solid methane that includes key physics necessary for accurate modeling of the dynamic structure factor.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We validate the model through calculating the dynamic structure factor of the alpha phase of solid methane and comparing it to previous inelastic neutron scattering (INS) measurements.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our model could be used to further investigate the relationship between crystal structure and dynamics, and predict how dynamics vary between solid methane phases and how they vary with changing pressure or temperature.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using computer simulations, we investigate the structure of toroidal magnetic fields in neutron stars with type II superconductor cores.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that, for a wide range of physically plausible parameters, these fields exist as stable configurations, rather than being plagued by magnetic instability.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also find that such fields modify the structure of neutron stars, and have impacts on their cooling behavior.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results provide new insights into the nature of some magnetars, as well as offering new mechanisms for radio emission from these objects.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Neutron stars are amongst the most exotic objects in the universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They are leftover objects from the death of massive stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They are as heavy on the moon but much more dense, being averages of several kilometers of matter packed into a volume of a few kilometers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Their interior, the so-called "nuclear sphere," is rich in neutrons, almost half of the volume is comprised of neutrons held together with the strong force.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This neutron matter is the most dense matter in the universe, similar in density to a large tumor on a human being.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Surrounding the nuclear sphere is a "deep crust," essentially a thin layer of partially degenerate neutron drip, and finally an outer layer of hydrogen and helium.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 At the core of many neutron stars is a material core, supported by the strong force, which is most likely made of one of several forces that give rise to superconductivity, i.e, Fermi, Coorbital, U(1) or colour superconductivity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Type II superconductivity occurs with metals at low temperatures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In a magnetic field, the superconducting electrons line up into pancakes, forming fluxoids.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The resulting field is maximal in the mid-plane of the star and tapers off near the surface.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If the total flux is an integer multiple of the quantum of flux, ωφ0, the field is called "toroidal."

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Depending on the ratio of the magnetic energy to the condensation energy, this field is either stable or unstable.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For this work, we study a subset of the stable solutions, those with integral flux quanta.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the ratio of the toroidal field energy to the rest of the star goes as the fifth power of the field strength, so there is little free energy in the field at typical neutron star fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The field lines then naturally bundle as flux bundles of integral quanta.

 The evaluation for the complete Reynolds-Averaged-Navier-Stokes (RANS) equations—typically involving a solution procedure with a computational cost proportional with the eighth power of the Reynolds number—is therefore often avoided and an alternative approach is followed, with on a closure to model the unresolved scales.

 This new closure, that we call Matrix Exponential-Based Closure of the Turbulent Subgrid-Scale Stress (MEC-TS), ensures the RA Conserving property and greatly reduces the cost of the evaluation for the Reynolds-Averaged-Navier-Stokes equations at each time step, in the same time accounting for the unresolved contributions in the Turbulent Subgrid-Scale (TSGS) model.

 Late-type red supergiants (LTRSGs) were evolved stars that are the immediate precursors of massive Wolf–Rayet stars and cannot be observed in the local group of galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This includes the Milky Way (MW), the Local Group (LG) and the satellite galaxies of the MW, such as the Large and Small Magellanic Clouds (LMC and SMC, respectively).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They are of particular interest due to their importance as both the upper end of the initial mass function (IMF) and as possible progenitors for compact binaries, such as gamma-ray bursts (GRBs) and potential gravitational wave sources.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Despite the proximity of the LMC and SMC, and their extensive observational studies, only a small number of LTRSGs have been identified.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This may be due to LTRSGs being evolved stars and so relatively faint, or due to them not existing in these galaxies, for example due to their high luminosity requirements.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To test this hypothesis, I searched for LTRSGs in two satellite galaxies of the MW, the Large and Small Magellanic Clouds.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 I used deep, high-resolution imaging with the 6.5 meter Magellan telescopes and

 a wide-field Pan-STARRS1 (PS1) Survey to identify candidates and extract photometric information.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Two bona fide LTRSGs are identified in the SMC, but not in the LMC.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This suggests that although LTRSGs do not appear in the LG, they may exist in small satellite galaxies such as the LMC.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Weak lensing surveys allow us to study structures at large scales, making them powerful tools to test cosmological models and search for subtle signatures of gravity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To extract the largest possible information from these surveys, it is desirable to break the degeneracy between the lensing potential and the cosmological parameters, which introduces cross-correlation between different redshift bins.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Although ground-based telescopes provide the required precision for these cross-correlations, space is much more advantageous due to the high accessible volume and the reduced cloud coverage.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here, we present the first results of a lensing tomographic analysis with weak lensing reconstructions in 8 redshift bins from space with Wide Field Camera 3 (WFC3) onboard the Hubble Space Telescope (HST).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We combine this with accurate, simultaneous optical and near-infrared photometry from the VisibleISS.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find very good agreement between current ground-based results with similar quality datasets, with errors of ~0.35 on the galaxy bias parameter and ~0.1 on the mass ratio spectrum.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This technique has the potential to achieve 0.1% uncertainty of cosmological parameters from cosmic shear with WFC3 and the VisibleISS, as well as break parameter degeneracies with other imaging surveys with similar telescopes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Valley-dependent optoelectronics based on inversion symmetry breaking have received great attentions recently due to its potential to achieve extremely low power operation, especially for electronics in the next-generation strained silicon CMOS platforms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, direct realization of inversion-symmetry-broken (IBS) materials in electronic devices are still challenging because of the complex relationship among valley-dependent optical selection rules, momentum-conserving carrier scattering, and electronic transportation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Toward this end, we propose a general platform for valley-dependent optoelectronics based on the IBS effect in oxide-interfaced semiconductors, where band structure engineering and reduced dielectric screening combine to relax these complicated constraints.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using relevant first-principles calculations, we demonstrate the gate-tunable valley splitting at up to 30 meV in n-type strained silicon interface oxide, and strong optical absorption onset at the silicon band edge in the photon energy range of 1.1-1.3 eV. Our work provides a promising route to harness the IBS effect for valley-dependent optoelectronics in existing CMOS technology nodes, paving the way for low-power and/or low-footprint Internet of Things applications.

 From this paper we establish two analogous correspondences between link concordance, homology cobordism, and Hirzebruch-type defects.

 The paper examines the characteristics in the nonstationary complex networks, which includes but not limited to the time-varying network and unsynchronizable networks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The nonstationarity originates in the rapid changing of the network structure and/or nodes’ dynamics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Because the network is nonstationary, the conventional network measures cannot fully reflect the network characteristics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To this end, the theory of recurrence plot is adopted to characterizing the network dynamics, and the method to quantify the nonstationarity is proposed accordingly.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The analysis on the generated model and empirical data shows that the nonstationary complex networks are very common in real-world networks, such as the dynamic network and brain network.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The further investigation on the biological network reveals the functionality difference between the stable and nonstationary complex networks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The nonstationary complex networks have broad implications for the real-world networks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, the brain network and large biological network is usually modeled as stationary networks, where the complex dynamics cannot be captured.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 On the contrary, the nonstationary complex networks reveal the underlying nonstationary dynamical behaviors, and thus can be used to achieve more accurate results for some applications, such as the network disease and dynamic forecasting.

 To model the effect of electromagnetic barriers (barriers in materials of different indices of refraction) and tunneling barriers (barriers that allow tunneling through them), we derive general constraints on the thicknesses, refractive indices, and densities of states of dielectric multilayers and potential barrier stepwise heights.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These constraints are applied to dielectric/dielectric and dielectric/potential barrier multilayer structures to determine the ranges of acceptable parameters for electromagnetic and tunneling barriers, respectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For each type of barrier, we find that the transmission, dispersion (wavelength shift), and density of states are inversely proportional to the fourth power of the ratio of the barrier height to the incident wavelength.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By setting these parameters for known barriers, we demonstrate that it is impossible to construct a stepwise potential barrier with arbitrary layer arrangement that transmits less than 10-8, disperses less than 10-9, or has a density of states less than about 10-4 states/eV/nm2/Ci.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Likewise, it is impossible to construct an electromagnetic barrier without a refractive-index difference between the layers greater than about 5.8×10-3 for completely reflecting barriers and greater than 2.2×10-2 for barriers with less than 90% transmittance.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These constraints will aid in the optimization of future electromagnetic and tunneling barrier designs and in the development of practical implementations of these effects.

 Riemann zeros are the set of points where the Riemann zeta function, ζ(s), has zeroes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Fractal dimension, a method of fitting a curve to data to represent its complexity, has been shown to fit the zeros well.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we fit functions of the form f(x)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 = a[1 - α(x - b)^c] to Riemann zeros, where a, b, and c are fit parameters, and α, β, and γ are function parameters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the parameter β corresponds to the fractal dimension of the curve fit, and we find that γ has a minimum value of approximately -0.2 at the real axis.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Additionally, we compute the error on these fits and find that the error is consistent with being normally distributed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We compute a Hurst exponent h using the following equation: H = −γ / (a log(2) sqrt(ln2) β) where β is the fractal dimension, computed above.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that Hurst values tend to fall in the range 0.5 < H < 1, indicating non-random fractal behavior.

 Finally, we show the results for these fractal fits on a Riemann surface, with particular focus on the vertical (X) axis.

 We observe that f(x)

 = a[1 - α(x - b)^c] fits the Riemann zeros very well, with errors consistent with a normally distributed random variable.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We conclude that Riemann zeros fit the assumptions of fractals, and that fractal functions provide good fits to the Riemann zeros.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 DNA hashing (or DNA hash, dna hash) is an advanced hashing technique to generate short, fixed-length hash values for long, variable-length sequences of nucleotide bases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was first proposed by Chew et al.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [1], and is shown to be highly resistant to hash collision attacks [2, 3].

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In 2014, DNA hashing is adopted by the EU FP7 ProjectDNA Consortium for building EU digital DNA sequences [4].

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In late 2017, DNA hashing was adopted by Google for generating short nucleotide sequences, called Thumbprints, for authentication and identification purposes [5].

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In 2018, DNA hashing is proposed for protecting digital signatures

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In 2019, DNA hashing is adopted by Apple for generating secure key files for TouchID [7] and for encrypting user photos on the Apple Photos service [8].

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In 2020, DNA hashing is proposed for generating secure and unique biometric identifiers [9] and for addressing the jitter issue of fingerprint sensors [10].

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 DNA hashing is also adopted by Google for digital identifier protection [11].

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is shown that DNA hashing can protect the privacy and security of digital identifier users

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As a digital identifier was often correlated with sensitive information (such as fingerprint information, facial recognition information, and biometric identification information), DNA hashing can protect the privacy and security of the identifier owner.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 DNA hashing shares the same basic principles as cryptography-based one-time password (OTP) schemes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Unlike cryptography-based OTP schemes, DNA hashing protects against offline password recovery attacks by incorporating a unique salt into the hash function.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Like cryptography-based OTP schemes, DNA hashing enables password change without exposing old passwords, because old password hashes cannot get reused to calculate new hash values.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Unlike cryptography-based OTP schemes, DNA hashing can generate and memorize short, fixed-length hash values from long, variable-length sequences of nucleotide bases, thereby significantly reducing the storage and computation costs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 DNA hashing was also designed to satisfy other design requirements.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, it should satisfy the hardware constraints of the embedded system, as it can be implemented in low-cost, small-footprint circuits.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It will be compatible with existing Watson and MegHash hardware architectures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It can be extendible to multiple algorithmic choices.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It should be easily expandable to different signature schemes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We believe that DNA hashing is a novel, promising digital identifier technology, with important security, privacy, and usability advantages over existing technologies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 More information about laser assisted nuclear reactions can be found in the recent review article (Ref. 1) and references therein.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 High-purity radicals are essential for dynamic nuclear polarization (DNP), which boosts nuclear magnetic moments for imaging at high sensitivity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The hyperpolarization produced in DNP requires a short polarization time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here, we introduce a versatile solid radical, nitroxide trityl (N3), for efficient DNP.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we explore the dynamics of N3 using electron paramagnetic resonance (EPR).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We identify a stable nitroxide anion, tetramethyltetranitromethane (TMTN), as an efficient trap for N3 radicals.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We demonstrate that dipolar coupling of electron and nuclear spins, arising from the anisotropic electron spin, enhances the rate of dynamic nuclear polarization by a factor of 6.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Dipolar coupling has been proposed as an approach to increase the rate of DNP, but the enhancement we observe is an order of magnitude greater than that predicted by theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This enhancement arises from a combination of faster electron relaxation in the TMTN radical and faster formation of N3 radicals in the TMTN radical trap, and we show that both effects contribute significantly to the enhancement.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The rapid diffusion and high polarization we observe with N3 suggest that the approach may be extended to other solid radicals and has the potential to reduce DNP time to less than 1 ms.

 In the field of computer-based learning (CBL), educational researchers and practitioners has identified the need to evaluate the effectiveness of CBL using empirical evidence.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 While there has been a rapid increase in the development of automated assessment in CBL, evaluation methods still mostly rely on self-report and think-aloud protocols, neither of which provides an accurate picture of participants' cognitive and affective experiences.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This article introduces a new method, evaluation of communication (EAC), to measure these experiences.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The EAC method collects survey data on participants' verbal and non-verbal communication during CBL tasks, and uses data mining and natural language processing techniques to analyse the data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The article presents results of an evaluation study using an artificial intelligence-based CBL system to demonstrate the feasibility of the EAC method.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The study achieved 76% statistical significance in identifying different communication styles between low- and high-performing learners, and 85% concordance between human coding and the machine-learning-based approach to coding communication styles.

 The AnITA generic tutoring system was developed to help students improve their academic performance.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work, we present an empirical study on its design process and experiments from multiple perspectives.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We first analyze the system through its design documents and reference architecture, which consist of requirements, use cases, design documents, and tests.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Then, we study the system implementation through architecture, development, and testing perspectives.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Additionally, we present several system-level experiments to study their impacts in tutoring sessions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The findings indicate that the system achieves an average rating of 4.3 stars out of 5 on system usability, 4.8 stars out of 5 on content quality, and 4.7 stars out of 5 on system reliability.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Furthermore, we find that when using multiple experiments, the tutor’s fluency and engagement could be increased by 5.2% and 6.8%, respectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Overall, this work provides a detailed case study of the development of a generic tutoring system and presents several design optimization methods and lessons learned that are potentially useful to others.

 A REM (Rapidly Extensive Method) interface to the simulation of dynamical mean-field spin glasses is introduced.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This interface allows one to perform parallel simulations for finite temperature dynamical mean-field spin glass dynamics in the wide range of time and length scales.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed interface was specialized to handle fully connected random matrices.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study the relaxation of a mean-field spin glass model with probability distribution of Ising interactions defined by a Gaussian random matrix to the equilibrium distribution using the REM.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For particular, we compare the average relaxation time τRSA calculated with different existing methods.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 τRSA obtained from the REM is consistent with the theoretical prediction 1/log(N), where N is the system size.

 For N=10^4, τRSA = 13.2, consistent with 1/log(N) = 13.2/9.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The spiral wave is a key phenomenon in the plankton ecological systems and exhibits the rotating spots with different densities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this Letter, we show that far-field spiral wave breakup is an alternative route to spatiotemporal chaos (STC) in the plankton ecological systems, which cannot be described by the classical C. E. Pfister’s theory1.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The system with three-prey version of the Leslie model exhibits the spatiotemporal chaos when the diffusion coefficients ratio and the compensation rate are set as R=4 and α=2.5, while the spiral wave could still become observed in the experimentally observed region.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using the spiral wave frequency, the wave pattern and the STC are confirmed to be the same.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Thus, the far-field breakup in the spiral wave is an alternative route to the spatiotemporal chaos in the plankton ecological systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The spiral wave breakup is not only an alternative route to STC, but also can being observed by the naked eye in the real ecological systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Central type groups and cohomology classes Let G be a Lie group and g its element.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We say that g has central type if the Killing form of the Lie algebra of G vanishes at the origin, i.e. vanishes on the Lie algebra of G.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this case, the mapping g−1 : g−1 (g)↦g is an automorphism of G called the Zassenhaus automorphism.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We say that a cohomology class in Hn(G,M;R) has central type if its projection to Hn(g−1(g),g−1;R) does.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We give two criterions to know when a cohomology class with central type is non-degenerate: it is non-degenerate if and only if its inverse is non-degenerate and we give an explicit cup-product.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also explain how to compute cup-product of two cohomology classes with central type in terms of pairing between the corresponding Lie algebras' cohomology classes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We finally show that any cohomology classes with central type is bijective if and only if it is non-degenerate and then exhibit an explicit formula for its inverse.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In quantum mechanics, the state of a system is described by a density matrix, a Hermitian positive semidefinite matrix corresponding to a statistical ensemble of pure states.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The density matrix allows one to calculate various properties for the system, such as the expectation value of a particular operator.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For experiments, access to the density matrix requires a quantum process tomography (QPT) scheme.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 QPT is the method of reconstructing the most general process that has acted on a system by probing the system with a large number of different initial states.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work, a closed quantum system is prepared in an arbitrary initial state Ψ0, and a series of projective measurements are performed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The expected outcome for each measurement was calculated from the initial state.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By repeating this process for a series of different Ψ0, a histogram of expected outcomes is generated.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using a quantum process tomography scheme, the initial state can then be extracted from the histogram.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The average fidelity between the reconstructed and true initial states was calculated for a wide range of system parameters, showing the efficacy of the process.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Additionally, finite-time effects are considered, where the expected outcomes are calculated for a system initialized in a highly non-equilibrium state.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The formalism was then applied to a spin-boson model, the T1 qubit, showing a method for measuring arbitrary channels of a spin qubit in a scalable architecture.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Geometric control theory (Grueneisen criteria) is a powerful extension of classical control theory that provides a unified framework for the analysis and stabilization of mechanical systems with constraints and mechanical systems with ordinary differential equations (ODEs), respectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This framework was based on the notion of sub-Riemannian geometry, which was introduced by A. Ferreira in 1973.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This extension was is very successfully applied to several areas of Mathematics, such as the theory of PDEs and geometric evolution equations, and also to applications such as mechanical systems with constrains or in faulty situations, vector fields on statistical manifolds, etc.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, up to now there has not been a comprehensive exposition of this theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With this work we give a comprehensive exposition of geometric control theory, from a synthetic point of view.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To do this, we provide a detailed study on the main concepts in sub-Riemannian geometry and also we prove some basic results of functional analysis and the theory of ordinary differential equations that are of general interest.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also discuss the relation of this theory to the optimal control of differential equations and the calculus of variations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present the main applications of geometric control theory in several fields of Mathematics and give a list of open problems that will be of interest for experts and researchers in the field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Solar radio spectrograph observation of the off-limb active region on 22 June 2014 at 04:30 UT is presented.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Spectral analysis shows that the observed radio emission is mostly composed of two thermal components: one is the spectrally broad and kinetically cool accelerated component, which are usually interpreted as electrons and heat deposited by precipitating beams; the other is the spectrum with little variance across the line profile, which may be contributed by the Maxwellian electrons accelerated by the magnetic field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Compared with the off-limb observation on 21 May 2014 at 14:00 UT, we found that the beam-related emissions have a similar strength, whereas the mean electron density and the temperature of Maxwellian electrons decreased by 20% and 10%, respectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This paper analyzes the spectral lines and their spatial derivatives to reveal how the density and velocity distribution of the thermal electrons change along the solar atmosphere.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results show that the density stratifies downward from the corona to the transition region, and the velocity distribution becomes more anisotropic with decreasing temperature.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The density stratification indicates the beam-generated hot plasma was rooted in the lower solar atmosphere, and the velocity distribution anisotropy suggests that the beam particles propagate along the magnetic field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results imply that both the beam formation and the propagation processes occur simultaneously in the lower solar atmosphere.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The characterisation for the dark matter (DM) component in clusters of galaxies is important for our understanding of the Universe on the largest scales.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 While observational signatures of DM are sought by many methods, one of the most direct is the measurement of the velocity anisotropy of the DM particles as a function of their position within the cluster.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We describe a method of measuring the DM velocity anisotropy, using optical observations of the cluster galaxies and strong gravitational lensing of background galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We apply this method for the galaxy cluster MACS J0429.6-0253, combining our measurements of the projected mass distribution with strong lensing observations from the Subaru telescope.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find strong evidence for an axisymmetric DM velocity anisotropy in this cluster, with the amplitude of the anisotropy dependent on radius.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show that dark matter is not fully collisional, but instead retains some of its velocity memory from earlier times.

 The stability for circumnuclear disks (CNTs) in elliptical galaxies is a topical issue in modern astronomy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Due to the relatively high gas content of these galaxies, they often have detectable rotating disks of cold gas, which are often also embedded in dust.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The presence of these circumnuclear disks were discovered relatively recently.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Despite its cosmological significance, the physics of the formation and the stability of these disks remains obscure.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A number of researchers have claimed that CNTs are gravitationally unstable.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These claims have not yet proven convincingly proven either by laboratory experiments or by computer simulations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is therefore difficult to make accurate predictions about the nature and properties of these structures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This work attempts to study the problem in gravitational stability of CNTs using modern methods of computer simulations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The study was performed using the GRaphic PAthway Code (GPU-PCM), which is a highly efficient parallel computer code for solving the equations of hydrodynamics on a grid.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The experiments are performed for a model of an elliptical galaxy with a low-mass companion, and for a model with a long-term evolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The experiments have confirmed the dynamical stability of circumnuclear disks in both cases, and the specific angular momentum of the disk material was preserved over time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The simulations also revealed the complex spatial structure of the circumnuclear disks, with a complex patchwork of nonaxisymmetric clumps.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, it was not possible to determine the existence of a firmly established fundamental mode of the system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is therefore difficult to state unequivocally whether the structures observed in the simulations are stable in the strict sense.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, it was demonstrated that the tested models had sufficient parameters to reproduce the observed properties of real galaxies with circumnuclear disks.

 Recent observations of distant galaxies has revealed the existence of an "unknown force" which shapes the universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The existence of this force, known as dark energy, was confirmed by the observed accelerated expansion of the universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This 'dark energy' is thought to permeate all of space and essentially make up 68% of the energy budget of the universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 According to general relativity, the 'dark energy' will cause gravity to become stronger with distance, leading to more rapid increases in velocity when observed approaching the center of a galaxy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Galaxy rotation curves have proven to be more shallow than this, possibly signaling the presence of 'dark matter', with which 'dark energy' interacts to produce the observed gravitational force.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This 'dark matter' is thought to make up 26% of the energy budget of the universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is possible because the observed 'dark matter' and 'dark energy' interact only on large scales, allowing for the possibility of 'dark matter' on galactic scales but only 'dark energy' beyond this.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This 'brane theory' has the same weak gravitational force on small scales as general relativity but different forces on large scales.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recent experiments have shown that the universe may in fact be four dimensional with matter existing on a three dimensional brane.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This 'brane theory' can explain both the 'dark matter' and 'dark energy' interactions necessary to explain galaxy rotation curves.

 The pseudospectrum for a system of semiclassical operators is the complement of the spectrum in the closed sectoral cone of the complexification of the phase space of the system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The pseudospectrum can have a fractal structure with numerous self-similarities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This was demonstrated for the harmonic oscillator on the real line with smooth polynomial potentials.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, this implies that the Kolmogorov complexity of the pseudospectrum may not be efficiently computable.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For systems whose phase space is either the torus or the cylinder, explicit formulas are obtained for the pseudospectrum.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The pseudospectrum can be approximated numerically with arbitrary accuracy by considering finite-dimensional truncations of the system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This is used to prove the existence of resonances in the pseudospectrum, i.e. to show that the widths of some spectral bands may become zero.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A practical algorithm to find resonances was also presented.

 The LBNE Collaboration has studied the potential of the long-baseline neutrino experiment to determine whether or not short-baseline muon neutrino disappearance was caused by neutrino oscillations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that such an observation would be highly statistically significant and have a good chance of making a discovery.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We determine projected sensitivities to total mixing, inverted mass hierarchy, and CP violation in the MNS matrix.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also discuss potential spinoff experiments, which may confirm or exclude the null result with higher statistics, and address experimental challenges.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we compare the LBNE proposal with other long-baseline neutrino experiments and to proposed neutrino sources.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the LBNE proposal has excellent potential to make a discovery and set strong constraints on neutrino parameters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Long-Baseline Neutrino Experiment (LBNE) is a proposed neutrino physics program at the Sanford Underground Facility (SONGS) in South Dakota, USA, and the Soudan Mine in Minnesota, USA.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The LBNE has the scientific goal of establishing whether or not short-baseline (~15 km) muon neutrino disappearance is caused by neutrino oscillations, and if so, to determine the nature of the disappearance; that is, whether it is due to normal or inverted mass hierarchy, and whether it involves maximal or minimal neutrino CP violation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If confirmed, these phenomena would indicate the presence of new particle species, leading to possible discoveries in particle physics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 LBNE could also shed light on a possible conceptual conflict between the short and long distance scales implied by neutrino oscillations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The LBNE has a two-detector configuration using massive 200 kt-Trititanium (TT) detectors with a baseline of 1210 to 1610 km.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It has been shown that this configuration would be sensitive to total neutrino mixing < 13% C.L. at the 3x10-3 baseline resolution, and to neutrino mass-ordering and CP violation at the 5x10-2 to 5x10-3 C.L. levels.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We describe the determination for projected sensitivities to neutrino parameters using a Feldman-Cousins method that includes systematic uncertainties.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This study is preliminary and does not include a cost-benefit or risk assessment.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We conclude with a discussion of proposed spinoff experiments that could confirm or rule out the null result with higher statistics and discuss experimental challenges.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Object classification is a key step in difference imaging, the study of galaxies when they were younger than they are now.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Historically, this has been a laborious process that has limited the kinds of galaxies that have been studied.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We introduce a technique for object classification that both increases the efficiency with which we can study galaxies and improves the reliability of our results.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The technique uses a convolutional neural network trained on high-quality images of galaxies to classify low-quality difference imaging images of the same galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This allows us to identify candidate galaxies and to reject images of stars that otherwise might have become incorrectly labeled as galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our method improves the reliability of our results and significantly increases the number of galaxies that we will study.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As a test, we apply our method to the difference imaging survey of a field in the southern sky, K2, identifying 80% as galaxies instead of the approximately 50% that were identified by eyeball inspection.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The resulting catalog may be useful for studying the evolution of the population of galaxies as a function of redshift and will aid in our understanding of galaxy morphology and population statistics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The technique described here is not limited to difference imaging.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Similar methods can be applied to other contexts in which object classification is a necessary preliminary step.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This letter investigates the transient behavior in surface plasmon polaritons (SPPs) scattered at a subwavelength groove.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The SPP scattering is modeled as a two-dimensional waveguide grating with a finite longitudinal dimension.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was shown that the SPP fields are primarily distributed in the groove and gradually decay to zero in the distance of lambda/2n where n is the refractive index of surrounding medium.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The SPP fields decay as a free-space exponential function in the long distance and the time scale is determined by the dimensions of the groove.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The temporal evolution in the SPP field is in-line with that of the transverse component of the electric field of the incident pulse, showing the dominant role of the SPP in the scattering process.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results provide useful information on SPP scattering at subwavelength scale and can be utilized to optimize SPP-based devices.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With this paper, we study dynamical properties of fluid of platelike colloidal particles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This subject has been recently studied experimentally

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In our study, we apply computer simulation techniques.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We consider bidisperse mixture with platelike and spherical colloidal particles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We perform event-driven molecular dynamics simulations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In our system, platelike particles have two equal square-shaped faces and diameter d. Spherical particles have a diameter d/2.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study dynamical properties of our system in the range of volume fraction 0.621 ≤ϕ≤ 0.895 and averaged number of platelike particles NPl=100, 200, and 300.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Within this range of ϕ and NPl, we study transients and long-time dynamical behavior of self-intermediate scattering function S(q,t) and pair-intermediate scattering function S(q,t) for different values of q.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We observe dynamical behaviour with exponential decay of transients, quasiequilibration and growing of correlation functions toward exact hydrodynamics at long times.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The quantum vacuum is a magical place where particles pop in and out of existence in a probabilistic fashion.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The behavior of such quantum fields underlie all known interactions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, their exchange leads to the stability of the Standard Model (SM) electric charge, the spin of the particles, and the form of the interactions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If we extrapolate the particle spectrum of the SM to the lowest possible energies, we expect the particle exchanges to involve gravitons, which could explain the observed gravity, and, possibly, also photons and fermions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For this work, we discuss the first option.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Gravitons are the expected carrier for the gravitational interaction, which otherwise feels indirect through intermediate messengers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Photons and fermions are the two most massive particles in the SM.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, it seems plausible that they could be the corresponding force carriers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, the fact that they are spin-1/2 fermions rather than spin-2 bosons has so far prevented them from becoming observed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work, we propose a way for photons and fermions to interact directly, through a new Lorentz- and CPT-violating term in the Standard Model Lagrangian.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present a way to test this proposal with current and future colliders.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Gravitons carry both the gravitational and Lorentz-violation interactions, leading into a unique signature of completely missing particles, with two corresponding jets emerging at high invariant mass.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Photons and fermions only carry the gravitational interaction.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, their phenomenological implications are different.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Photons and fermions can decay to gravitons, so the signature would be two jets plus missing energy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If the graviton is the lightest of the new particles, the signature would instead be four jets.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 An excess of any of these signatures could be a hint of the underlying theory, which could also give an explanation for dark matter and the strong and weak forces.

 Recent spectropolarimetric observations of Balmer-dominated shocks has revealed the presence of a so-called transition zone with characteristics in-between the pre-shock and post-shock regions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The characteristics in this zone are dependent on the properties of the incoming flow, such as the Mach number and the pre-shock magnetic field strength, as well as on the shock strength.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Within this paper, we present the results of 1D numerical simulations of Balmer-dominated shocks in the strong shock limit, which enable us to characterize the nature of the transition zone and to compute its physical properties as a function of the shock parameters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that for strong shock limit, the width of the transition zone scales as the distance between the centers of the pre-shock and shock zone, while its temperature and velocity dispersion scale as the square root of the corresponding pre-shock values.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Furthermore, we find that the fractional abundance of ionized carbon decreases exponentially from the pre-shock value to nearly zero across the shock front.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We provide scaling relations which were are used to approximate the physical properties of the transition zone in between the pre-shock and post-shock regions, on the basis of the knowledge of the physical parameters of the incoming flow and of the shock.

 Nucleon density and momentum distributions in nuclei provide unique information on the spatial distribution of nucleonic momenta and currents in atomic nuclei.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the standard analysis, the center-of-mass (c.m.) correction is applied sequentially after the removal of the nucleon resolution function.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here, we present a method that combines these two corrections into one step, thus termed simultaneous center-of-mass (s.c.m.).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The s.c.m. correction improves the agreement between theoretical predictions with experimental data for a wide range of nuclei and distributions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The accuracy of the new method was illustrated by a simultaneous description of the deuteron and W(d,2p) distributions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The method was was readily applied to other nuclear reactions and extends the applicability of nuclear reaction theory to regions of current interest, such as the studies of spin-isospin excitations of nuclei and structure changes during the evolution of nuclear systems in collisions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The method can be downloaded from https://arxiv.org/abs/1906.09044.

 We present late-time X-ray observations from the nearby Type Ibc core-collapse supernova 2018crp with the Chandra X-ray Observatory and review its observational and modeling signatures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We measure an X-ray luminosity as (4.6 ± 1.0)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 × 1033 erg s−1 at a Galactocentric distance of 4.4 ± 0.3 kpc, assuming the distance to the Large Magellanic Cloud is 50 kpc.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We compare this luminosity with modeling predictions for three distinct progenitor models of the Type Ibc SN 2018crp: a naked helium star (a Helium star with no external hydrogen or dust layer), a stripped-envelope star (a star with a hydrogen or helium envelope, but not enough to classify it as a blue supergiant), and a compact Wolf-Rayet star.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 All progenitor models predict X-ray luminosities that are highly inconsistent with the observed value.

 We determine that the X-ray emission from the forward shock radius must be suppressed via a break in the electron energy distribution; the suppression could be due to either a significantly steeper electron energy distribution (which requires a much faster ejecta expansion velocity or larger explosion energy), or a low-density environment surrounding the shock-suppressed region.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We thus present evidence against the compact Wolf-Rayet star progenitor model for Type Ibc SN 2018crp and, in general, favor more extended, lower-velocity explosion models for these transients.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Type Ibc supernovae, or hypernovae, are a rare class of explosive stellar events that are generated by core-collapse of massive stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Their classification is based on their observed spectra, with Type Ibc supernovae showing hydrogen or helium features in their spectrum, but lacking sufficient features of a broad absorption line supernova.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The recent discoveries of long gamma-ray bursts (GRBs), also known as hypernovae, have opened up new possibilities to probe their origin.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Observational constraints on the location of long GRBs suggest they were associated with the deaths of very massive stars, though the details of their progenitors are not fully understood.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Two long GRBs ( GRB 170729A and GRB 160821B) are observed in the local group of galaxies, and in one of these (GRB 160821B) late-time X-ray observations were also obtained.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Constraints on the progenitor star and explosion geometry can be obtained from the observed properties of these transients.

 For a few weeks to months following the GRB explosion, the X-ray, ultraviolet, and optical emission is powered by the forward shockwave from the escaping ejecta interacting with the circumstellar medium (CSM).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recent advances in nanoscale magnetic functionality has led to a burgeoning interest in utilizing these structures for magnetic imaging and magneto-optical signals detection.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Magnetic nanoparticles (MNPs) are uniquely attractive in these applications due to their tunable, localized surface magnetic moments.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we present the atomic scale magnetic characterization for uniformly 15 nm Fe Nanodots.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We employ aberration-corrected, high resolution transmission electron microscopy (AC-HR-TEM) to probe the local magnetic properties of these particles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our measurements reveal distinct magnetic fingerprint patterns on individual Nanodots.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These patterns correspond to the engineered multi-domain states of the Nanodots, which we image with nanometer-scale spatial resolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we exploit the spatial dependence of the magnetic fingerprints to rapidly image small volumes (~2 × 2 × 2 nm3).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our experiments provide a detailed, nanoscale magnetic characterization of sub-100 nm single-domain particles and represent an important step toward the development of MNP-based devices for high resolution magnetic imaging.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Baumslag-Solitar groups are a generalization of a well-known quotient of the free group.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With this paper, we present a duality approach to study representations of Baumslag-Solitar groups.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 More precisely, we prove that for any positive integer m, every representation of the one-relator group with m relation is dual to a (possibly different) representation of the abelianization of the group.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using this duality, we recover some well-known results for one-relator groups with integer relations as particular cases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also deduce some stability results for representations of Baumslag-Solitar groups.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use our duality to study a question about hereditarily just-infinite groups.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A group G is called hereditarily just-infinite if every subgroup of G is either just-infinite or finite.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Hereditarily just-infinite groups are a generalisation for just-infinite groups.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We prove that if a one-relator group with torsion is hereditarily just-infinite, then its abelianization is an elementary amenable group, which is a direct generalisation of a classical theorem of Mal’cev.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Galaxies are surrounded by large scale structures: the halos in which they form, and the filaments and sheets in which they are embedded.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Mergers between galaxies are important for galaxy evolution, as they can bring in new material, angular momentum, and, perhaps, new satellite galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Observational searches for satellites have traditionally been difficult, because they are easily disrupted or removed by the galactic environment.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 N-body simulations has proved to be a powerful tool for predicting the frequency and properties of satellite galaxies, but predictions still require observationally-informed scaling with the underlying dark matter halos.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recently, satellite galaxies have been identified in cosmological dark matter simulations, without including the baryonic physics that would likely disrupt them.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we use a set of zoomed-in, high-resolution cosmological simulations to examine the relation between mergers and the formation of satellite galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find a strong dependence of the survival of satellite galaxies on the relative masses of the satellite and its host, and on their orbital parameters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Satellite galaxies that are in highly eccentric orbits are much more likely to survive for several crossing times than those on more circular orbits.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Satellites in prograde orbits around their host are more likely to survive than those on retrograde orbits, and satellites on highly radial orbits are more likely to survive than those on low-radius orbits.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Satellite galaxies that form in the center of their host are more likely to survive than those that form far from the center.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also find that the internal structures of galaxies, as measured by their phase-space structure, are a better predictor of the fate of satellites than their dark matter halos.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, satellites that are either on radial orbits or on highly eccentric orbits will have large amounts of stars stripped from their outer parts.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The time until all of the satellite’s stars are removed depends on its orbit, with radial orbits being more unstable than more circular orbits.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Overall, we find that merging plays a large role in shaping the satellite galaxies we see in the universe today.

 The generator coordinate method (GCM) is an approach for computing eigenvalues and eigenfunctions of operators, such as the time-dependent Kohn-Sham equation, in many-body quantum systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The GCM solves the Schr[ö]dinger equation with a symmetry-breaking manner, using a unitary transformation to cast the problem in a fully symmetry-preserving form.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This allows for the separation of low-lying states of the Hamiltonian into separately optimizing each state in a different, yet internally consistent, approximate representation of the ground state.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The GCM has been widely used to study strong correlation in electronic structure, particularly with the development of linear-response time-dependent density-functional theory (TDDFT).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work, we show that in the case of the TDDFT Kohn-Sham Hamiltonian, the same separation of low-lying states into separately optimized approximations can been achieved without symmetry-breaking, by instead optimizing the generator coordinate itself in a self-consistent manner.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We call this method the generator coordinate method of TDDFT (GCTDDFT).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We illustrate this approach for the polaron, the Shcrödinger equation with aScreening Coulomb potential, and an iron pnictide.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Optical lattices provide a highly controllable platform in simulating quantum systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By modifying the Raman coupling and the potential, various quantum phases can become achieved, such as superfluid and Mott insulators.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The quantum phases of cold atoms loaded in an optical lattice is typically characterized by the Wannier function based on Bloch’s theorem, which is a key issue in simulations and experiments due to the difficulties in engineering accurate optical lattices with desired band structures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To this end, we show that in the deep lattice limit with a large on-site Hubbard interaction U, the dynamics of hardcore bosons can be mapped to an effective quantum spin system with long-range interactions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For the thermodynamic limit, this quantum spin system exhibits a third-order phase transition at a finite wave number k* from a MI to a SF in the Wannier function representation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, the dynamical and equilibrium properties are discussed in detail.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Furthermore, a real-space renormalization group approach was proposed to accurately calculate dynamical quantities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results shed lights on a possible experimental realization of the quantum spin system and the localization phenomena of quantum many-body systems in realistic optical lattice systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Many biophysical and biochemical studies have underlined the crucial influence of carbohydrates in living cells.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Indeed, carbohydrates seem to be essential in various life processes, such as cell recognition, structural integrity, energy storage or as transmitters of chemical signals.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Thus, the effect of carbohydrates on the structure and dynamical properties of proteins of interest has received great interest in recent years.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For this study, we focus on the effects of three commonly occurring carbohydrates, trehalose, maltose and sucrose, on the dynamical and structural properties of hen egg-white lysozyme by means of Molecular Dynamics simulations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that these three carbohydrates influence the protein dynamics, as well as its secondary and tertiary structure.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By addition, we find that maltose has a more pronounced stabilizing effect on the protein structure than trehalose and sucrose.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Further, the dynamical quantities were found to be related to the protein-carbohydrate interaction strengths.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Researchers study the composition and evolution of dust during the early stages in galaxy evolution using Primordial Supernova Remnants (P31 on the image below, also known as Cas A) as aRosetta Stone to help interpret the observed abundances and physical conditions in young supernova remnants (SNRs) throughout the universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By performing state-of-the-art dust formation and evolution simulations, we find that silicate dust grains formed in the P31 ejecta can survive for a Hubble time and become injected into the surrounding early Interstellar Medium (ISM).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These dust grains would then grow via accretion of metals from the presolar ISM to form nanometer-sized particles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also find that titanium and vanadium are the most abundant elements at the grain surface and that the overall stoichiometry is roughly Ti-26V-4Si, with a high sulfur to oxygen atomic ratio of 0.5-1.5%.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These sulfur-rich compositions are distinctive from those of chondritic meteorites and are most consistent with carbon-rich pebble materials, such as enstatite andagnetite, as injected dust precursors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We conclude that the P31 supernova remnant, as observed and modeled here, provides a rich platform to test theoretical predictions of dust formation and subsequent evolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The bulk compositions of silicate dust grains injected into the early ISM would serve as fingerprints to help identify these unique grains among the Galactic and extragalactic background population.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The silicon, titanium, and vanadium abundances can be used to confirm the formation of silicates, oxides, and carbides, respectively, as expected for core-collapse supernova ejecta interacting with the surrounding ISM.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Furthermore, the sulfur-to-oxygen ratio can be leveraged as a clock to date the injection event to within roughly 30-330 million years, depending on the assumed density and composition of presolar ambient gas.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The recent detection of an unusually large sulfur mass fraction in the wake of SN1987A supports an age estimate of ~30 million years, given that most of the injected sulfur would have likely become consumed in the formation of new dust grains.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Ultimately, dust identified in young SNRs may provide a unique window into the nucleosynthesis and chemical enrichment history of the very first stars and galaxies in the early Universe.
