Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For this paper, we consider the problem of determining the minimal probability of ruin for a jump-diffusion risk model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We provide a characterization of the minimal probability of ruin via a convex game that consists of a stopping game and a control game.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 At each horizon, the player has to choose between playing the risk process until the time of ruin and terminating the play with some safe liquidation wealth level.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The control game is then played with the strategy chosen by the first player determining the time and the level of the jump process.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 After applying an extended version of Sion's theorem to this game, we are able to characterize the value function of the stopping game as the unique classical solution to a degenerate elliptic partial differential equation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we prove that this value function is both the minimal probability of ruin and the unique maximum probability of survival.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This work is of interest to risk managers, researchers, and students who are interested in problems related to determining the minimal probability of ruin for a jump-diffusion risk model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Magnetic fields were known to be present in most stars and planets, and play a crucial role in their evolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Much less was known about magnetic fields in systems lacking apparent collimated, ordered magnetic fields, such as stars and planets.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Observations of continuum and line emission from large numbers of low-mass pre-main-sequence stars (T Tauri stars) has provided evidence for substantial magnetic fields in these systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The most likely topology for the field in these systems is a dipole aligned with the stellar rotation axis.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here, we present Zeeman-Doppler imaging of the presence and properties of a dipole field in the T Tauri star Hen 3-4008.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The dipole field is occulted by the large inner disk but emerges in the outer disk, along with slow magnetoacoustic waves that thread the disk.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present quantitative modeling for the field characteristics, and place lower limits on the strength of the magnetic field of Hen 3-4008 of approximately 650 G.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The existence of dark matter is established by the gravitational effects it has on visible matter in galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The nature behind dark matter, however, is unknown.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The most popular theory regarding its nature, the cold dark matter theory, states that it is comprised of elementary particles which neither give off nor receive electromagnetic radiation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Observational evidence has established that dark matter exists in clusters, or aggregates, large enough to be observed in both particles and galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These clusters are believed to evolve via the mutual gravitational interaction of their constituent particles and galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Since the constituents of dark matter do not give off or absorb light, their direct observation has been challenging.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Studying the dynamics of these clusters can therefore aid in understanding the properties of dark matter.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 B514 is a globular cluster located in the M31 galaxy approximately 25,000 light-years from Earth.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using the Hubble Space Telescope, I have determined that B514 has an additional extended halo which, based on its structural and dynamical characteristics, was most likely comprised of dark matter.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 I have determined that this dark matter halo has a mean density of 0.105 halo particles per cubic light-year and a diameter of 1.33 kpc or 17,650 light-years.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A muon, electron, andtau particle neutrino interaction with a nuclear target can lead to various channels.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Of particular interest in neutrino oscillations experiments are the channels in which a charged current interaction produces a charged current signature lepton plus a missing transverse momentum.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, we demonstrate that these channels can be reduced to a complex symplectic invariant, which we call s.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The structure in this invariant allows us to predict the structure of the corresponding charged current neutrino interaction matrix in the Standard Model, namely the Cabibbo-Kobayashi-Maskawa (CKM) matrix.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use experimental data for the leading order structure of the CKM matrix and demonstrate that it reduces to a good approximation to the structure predicted by the invariant.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We apply our analysis to precisionglobal fits to the neutrino mixing matrix and show that the corresponding structure predicted by s is in agreement with data at the 1.7 sigma level.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also discuss the connection of this result to higher-dimensional physics and flavor symmetry.

 The presented paper describes the development of a new general relativistic hydrodynamics code called WHAM (WENO-HARDM).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The paper presents the numerical methods implemented in the code, as well as some of the problems and solutions encountered during the development.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The code is written in modular fashion, which allows it to be easily extended to other hydrodynamics equations, embedding equations, and mathematical flux functions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The authors performed several tests of the code to demonstrate the ability to accurately capture both smooth solutions and physical discontinuities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results are in good agreement with the exact solutions and published literature for various hydrodynamics equations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 WHAM is available from https://bitbucket.org/carrerr/wham.

 Fluid mechanics, by turn, is the study of fluid behavior not involving radiation or mechanical phenomena.

 The dynamics in a viscous fluid is is described by the hydrodynamic equations: the continuity equation, which expresses the conservation of fluid mass; the fluid velocity, which is the statement of Newton's law of motion, and an appropriate velocity specification such as no flow across boundaries (no slip) or in canals (zero shear); and the conservation of momentum, which is the statement of force production due to contact friction and other sources not already included in the fluid mass equation.

 General relativity is the study of the effects of gravity on the propagation of light.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 General relativity is one among the most comprehensive and successful descriptions of the laws of physics, accounting for all known forms of energy, including mass-energy and matter, electromagnetic, and nuclear energy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It also describes the dynamics of spacetime, the construction of spacetime itself.

 The theory arose in attempts to reconcile the Ideas of Isaac Newton regarding an universal and singularly elegant theory of gravity with the correct description of the movements of the planets and stars.

 In particular, general relativity accurately describes the behavior of light on the scale of planets and stars, while Newton's theory does not appear to adequately explain such observations.

 Noise in the fractional quantum Hall effect (FQHE) is an important aspect that can often be overlooked in the study of this novel state of quantum matter.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Both emission and absorption noise have been theoretically predicted to occur in the FQHE.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 While emission noise can affect transport measurements through the sample, absorption noise cannot and can be observed via noise spectroscopy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present two distinct experimental realizations for this noise spectroscopy, one utilizing microwave radiation and another optical Raman scattering, both of which are in good quantitative agreement with theoretical calculations of emission and absorption noise in the FQHE.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This noise spectroscopy is an essential tool to study transport in the FQHE and will enable future studies of many-body dynamics in this quantum many-body system.

 We investigate the collapse of very massive stars, starting with a Solar mass and rotating at the level of 600 times the speed of light, to black holes in full general relativity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These collapses occur in a region with very high angular momentum, where the hole punctures the sky and shrinks to a Schwarzschild radius of about 30 km, when General Relativity requires that it becomes infinitely massive.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We perform simulations with up to 2048*1024 resolution, showing that the fluid forms a prolate configuration, with a maximum radius of about 1000 meters, and a slowly rotating inner core of radius a few meters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Following an initial phase of about 0.5 ms, the collapse proceeds by a way remarkably similar to the head-on collision of two black holes of 30 and 10 solar masses, with an apparent horizon of about 20 kilometers in size and an estimated radiated energy of about 2.5% of the total mass, in excellent agreement with the values obtained in previous perturbative calculations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study the properties of the formed black holes and show that several physical parameters, like the irreducible mass, the rotational parameter, the curvature invariant and the event horizon surface gravity are in very good agreement with the values obtained in perturbative calculations, even for the final, non-perturbative, rotating star.

 Web data has evolved with the growth of Web and the introduction of new concepts such as social networks and mobile applications.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The volume of this data increases day-by-day and new research in the field of data management is needed for effective data analytics on this data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, a distributed data model for Web data integration in data warehouses is proposed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main advantage of this model is that all the data associated with a website are represented as a single row in the target relational database, which makes it easy to perform joins between this table and other tables.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This model uses case-change style rules to add new columns to the base table to represent the new concepts and these rules can get extended easily to add new concepts.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed model has been implemented in MySQL database and the performance of this model has been evaluated using real-life data and it is shown that this model can handle large volumes of Web data compared to other models.

 Recently, various anomalies have been found in the WMAP data, such as the alignments between the regions of high (positive) and low (negative) signed intensities and the directions of the solar wind, and the correlations between the temperature and the components of the WMAP data in the KQ75 orientated dataset.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These anomalies have become widely interpreted as indirect signatures of the presence of electromagnetic interference and/or possible contamination from Solar System dust.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, we report the discovery of several other alignment and intensity anomalies in the WMAP data that have not been reported previously and are more difficult to explain.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also provide a plausible physical explanation for these anomalies, which are due to interference from man-made radio signals.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We demonstrate that the same interference is also responsible for the recently observed anomalies in the signed-intensity and cross-power spectra.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The interference we report here probably comes from man-made radio signals in the frequency bands 128 - 137 MHz, 143 - 149 MHz, and 333 - 349 MHz.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The radio waves from these sources would have propagated from North America into the northern hemisphere of the sky (where the WMAP spacecraft is located) in the period from May 2003 to November 2003.

 From this paper, we present a construction of free fermions for supergroup WZNW models using a free fermion resolution of supergroups, along with a spectral flow that relates models with different levels.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We give a free field realisation of the WZNW model based on the free fermion resolution.

 Bipolar spintronics combines the advantages of ferromagnetic materials and spin electronics by utilizing the spin of electron as well as that of hole.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this approach, the spin-orbit interaction (SOI) was employed to generate or detect spin polarization, and the ferromagnetism can be used for information storage.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first realized application to bipolar spintronics is the observation of spin hall effect in 1977.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Since then, intensive studies have be conducted in this field, and various applications have been proposed, including the anomalous hall effect, pure spin current injection, and spintronics-based logic.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This paper gives an overview on bipolar spintronics, from spin injection to spin-controlled logic.

 Neutrinos are an essential part of the Standard Model (SM) of particle physics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They interactions are described by the Lagrangian λ–μ+ν(−χ+ρ), where λ,μ and ν are the three lepton families' coupling constants, and χ and ρ are scalar fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The origin of these couplings was not understood in the SM.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The neutrinos' self-interactions are absent from the Lagrangian because of a symmetry, called lepton number symmetry.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Nevertheless, we show that the observed neutrino oscillations is best explained by spontaneously breaking of this symmetry at the scale θ≤10−10 GeV, below which the effective theory has radiatively broken symmetry.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We calculate θ and several cosmological parameters, and we find that the simplest versions of this model are in accord with recent data.

 We also briefly discuss variations of this model with additional scalar fields and steps to test this model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Massive black holes exist in all massive galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They grow with time due to accretion of matter.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Their masses can be estimated using the fundamental plane of black hole activity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The plane was based on three parameters, namely the velocity dispersion of the host galaxy, the stellar velocity dispersion and the radius of the sphere of influence of the black hole.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first two were measured for the galaxy, while the third one can be estimated using the black hole's mass.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The latter two are strongly correlated and can be used to estimate the mass of the black hole.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Such estimation has be done for a large sample of galaxies and it was found that more massive galaxies have on average more massive black holes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This correlation is is expressed as a linear relation of the form: M_{BH} = A x M_{spheroid} + B where M_{BH} is the mass of the black hole, M_{spheroid} is the mass of the spheroid, A is a coefficient close to 7 and B is a constant.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This relation was found to be true for galaxies of all Hubble types, but especially for early-types.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The correlations with the host galaxy properties were stronger for the spheroid than for the black hole mass, which can be explained by the merger driven growth of black holes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The scatter of the relation can be reduced by using another observable, namely the luminosity of the spheroid.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The latter can be estimated using the velocity dispersion and the radius of the sphere of influence, which are required for the former.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The latter can be estimated from the B-band luminosity of the galaxy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is found that the scatter of the black hole mass - spheroid luminosity relation is significantly lower than for the other relations, and the best-fit coefficient is closer to 10, which can been explained by more accurate measurements and less intrinsic scatter in the spheroid luminosity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was suggested that the black hole mass - spheroid luminosity relation can be used as a new standard for estimating the black hole mass.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Free core nutation, also known as temporal nutation, is a relatively fast component of Earth's rotation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is directly proportional to the axial wobble, which in turn was driven by the planet's mass and moment of inertia.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Temporal nutation was measured by satellites with very high precision, which has enabled detection of Free Core Nutation Frequency (FCNF).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 FCNF is caused by modulation of Earth's axis of rotation in the Free Core Nutation Mode.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The amplitude of FCNF can vary with time and gives information about dynamics of Earth's core.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For this study we analyze an existing database of FCNF observations from space.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We apply two methods to extract theFCNF signal from the noise.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first one is based on statistical hypothesis testing and calculates the significance of FCNF signal.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The second one was based on empirical mode decomposition and identifies components of FCNF signal.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results of both methods are consistent and show that the amplitude of FCNF varies with time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This indicates that dynamics of Earth's core may be of interest for scientists.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This work revisits the ideal fluid dynamics on Lie groups from a control perspective.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is well-known that such theories can be obtained from the Lagrangian formulation of the celebrated Euler equation on the diffeomorphism group of a three dimensional Riemannian manifold.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 An equivalent Hamiltonian description using the theory of Lie groupoids and Lagrangian mechanics on Lie groupoids is proposed, and explicit constructions were given for some important special cases including fluid dynamics on Lie groups, Newtonian gravity on the special orthogonal group and the general linear group, and the classical ECSK theory of non-relativistic gravity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the Hamiltonian description, the fluid dynamics on Lie groups and ideal hydrodynamics is described by a Lie groupoid, with the fluid dynamics being a particular case in which the source of the gauge groupoid morphism is the diffeomorphism group of the fluid domain.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, in the particle description, the fluid dynamics on Lie groups and ideal hydrodynamics can be seen as resulting from a deformation quantization of the source groupoid.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was shown that the Schrödinger equation, which describes the evolution of quantum mechanics, arises as the geodesic equation for the magnetic connection of the deformation quantization.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This permits the construction of a mechanical system which realizes ideal hydrodynamics in the large, namely which exhibits the geodesic flow of a specific left-invariant metric on the solution groupoid.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The resulting system is presented in explicit form for the example of ideal fluid dynamics on the special orthogonal group.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is also shown that the system so constructed is Hamiltonian with respect to a modified symplectic structure, corresponding to that of Dubois-Viallet on the Lie group corresponding to the special orthogonal group.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Some exact solutions were also presented.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A background study for the CERN Axion Solar Telescope (CAST) pn-CCD detector is presented.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The CAST experiment is searching for solar axions by measuring their invisible photon-axion conversion probability in the magnetic field of the Southern solar farm.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The pn-CCD is one of the detector systems of CAST.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It consists of two hexagonal planes of Silicon photomultipliers with 0.85 mm depleted surface detector, covering 95% of the total sensitive area.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This study updates and completes the model-independent background analysis of the detector, presented in a previous publication.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The expected rates for the gamma-ray induced signals in the silicon detector and in the surrounding passive material are computed and compared to the measured background.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The resulting rates were used to derive new limits on photon backgrounds for CAST.

 A wide range of masses, from 3 to 18M_odot, has was found for Single stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This range includes 4 to 18M_odot for White dwarfs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The maximum masses of neutron stars have been found to be 2.2-2.5M_odot, but there is a large uncertainty in this number.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For binary systems, it is much harder to form such massive compact objects, because a larger amount of matter must be compressed for a longer time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The origin for these very massive objects is not clear.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It has been proposed that these very massive objects might be the remnants of very massive Population III stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These very massive Population III stars may have formed in metal free regions of the early universe due to the bottom up creation mechanism for these very massive objects.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Very massive Population III stars may have formed with approximately 40-200M_odot.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 When these very massive Population III stars eventually exhaust their nuclear fuel, they can end their life as very massive compact objects.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Currently, there are very limited models for these very massive compact objects, and this hampers our understanding of their evolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Current very massive compact object models assume the compact objects have a constant mass equal to the initial mass of the progenitor.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, a more realistic model for the compact object masses would take into account the possible loss of mass during the formation process.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Magnetodielectric media with simultaneously large magneto-optical and dielectric losses support traveling waves that become simultaneously attenuated and refracted.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 When resonant loss features of these media become broadened by radiative processes, the resulting local-field enhancement and media degeneration can lead to significant refraction and absorption reduction.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we demonstrate, both theoretically and experimentally, this phenomenon of negative refraction and absorption reduction in a resonant plasmon-radiative medium based on inverse Faraday rotation in a thin yttrium iron garnet film.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The observed resonant refraction reduction by over 25% is greater than that of standard resummed negative-index media.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The derived absorption reduction is greater than 10% in the measured frequency range, which is the largest value reported for any resonant plasmon-radiative medium.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results indicate that radiative losses may provide a promising approach for enhanced absorption and refraction in plasmonic and magnetic media."

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The post-Newtonian (PN) approximation is a powerful method to analyze the behavior of gravitation in systems consisting of compact objects.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first post-Newtonian approximation (1PN) of general relativity (GR) were constructed by Einstein and Rosen in 1932.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Scalar-tensor theory (STT) generalizes GR by generalizing the graviton into a more general scalar field, leading to additional gravitational degrees of freedom.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The most general STT action consistent with general covariance and single-scalar-fieldsymmetry is that of Horndeski.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In 1981, Deffayet et al. found a novel class of scalar-tensor theories, known as scalar-tensor theories with non-minimal coupling (STT[NGC]), which differ from general STT by the form of the coupling function.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To first order with the usual PN parameter ( = GM/(rc^2)), where M and r are the mass and distance of the system, respectively, and G is the Gravitational constant, the equations of motion for a two-body system in general STT[NGC] differ from those of GR only by 2.5PN order, while the self-coupling of the scalar field enters at 1.5PN order.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In 2015, Brax et al. showed that a special case of STT[NGC] called scalar-tensor-relativistic theory (STR) is a good approximation to general STT in a large class of spherically symmetric solutions, dubbed nearly solutions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To zeroth order for the usual PN parameter, the equation of motion for a nearly spherically symmetric system in STR is fourth order and reduces to the ordinary Emden equation, whose solutions are exact scalar-Gauss-Bonnet black holes with a finite horizon.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For this Letter we consider the slow motion of particles around such black holes and compare the resulting scalar-Gauss-Bonnet Hamiltonians with the ones of GR.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that: i) in the 1.5PN and 2PN orders, the first terms in the potential and precession Hamiltonians of STR differ to those of GR, respectively, by scalar and Gauss-Bonnet topological invariants; ii) the 1PN terms in the potential and precession Hamiltonians of STR are proportional to the square of the absolute value of the Det of the spatial metric.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Henceforth, these invariants vanish in black holes in Einstein gravity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In conclusion, we have obtained the 2PN approximation of scalar-Gauss-Bonnet theories of gravity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The generation interval (GI) is the time between the infectious period of an individual and when they will become contagious again.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 During the COVID-19 pandemic, the GI is found to be decreasing in many countries, indicating that the virus could remain viable in the population for a shorter time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This could help the virus spread throughout the population more quickly, or it can lead to increased uncertainty about when an individual is contagious, which could compromise vaccination strategies or other mitigation strategies that depend on knowing the timing of infection.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To understand this phenomenon, we analyse data from COVID-19 cases in Australia, Brazil, Italy, and the United States.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that changes in GI vary over time, following trends in cumulative cases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This allowed us to build a model of GI that reproduces the observed time series with high accuracy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also find that changes in GI are positively correlated with changes in cumulative cases, both globally and on annual timescales, which indicates that the observed contraction in GI is a global phenomenon.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our findings indicate that real-time monitoring of COVID-19 GI can help public health authorities better understand the COVID-19 pandemic and respond more effectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A method to determine the electronic structure of single dopant atoms in silicon carbide using scanning probe microscopy was presented.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Because dopant atoms have different lattice structure from the host semiconductor, they may offer novel opportunities to investigate quantum systems at low temperature.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we demonstrate this concept of employing an electrically-tunable scanning tunneling microscope (STM) to locally modify the electronic structure of a single atom of SiC.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The application of a rapid voltage pulse modifies the electronic structure of the donor atom such that a distinct feature can be observed in the dI/dV spectrum acquired using the STM.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This approach would enable electrical detection and control of individual dopants in silicon carbide, paving the way for investigations of quantum states in nanoscale devices and development of atomic-scale sensors with these novel properties.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The control and study for individual dopants in silicon carbide (4H-SiC) offers the exciting possibility of tailoring nanoscale devices to have novel quantum properties.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A single dopant atom has been shown to provide an opportunity to investigate a quantum system at low temperature.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, the phosphorus atom is a well-studied donor atom which has been used to demonstrate the spin of a single phosphorus atom electron and investigate electron quantum tunneling in this system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, probing the electronic structure of a single dopant atom in real time with high spatial resolution has remained a significant experimental challenge.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work, we employ a scanning tunneling microscope (STM) to locally modify the electronic structure of a single atom of 4H-SiC.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The modification to the electronic structure of a single atom allows for electrical detection and control of individual dopants in silicon carbide.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As an example, we apply rapid voltage pulses to the STM to locally change the electronic structure of a single donor atom.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A distinct feature in the dI/dV spectrum is observed when the donor atom’s electronic structure is modified.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We characterize the modification of the electronic structure of the donor atom and its influence on the dI/dV spectrum.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This approach allows for electrical detection and control of individual dopants in silicon carbide, paving the way for investigations of quantum states in nanoscale devices and development of atomic-scale sensors with these novel properties.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A growing network is a general network model in which nodes can be in one of several states (such as "alive" or "dead") and can activate (or "arrive") and become nodes of the network according to a scheduling rule.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this model, nodes are allowed to have an arbitrary out-degree which may change over time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this model, we study the maximum in-degree that can be supported for a network whose out-degree is one and nodes arrive according to a Poisson process.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is proven that the maximum in-degree is one if and only if the out-degree is two, and it is two if and only if the out-degree is one and the in-degree distribution is constrained to be delta_0.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In other words, the maximum in-degree is limited by the arrival process and by the out-degree of the network.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, we assume that nodes arrive according to a Poisson process and the out-degree of the network is one.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study the maximum in-degree that can be supported if the in-degree is limited by the out-degree of the network and by the arrival process.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is shown that this maximum in-degree is one if and only if the out-degree is two, and it is two if and only if the out-degree is one and the in-degree distribution is delta_0.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is an open problem to determine the maximum in-degree of other out-degree distributions and other arrival processes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Non-coding DNA (ncDNA) is much more than just "junk" DNA.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Large scale analyses of full genomes has accumulated extensive evidences showing that ncDNA sequences perform many vital functions in the cell, from encoding transcriptional regulatory elements to encoding small RNAs, to forming secondary structures that modulate gene expression and even to encoding entire proteins.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Noteworthy, two recent high-throughput RNA sequencing studies have revealed that up to 98% of eukaryotic genomes is transcribed into non-coding RNAs (ncRNAs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 While the functions of most ncRNAs are not understood, increasing lines of evidence suggest that ncRNAs are vital parts of gene regulatory networks that are crucial for development, cell differentiation, and many other processes in living organisms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In contrast to well-known protein-coding genes, which is usually conserved and rarely mutated, ncDNA sequences show different levels of variation across different species, RNA transcripts, and individuals.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Particularly, a recent large-scale analysis of whole-genome sequences in 1201 human individuals have identified noncoding DNA sequences evolving at significantly faster rates than coding sequences, highlighting the importance of ncRNAs in driving rapid evolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Interestingly, a close observation on various types of sequence variations has found that most of the substitutions that led to amino acid changes in protein-coding sequences were caused by ncRNAs, pointing to the role of ncRNAs in driving rapid evolution and adaptation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this talk, we will present the recent findings on these fascinating aspects of noncoding sequences, and discuss the potential implications of these findings on our understanding of evolution and human health.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, we study simple shear flows in inelastic Maxwell models, where the material particles have pairwise linear forces.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For particular, we consider the constant-shear-stress case.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Through Chapman-Enskog analysis, we obtain a set of nonlinear differential equations for the model-specific distribution functions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For a one-dimensional model, we observe dynamic instability in the form of periodic density waves and calculate the growth rate.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For a two-dimensional model, we show that the Navier-Stokes equation is restored in the large-time and large-length-scale limits.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A novel approach to spectral imaging using stereoscopic vision.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We develop a hybrid differential stereoscopic (HDS) system based upon structured light using two synchronized broadband optical filter liquid crystal displays (LCDs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We apply this system to a spectral imaging modality that uses white light to estimate the spatial temperature profile of a scene.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The approach we present combines the high spectral resolution from multi-bandpass filter spectrography with the wide field of view and high spatial resolution of structured light.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We experimentally demonstrate that HDS allows for measurement of temperature differences as small as 1 degree across a 200 meter field of view with sub-millimeter resolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that with additional processing, this narrowband HDS system has the sensitivity to detect temperature differences as small as 1/1000 of a degree across the same 200 meter field of view.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This approach overcomes several of the limitations of previous narrowband HDS works, such as the Pollefeys et al. system which uses only a single optical filter, or the Huang et al. system which uses high-end filter spectrography but only has a 30 meter field of view.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We believe this work represents a novel method for narrowband HDS that will have significant impact across many scientific and commercial spectral imaging modalities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The properties for the lightest hadrons are among the least comprehended aspects of particle physics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One important characteristic about the pion, the lightest hadron, is its radius.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Measuring the radius would test our understanding of the pion's quantum fluctuations and the nature of the strong interaction.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 I will review recent progress on determining the pion's radius and discuss open questions and potential avenues for future research.

 Pion radius is a characteristic of the pion, the lightest hadron, that remains less well understood than properties of other hadrons.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The radius is related to the quantum fluctuations of the pion, its spatial distribution.

 Pion radius is of particular interest, as it can been used to test our understanding of the strong interaction and the nature of the confinement mechanism.

 Recent progress has been made in determining the pion radius.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A recent proposal for a physical implementation of the quantum NOT gate

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [1] has the potential to enable scalable quantum computing using superconducting qubits, opening the door to the construction of a large-scale quantum computer.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here, we show that the reliability of this physical realization of the quantum NOT gate is ultimately limited by dissipation arising from the preservation of the von Neumann entropy of the quantum system during its dynamics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we find that the infidelity of the quantum NOT gate in this realization, due to entropy accumulation, was constrained to be less than 0.067 over timescales required for quantum computation, significantly outperforming other proposed physical approaches to quantum computing.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This analysis sets a new bar for quantum computing precision that can be exceeded only by approaches based on error suppression by active control.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [1] M. S. Allman, et al., Implementing the Quantum NOT Gate for superconductive Qubits, arXiv:1809.07413 (2018).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 *ACTIVE CONTROL* was used to suppress the accumulation of entropy in our physical realization of the quantum NOT gate, allowing for an error rate less than 0.067 over timescales required for quantum computation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A significant number of galaxies have been detected in the deep field surveys with luminosities far in excess of their estimated star formation rates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These Hyper-Luminous Infrared Galaxies (HyLIRG) are of particular interest as possible probes of galaxy evolution in extreme environment.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For this paper, we study six HyLIRGs with available X-ray data from the XMM-Newton observatory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These include four E+A (post-starburst) galaxies, IRAS F09230– Mo1, IRAS F00183–7 Jam1, IRAS F00397–7537 and ClG J2218.1+0052, and two late-type HyLIRGs, IRAS F00183–7 Jam2 and ClG J2218.1-0053.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 All except IRAS F09230– Mo1 have starburst-driven winds which were well detected in X-rays, but none have elevated absorption, suggesting that the HyLIRG phenomenon may be caused by extreme gas-rich mergers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Comet Hale-Bopp was a remarkable visitor on Earth in 1996.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was visible in the morning twilight for several weeks, captured the interest of the public and press, and was the subject of a large number of studies in all wavelength regions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper we present the results of our study of Hale-Bopp in the mid-infrared.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We observed Hale-Bopp at the NASA Infrared Telescope Facility (IRTF) and the Copernicus Space Observatory in April, May, and June 1996.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From these data we see evidence of polarized light from Hale-Bopp for the first time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our observations suggest that Hale-Bopp is composed of numerous thin, strongly elongated grains of ice which were aligned nearly perpendicular to the orbital plane of Hale-Bopp and its parent nucleus.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results may be explained if the asymmetric ejection of material from Hale-Bopp's nucleus was the source of Hale-Bopp's rotation and orbital angular momentum.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also examine Hale-Bopp's dust coma and calculate its minimum orbit intersection distance (MOID).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the MOID of Hale-Bopp at the time of our observations was approximately 3.2 Earth radii, a value similar to the observed coma size.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We consider implications of our results for models of the formation of Hale-Bopp and its parent nucleus and for future cometary missions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present the results of a spectral index distribution (SIND) analysis of a complete flux-rescaled sample of gamma-ray blazars detected by the Energetic Gamma Ray Experiment Telescope (EGRET) on the NASA Compton Gamma-Ray Observatory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also present a preliminary SIND analysis for the nearly simultaneous 3EG sample.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By contrast to most gamma-ray telescopes, EGRET detected nearly all blazars as highly polarized gamma rays, and nearly all exhibit substantial variability on many different timescales.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Blazars were widely believed to be the brightest class of gamma-ray sources and their spectra are typically well-fitted by a simple power law of photon index around 2.2.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We perform the first SIND analysis on high-energy gamma-ray blazars using a complete flux-rescaled sample selected from the third EGRET catalog and demonstrate that the SIND of EGRET blazars is consistent with a one-dimensional truncated power law with an exponential cutoff.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The slope of the blazar SIND at high energy (E > 100 MeV) is approximately -2.2, while the slope at lower energies is slightly shallower.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The high-energy index is similar as that of the low-energy gamma-ray flux, though with large error bars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also present preliminary SIND analysis of the 3EG data, though the small number of sources and incomplete sampling of the EGRET band limit the conclusions that can be drawn.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The EGRET blazar SIND may hold the key to understanding the high-energy emission process in these objects and their connection to particles in extragalactic magnetic fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The so-called ’dark energy’ was believed to be responsible for the recent acceleration of the universe’s expansion.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Independent observations of this phenomena has only been available since the late 2000s, so when exactly the universe started to accelerate has been a subject of significant debate.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, we use a suite of different datasets to measure the timing of the transition from deceleration to acceleration.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that while there is a high degree of agreement on the average transition time, the precision with which it has been determined is highly dependent on the choice of dataset used.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our findings indicate that cosmologists may have overestimated the uncertainty in the timing of the transition, with the impact on the design of future dark energy surveys being discussed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The acceleration of the cosmic expansion were first observed in the late 2000s, and since then its cause has been a subject of intense study.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Indirect evidence of this phenomenon, based on measurements of the cosmological parameters, only became available during the past decade.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Consequently, the question of precisely when the expansion started to accelerate has been a topic of debate.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper we consider this question using a suite of different datasets, and find that while there is good agreement on the average transition time, the precision with which it has been determined is highly dependent on the choice of dataset used.

 Our findings indicate that cosmologists have overestimated the uncertainty in the timing of the transition, with the impact on the design of future dark energy surveys being discussed.

 Our results were based on recent measurements of the cosmic microwave background (CMB) – the afterglow of the Big Bang – lensing of the background light by large scale structures and direct measurements of the expansion rate of the universe using distant supernovae.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The entire band was divided into two 75.6MHz-wide polarizations which are Nyquist-sampled at 1.2875MHz sample rate.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Each baseband channel is 25.6kHz wide, providing a velocity resolution at 22.1km/s and a temperature sensitivity of -82.6dBm in a single beam.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper we explore the possibility to learn something from the distribution of the biggest fragment in an iron-rich, zirconium rich, 304 stainless steel sample, using artificial intelligence techniques.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The goal is to check if the distribution of the biggest fragment – here named “vital trace” – could been used as a fingerprint to identify the origin of the sample and if it carries information about the processes by which the sample is formed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We run a supervised machine learning algorithm with three classes, namely “iron-rich”, “zirconium rich” and “304 stainless steel”, using as features the elemental concentrations of 26 elements and as target the vital trace distribution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We found that the algorithm was able to learn the differences among the classes and to generate different predictions for the three classes, with an accuracy of more than 70% when using only 10% of the samples to train the algorithm.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also applied a similar algorithm, this time using histological images of burns as input and found that it was also able to learn the difference between “304 stainless steel” and “fire” samples, even using only 3 burns to train the algorithm.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This shows that vital trace distribution could carry information about the processes occurred before the formation of the material.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We believe that this work is a proof of concept that the distribution of the biggest fragment, that could be easily lost during the manufacturing of a material, could carry information that could get used to identify processes occurred before the material formation.

 For the first part of this paper, we introduce a new algorithm that solves the advection-diffusion equation with moving boundaries (i.e. free boundaries).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The algorithm is based on a discrete ordinates approach, using a finite difference method to discretize in both space and velocity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This method is exact if the boundaries are periodic or advected with a linear velocity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that it is also consistent if the advection speed is linearly interpolated between the cell center and the boundary.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In practice, this method is useful as long as the advection speed is not too large, or the spatial resolution is not too poor.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For an example of its application, we simulate the growth of solids in a viscous accretion disk.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We test our algorithm on analytical solutions of the diffusion-advection equation and show that our results are in agreement with the expected analytical solution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We then use our algorithm to study the evolution of solids in a viscous accretion disk with various sets of initial conditions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In all cases, solids cannot reach the central star within a ten thousand year time scale.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the second part, we study the effect of solids on the dust evolution in the disk.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Solids generate a size distribution that differs than that of dust grains.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For particular, solids tend to generate a significant amount of sub-micron sized grains.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The exact form for this size distribution depends on the size and composition of solids.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 During this part, we present several simple models to investigate the influence of solids on the dust evolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that solids with a given size and composition produce different consequences on the dust size distribution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we show that the exact form of the size distribution is of little importance for the dust evolution in the most part of the disk: after about one million year only large grains are present in the disk and the evolution is fully determined by the dust settling and the radial drift.

 We conclude that solids cannot reach the central star within a ten thousand year time scale, but they are a major actor of the dust evolution.

 A new generation of astrophysical electron telescopes, such as the recently-commissioned HESRG, are opening a new window onto particle astrophysics, with the potential to provide dramatic improvements in our understanding of cosmic-ray acceleration, propagation and their myriad effects.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work, we present new HESRG data on the enigmatic recurrent nova RS Ophiuchi, whose 2006 outburst has historically been among the most energetic witnessed in the modern era.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We interpret our data within the framework of nonlinear diffusive shock acceleration (DSA) to cosmic-rays, and we make a number of novel inferences.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the electrons and ions can be well-fitted by a single power-law of common index -2.29 with no indication of any break or steepening at the hadron-to-electron transition, and that their non-thermal emission undergoes a rapid but smooth transition from keV to MeV energy bands.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From comparison with nonlinear DSA theory, we deduce that electrons were most likely accelerated to 300 TeV - 1 EeV via magnetic reconnection events within a high-speed magnetospheric outflow from the binary system, whilst ions are accelerated to 30 GeV - 1 TeV, within a slower but more-diffuse wind.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We finally compare our results to previous predictions from the light-echo observations of the 2010 outburst of RS Ophiuchi - with which we likewise detect non-thermal emission - and find excellent agreement for electron energies but substantial tension for ion energies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We conclude because our results provide compelling new evidence that nonlinear DSA is an enabling paradigm for the acceleration of both electrons and ions to the very-high-energies observed in cosmic-ray sources.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The article aims to overview the recent development in the understanding of cosmological shock waves.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These are fluid dynamic phenomena which occur in an abrupt change of properties of a fluid, usually characterized by a supersonic flow jump.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In cosmology these shock waves appear in the inhomogeneous distribution of matter which leads to the formation of large scale structure.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 There are two distinct types of these shock waves which are discriminated by the velocity of the fluid movement before and after the shock.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Type 1 shocks appear in relatively low velocity flows, i.e., slower than the speed of light.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These shock waves appear in the matter accretion, i.e., the process by which clusters of galaxies formed from small density fluctuations in the early universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These shocks go by names such as sound waves or collapse shocks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They can be described by a fairly simple linear theory, which has been verified against numerical simulations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Type 2 shocks appear in the flow of high velocity gas, i.e., relativistic or transonic motions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These shock waves are more frequent and more interesting to study of the former.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Hubble flow, which is the motion of galaxies relative to the observer, appears as a type 2 shock wave.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Cosmological type 2 shock waves have been invoked to explain phenomena such as the 511 keV line emission from the galactic center, the large scale structure, and the Kolmogorov spectrum of cosmological density fluctuations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent years, there has been a renewed interest in the cosmological shock wave phenomenon.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This is because new observational discoveries such as the 511 keV line, and highly contrasted galaxy clusters have shown the need to go beyond the homogeneous and isotropic cosmological model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the cosmological world, there is more variation in the matter density and velocity fields than what would be expected from a simple homogenous and isotropic model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was now known that type 2 shock waves are generic features of cosmological fluid flows.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Their behavior, however, depends on the features of the underlying cosmology, which can no longer be described by a simple parameterization.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The study of cosmological shock waves requires the use of numerical simulations and increasingly sophisticated analytic methods.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The article was organized as follows.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The theory and observation of type 1 shock waves is presented in section 2.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The formation of large scale structure is formulated as a type 1 shockwave in Section 3.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Section 4 presents an analytic model of type 1 shock waves.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In Section 5, numerical simulations of the formation of structure were reviewed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In section 6, a Type 2 shock wave in the Hubble flow is introduced and its impact on the large scale structure is discussed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Section 7 summarizes these findings.

 Coleman and De Luccia showed that nontrivial topologies with nontrivial first homotopy group allow for Euclidean wormholes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This method of traversing the wormhole requires that the Euclidean path integral is performed across the wormhole, with the traversal switched on at the end of theColeman and De Luccia showed that nontrivial topologies with nontrivial first homotopy group allow for Euclidean wormholes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This method of traversing the wormhole requires that the Euclidean path integral be performed across the wormhole, with the traversal switched on at the end of the wormhole and switched off at the end of the Euclidean universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here I demonstrate that the Euclidean path integral may be performed without reference to a global Euclidean metric, but rather based on a local thermal energy density.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Because the Euclidean wormhole instanton is based on local thermal energy, the traversal of the wormhole may occur at any point along the wormhole without concern for global temperature or topology, and the traversal need only be switched on at one end of the wormhole to be complete.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This allows for tunneling from one topology to another without reference to a global Euclidean metric.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This new version of Euclidean wormholes is also applicable to Lorentzian spacetimes, and so Euclidean wormholes with nontrivial first homotopy group may now allow for traversal from one Lorentzian universe to another without violation of the Coleman-Herman uniqueness theorem.

 A theoretical study of the decoherence of a driven multilevel quantum system interacting with a multi-bath reservoir was presented.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A general description of a qubit-bath model is presented where a reduced density matrix for the qubit is obtained using a hierarchical quantum master equation approach.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our result shows that, under the secular and rotating wave approximation, the reduced density matrix of the qubit converges to a product state for a weak system-bath coupling, which indicates that the qubit state becomes insensitive to its environment.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, for a strong system-bath coupling, we show that the off-diagonal elements of the reduced density matrix decay to zero much slower than the diagonal elements, which indicates that the qubit state becomes entangled with its environment.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our result also shows that the purity of the qubit state decays to one half in a short time for any coupling strength, which indicates the fast depletion of the qubit's quantum information.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We illustrate our theoretical findings using a representative model of a three-level system interacting with a one-dimensional bosonic reservoir, and show that the entanglement between the system and environment becomes stronger as the system-bath coupling increases.

 The W3 giant molecular cloud (GMC) is a prominent region of the constellation Aquila.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Located some 20 kpc away, W3 is one of the nearest grand design spiral galaxies and hosts an extreme cluster of massive young stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Historically, W3 has been used as a prototypical GMCs with significant ongoing star formation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For this study, we present far-infrared and submillimeter data from the Herschel Space Observatory, as well as molecular line and radio continuum data from the data archives, to characterize the star-forming content of W3.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Far-infrared and submillimeter data are an ideal probe for thermal dust emission, which is well-correlated with young stellar populations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that W3 has a bolometric luminosity around 9.5 x 10^9 L⊙ and a total mass of 1.2 x 10^10 M⊙. At a column density of 1.87 x 1021 cm-2, its mass surface density is 221 M⊙ pc-2.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We estimate that W3 has a mass of 250 x 10^3 M⊙ within its estimated star-formation density threshold of 2.2 x 10^4 M⊙ pc-2.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This suggests that star formation is ongoing within W3 but is not significantly active.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this context, W3 likely would not qualify as a typical GMC with significant ongoing star formation, but rather is a very massive, very old (5-10 Myr), quiescent, and extremely dense star-forming region.

 Recently, a number of studies have claimed that the metallicity distribution of the solar neighborhood is non-Gaussian.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, these claims are based on samples with small numbers of stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We determine the metallicity distributions for high-latitudes using data from the Sloan Digital Sky Survey Data Release 12.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The number of stars in our samples are in the range of tens of thousands, and hence we are able to confirm whether the metallicity distribution is consistent with being Gaussian.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We determine the metallicity distributions using the targets' Galactic extinction-corrected photometry and the DR12 of the SDSS.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the metallicity distributions in high-latitudes show no significant differences from those of the whole sample.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The probability that the high-latitude samples and the whole sample are drawn from the same population is larger than 99.99%.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results indicate that the local stellar metallicity distribution is consistent with being Gaussian, and previous studies that claimed non-Gaussian distribution were likely caused by small sample statistics.

 The Laser Interferometer Space Antenna (LISA) will be an orbiting telescope designed to detect weak gravitational waves.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Space-borne gravitational wave detectors are most effective at detecting the most strongly bound systems: supermassive black hole (SMBH) binaries.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Accretion-driven phase relations in such systems can been predicted using mass and angular momentum accretion rates, and when the SMBH mass is measured by other means, such as stellar velocity dispersion or gas dynamics, the most precise tests of general relativity come from LISA's sensitivity to measurement errors of these parameters at the milli-arcsecond level.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we report the result from a three-stage search for SMBHB candidates in LISA data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first stage was a matched filter search using error models; the second was a genetic algorithm search for coherent sinusoidal signals from the LISA data; and the third was a hierarchical Bayesian analysis using population synthesis models for SMBHB populations to quantify the sensitivity of the first two stages to SMBHB signals.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 No significant candidates was found in the three stages of the search, and this resulted in a false alarm rate of less than 1 per billion years.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results place significant bounds upon the space density of SMBHBs and constrain scenarios for their evolution.

 With this paper we present the first evidence of the transverse proximity effect in spectral hardness towards HE 2347-4342.

 Hard x-ray observations of this quasar, performed with the Chandra satellite, revealed a proximity effect typical of a forest of absorption systems along the line of sight.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Potassium-calcium phosphate based optical amplifiers have been recently introduced as a cost-effective alternative to Erbium-doped fiber amplifiers.

 In this paper, the optical properties of Er3+ doped KCa3(PO4)2 glasses, which are promising candidates for the realization of low-cost optical amplifiers, are presented.

 Resolving the spectra of individual galaxies is one of the most promising methods to measure their physical properties, since it would allow to separate starlight from active galactic nuclei (AGN) and potentially to map the spatial distribution of different types of galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Although recent large surveys like the Sloan Digital Sky Survey (SDSS; @SDSS) have provided large samples of spectra of galaxies, their analysis still requires significant effort.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Modeling individual galaxies, on the other hand, is time-consuming, as it requires the knowledge of numerous parameters that describe a galaxy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A combination of the two approaches — a library of synthetic galaxy spectra, which would parametrize the basic properties of galaxies and allow to fit the spectra of individual galaxies, would significantly simplify the process of galaxy spectrum analysis and could be a key to unlock the full potential of current and future spectroscopic surveys, like the Gaia mission.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To this end, we have started building a library of synthetic galaxy spectra, based on state-of-the-art physically-based models of galaxies, which we are making publicly available to the community.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here, we present the first results from the galaxy sample classification based on a Random Forest algorithm, trained on a sample of 3 million galaxy spectra, which we made available together with the library.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that it is possible to separate the library galaxies according to four basic properties: starlight fraction, AGN fraction, the spatial distribution of the starlight and the physical size of the galaxies.

 We also present preliminary results on the preliminary parametrization of unresolved galaxies in the Gaiaspectro library by means of Random Forest regression.

 Theory predicts that stars more massive than about two solar masses may develop degenerate cores, and will consequently become magnetic stars known as Ap stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Observational evidence for such a link, if it exists, could provide strong constraints on stellar evolution models.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we report spectropolarimetric observations on 150 candidate Ap stars belonging to open clusters and associations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We measured longitudinal magnetic fields and from this, assuming the relation between magnetic field strength and rotational spin down rate, obtained estimates of the stellar rotation rates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find a significant anticorrelation between the stellar age and the strength of the measured magnetic fields, such that the most slowly rotating stars have the strongest magnetic fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This is consistent with the existence of a spin-down magnetic field strength evolution timescale of order 10^6 years, much longer than the estimated lifetimes of stars with convective cores.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This is the first observationally-based evidence of the link between magnetic fields and stellar evolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Manganese and other rare earths are examples of impurities that may localize in the interstitial sites of the semiconductor host lattice.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Such defects may form bound states with free carriers - usually referred to as localized charge carriers - leading to the formation of impurity bands.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 While for nonmagnetic impurities the dominant interaction mechanism is the so-called Hunds rule coupling, in the presence of localized magnetic moments of the impurity the Zeeman interaction has to be taken into account.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If both, the localized magnetic moments as well as the carriers are deconfined at finite temperature, we encounter a magnetic impurity band that may exhibit properties characteristic for both, localized and delocalized charge carriers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to understand the nature in the impurity band we study for the case of diluted magnetic semiconductors (DMS) the crossover from localized to delocalized charge carriers via a systematic variation of the Coulomb attraction by the acceptor.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this context the physical concept of Wannier functions was employed to describe the spatial extent and localizability of the impurity band wave functions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Coulomb attraction by the acceptor is modeled by a dielectric background in order to account for the screening behavior of the charge carriers in the valence band.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By comparing calculated optical spectra with corresponding experiments we are able to extract the relevant material parameters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The result of this theoretical study allow to conclude that the acceptor-limited mobilities of the DMS systems can be described by the simple formula σ(cm2/V·s) = (μ0(cm2/V·s) · epsilon(0) · N(D) · N(A))½, where μ0 is the band mobility in the absence of localized charge carriers, N(D) is the acceptor density, and N(A) is the density of donors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Hence, for a fixed acceptor density, the acceptor-limited carrier mobility in diluted magnetic semiconductors are only determined by the density of donors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This fundamental relation has to be considered as a general property of all IV-VI compounds which contain both, magnetic impurities and non-magnetic acceptors.

 The c2d Legacy Project mapped the emission from gas and ice particles frozen onto the surfaces of dust grains in 14 molecular clouds.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In general, the star formation appears to be more extended in Perseus and Ophiuchus than in Serpens, though the signal-to-noise ratio of the data for the former are relatively low.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Perseus and Ophiuchus clouds also exhibit distinctive centrally-condensed structures that did not appear in the Serpens data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, the Perseus and Ophiuchus clouds exhibit clear two-dimensional features that are not present in the Serpens data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Perseus cloud also appears to be undergoing global collapse on large scales, indicated by the central concentration of filamentary structure and depletion of dust mass toward the centers of some of the brighter 1.1 mm condensations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If real, this implies that the star formation in Perseus has recently been even more spatially concentrated than suggested by the Bolocam data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Because the spatial scales sampled by the Bolocam observations are large (0.1-2 pc), the mass of material involved in recent star formation in Perseus is comparable to or greater than the typical mass of gas and dust in these clouds.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Given this, the comparison between the spatial distributions of recent star formation in Perseus and Serpens may not be particularly meaningful.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Fermi’s golden rule (FGR) is an intuitive principle for understanding the rates of quantum system evolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It states that the rate of some physical process is proportional to the second power of the density of states (DOS) of the initial states to final states available in the process.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This proportionality constant is known as the strength of the process.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The rule is exact for weak system-bath couplings.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In molecular relaxation time scale quantum systems, the FGR predicted exponential dependence of the relaxation time on the thermal energy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Experimental verification of this prediction using Infrared (IR) photon emission rates for different temperatures showed the predicted dependence only for high temperatures, while for low temperatures the relaxation time is much shorter than expected.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result was interpreted as a signature of quantum dynamical phase transition (QDPT) in terms of scale-invariant behavior of the system.

 Turbulent flows are often characterized by the assumption of locality, where the kinematics and dynamics are largely separable in space and time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paradigm, fluid motion has decomposed into characteristic modes, or eddies, often arranged into quasi-regular structures such as shears, jets, and fronts.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As an example, in compressible turbulence, these eddies often exhibit a hierarchical arrangement with large-scale structures such as filaments and clusters forming out of the eddies at smaller scales.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This process was often characterized by a power-law scaling, where the size, velocity, density, and temperature of eddies at each scale are related to those at the next smaller scale through a characteristic scale factor.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This phenomenon, known as multiscaling, implies a self-similar structure and has been observed to varying degrees of rigor in a range of physical systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work, we present direct numerical simulations of compressible turbulence at high resolution, focusing specifically on the nature of multiscaling in the scaling regime.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that multiscaling is not as evident as in comparable experimental and Eulerian grid-based simulations, but is clearly present for a range of flow conditions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We posit that this is due to the evolution of multiscaling over time in compressible turbulence, where scaling relationships gradually break down as modes gradually separate through an increasing characteristic time scale.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This process, known in intermittency, implies a negative scaling exponent and correspondingly flatter multiscaling exponents.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We validate this hypothesis through the construction of a multifractal model, and demonstrate that the predicted intermittency leads to a breakdown of multiscaling as the flow transitions from steady to unsteady.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This provides a useful framework in interpreting observations of multiscaling in turbulent flows, and has important implications for the dynamics of clusters in highly compressible

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 turbulent flows such including those arising in the atmosphere and fusion plasma simulations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 In this paper, we study a special case of the quantum walk in which the probabilities of the walker stepping to the left and right is both biased by a factor of alpha in one direction.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The model, referred to as a self-interacting quantum walk, may be realized in various physical systems, such as electrons on a inhomogeneous lattice.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We consider a general initial condition, allowing the walker to have any fractional part, and prove that the quantum walker will settle in finite time into a pure quantum state with real eigenvalue density equal to 1.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also consider the classical analogous of this walk, where at each time step, the walker can choose to step to the left or right with some probability.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Since the classical walk is transient in general, we prove that for sufficiently small alpha, the classical walk will always settle into a periodic configuration.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we present a large deviation analysis of the classical self-interacting walk and show that the walker is most likely to end up in a finite number of cells.'

 This plane invokes minimal assumptions and is thus very robust.

 Ensembles of magnetic monopoles have been widely studied in the literature due to their potential relevance in quantum chromodynamics (QCD), the underlying theory of the strong interaction.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These ensembles provide a framework to explore non-perturbative aspects of QCD that cannot been studied via Monte Carlo techniques.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work, we confine such an ensemble using magnetic monopole solutions of the Bogomolnyi equation.

 These magnetic monopoles are point particles with both electric and magnetic charges.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They couple at the magnetic dipole moment.

 We use a modified Powell scheme to solve the resulting non-linear equation and generate ensembles of monopole solutions.

 Through high-dispersion spectroscopy, we have discovered pulsations in three pulsators: HS 0039+4302, HS 0444+0458, and we examine the properties of pulsators as a group.
