 The pulsators fall into two distinct groups: those with multimodal pulsation spectra, and those with single-peaked spectra.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The former exhibit complex spectra and appear to be multi-periodic; by contrast, the latter are single-mode pulsators with stable frequencies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These frequencies are similar in amplitude and frequency for each pulsator, with variations in peak separation, as well as varying pulsation amplitudes and phases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We posit that these pulsators represent different stages in the same evolutionary channel.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The pulsators with multimodal pulsation spectra are candidates for sdBs in the final stages of merger, prior to the onset of electron degeneracy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We report, as the first time, single-mode pulsation frequencies for three sdBs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These pulsators may represent different evolutionary states of a common progenitor.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find evidence of two distinct types of pulsators in the sdB population.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This discovery adds three new pulsators to the small, but growing, sdB pulsator census, and presents an important opportunity to study the interiors of sdBs, and the evolution of their progenitors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A Branch and Cut algorithm for the Halfspace Depth problem was proposed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The problem was known to be strongly NP-hard.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed algorithm first generates a set of bounding boxes for the input space.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Then, it solves a series of strongly reduced instances by a branch and cut approach.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to speed-up the solving process, the intermediate solutions were cached.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to guarantee the optimality of the found solution, a cutting plane based approach was used.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The performance of the proposed algorithm is evaluated on two large scale aircraft landing problem instances from the CUT willingness to pay dataset.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The obtained results are compared to the best-known solutions obtained from the CUT automated optimisation tool as well as two existing cutting plane based algorithms.'

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Reference: Z. Du, Z. Hu, W. Yang, and J. Cheng.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A Branch and Cut Algorithm for the Halfspace Depth Problem.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A quasar outflow, perhaps powered by a radio galaxy analogue, was identified in the narrow-line region of z = 0.1723 quasar SDSS J154141.33+155426.6.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The outflow has a kinematic width of at least 1000 km s-1, a dynamical mass of at least 1042 M⊙, and was moving at high velocity (v = -0.999995 c, relative to the quasar frame).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The width, dynamical mass, and velocity are all similar to, but slightly lower than, those of broad absorption line outflows.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The narrow-line region gas is asymmetrically distributed around the quasar, with one side closer to the quasar than the other.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The closer side is coincident with the radio galaxy analogue, suggesting that the quasar wind has been partially turned around by the AGN radiation pressure, and is interacting with the radio galaxy host.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The density of the outflowing gas, calculated from the X-ray absorption, is high enough ( approximately 1011 cm-3) to affect the spectrum of the quasar, providing a natural explanation for the unusually blue UV/optical/near-infrared colours of the quasar, as well as the detection of the MgII absorber in previous radio galaxy observations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The paper studies the invariance properties for the linear parabolic equation in n spatial dimensions x'=A(x) under the transformation of the independent variables x and the solutions x, where A is a matrix whose eigenvalues are all zero.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We establish the complete invariance of the Galilean transformation and the scaling transformation, in the case n≥2, and the Galilean invariance in the case n=1.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also establish the invariance under the transformation of the form x→λ(x), where the eigenvector corresponding to the zero eigenvalue of A satisfies λ(x1,…,xn)=0, and the invariance under the transformation xT−x for all vectors x.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By an application of the results, we prove the existence of conservation laws for this equation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With this overview, we survey energy-efficient resource allocation problems in wireless networks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We categorize the solutions of these problems into two main categories: algorithms that optimize a single network objective, such as energy consumption or sum-throughput, and algorithms that optimize multiple objectives, such as energy consumption and fairness.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We survey game-theoretic approaches to solve these resource allocation problems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A game is a mathematical model of conflict between rational agents that each prefer a different outcome.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Game-theoretic solutions for resource allocation in wireless networks assign algorithmic agents (transmitters or receivers) to matchmaking roles that compete or collaborate to settle on a solution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We categorize game-theoretic approaches for wireless network resource allocation in two classes: 1) best-response algorithms that involve only searching through the agent’s own playbook for a best response; and 2) non-trivial algorithms that leverage the underlying game to improve the search for a best response.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We survey approximation and martingale solutions of the multi-agent resource allocation problems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For particular, we survey Lagrangian relaxation, sub-gradient methods, and fictitious play.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we conclude our overview with a survey of emerging research areas for future directions in this field of study.”

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Aerosol optical depth (AOD), SO2, NO2, PM2.5, PM10, temperature, and relative humidity were measured at a urban site in Greater Tokyo, Japan (36.5N 137.5E) from January 2014 to December 2017.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 High-pollution episodes (HPE) is defined as days with PM2.5 concentrations of over 300 μg/m3.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 HPEs accounted for 42% of the total days and were dominant during the warm seasons.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 HPEs had high AOD, high SO2, high NO2, and low wind speeds.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Diagnostics of the dominated aerosol processes revealed that 61% of HPEs are related to secondary aerosol formation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 24% of HPEs are related to re-suspension, 11% to regional transport, and 5% to gas-phase chemical reactions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These processes were more active during winter, indicating the importance of wintertime transport in greater Tokyo.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Analysis of the emission inventories showed that fossil fuel combustion and industrial processes were the primary sources of SO2, NO2, and PM2.5.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Estimated secondary aerosol formation contributed 44% to SO2, 61% of NO2, and 73% of PM2.5.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These processes, along with the high temperature and low wind speeds during HPEs, were major contributors to the high AOD.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The dominant aerosol processes were different from what was observed in previous studies, which were mainly related to regional transport.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This may be because of the different emission patterns and climate conditions in Japan, compared to North America or Europe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Blazars are the most powerful non-active galaxies with their relativistic jets closely aligned to our line of sight.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They are classified in two categories based on the presence or absence of high-energy emission of whose particle accelerators is unknown.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Observational data indicates that the emission is most likely originated near the black hole event horizon, although not all models are able to producing high-energy gamma-rays.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Emission mechanisms from blazars are uncertain.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A popular theory is the Blandford-Znajek process in which the magnetized central black hole powers the jet by extracting spin energy of the black hole.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The original proposal had intended application to weak stellar magnetic fields, however subsequent studies suggest that the fields in blazars can be several orders of magnitude stronger.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Another popular model is synchrotron-self-Compton (SSC) in which synchrotron radiation up-scatters part of its own photons to high energy gamma-rays.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Blazars often exhibit variability across all wavelengths on very short timescales, ranging from hours to days.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Blazars are powerful emitters of radio waves, optical and gamma-rays and this electromagnetic radiation is highly variable.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we show that blazar jets are closely related to the inner regions of their associated accretion disks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Jets appear to be launched from tiny scale inner regions of the accretion disks and strong correlation is found between the magnitude of the disk scale height and the jet power.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Such a correlation was expected in the Blandford-Znajek model and fits well the available data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The article was aimed at a broad interdisciplinary audience, including specialists in plasma physics, black hole physics, relativistic astrophysics and nuclear physics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, we show that superconducting correlations can be induced in a ferromagnetic layer of a superconductor-ferromagnet (S/F) structure due to the proximity effect.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 When a magnetic field was applied to such a S/F structure, nonhomogeneous magnetization occurs inside the ferromagnetic layer.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This gives rise to a Doppler shift of the ferromagnetic resonance (FMR) signal and a superconducting current in the superconductor.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the triplet component of the induced superconducting correlations exhibits a local maximum near the FMR resonance frequency and the magnetic field at which the nonhomogeneous magnetization occurs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results indicate that it should be possible to detect FMR in S/F structures by using the techniques of superconducting spintronics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The full paper "Nonhomogeneous magnetization and superconductivity in superconductor-ferromagnet structures" can be found at https://arxiv.org/abs/1709.07446

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Single crystals of PbZr0.52Ti0.48O3 (PZT) undergo a phase transition from a higher to a lower symmetry phase at around 600 °C.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This structural phase transition is accompanied by a large change in electrical conductivity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It has been shown that the conductivity change can be explained by a change in carrier concentration caused by thermal excitation of deep trapping states.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It has further was suggested that in order to describe the change in conductivity correctly, the distribution of activation energies of the deep trapping states has to be considered.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The traditional method to obtain this distribution is the quasiequilibrium approximation (QEA), which is an assumption on the thermal evolution of the carrier concentration and requires a full description of the carrier diffusion.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here, we propose a method that relaxes the quasiequilibrium assumption and solves the coupled heat diffusion and drift-diffusion equations with the finite-element method.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The obtained conductivity-temperature-relaxation-time-distribution function is in agreement with the quasiequilibrium approximation results for lattice temperatures below around 700 °C.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 At higher temperatures, however, the difference between the two approaches is considerable and increases with temperature.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We argue that this is due to an approximation inherent to the quasiequilibrium approximation and suggest a different approximation that yields results in good agreement with our new method.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A robust developmental program is essential for multicellular organisms to carry out their functions, such as formation of body plans and limbs, and to adapt to environmental change.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we develop a theoretical and experimental framework to investigate multicellular developmental robustness, based on an epigenetic model for gene regulation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The model encompasses, for the first time, the role of cell division in developmental robustness, and our theory and experiments reveal that developmental robustness can arise from a compromise between developmental tempo and program, and between robustness to variability in cell type composition.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using this framework, we identify non-mutually exclusive avenues to improve developmental robustness.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, increases in developmental tempo may enhance robustness; and alternative strategies to increase robustness may be to (i) reduce the influence of noise in gene expression, or (ii) reduce heterogeneity in cell composition.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results establish a theoretical foundation for multicellular developmental robustness, and we propose that our theory should enable further identification and implementation of strategies to improve robustness in synthetic systems and in regenerative medicine.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper we study the problem of finding rational points on elliptic surfaces.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Elliptic surfaces are surfaces of the form y2 = x(x^2 +Ax +B), where A and B are constants, and they can been viewed as minimal models for certain elliptic curves.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finding rational points on elliptic surfaces of this form would give integer solutions to the elliptic curve given by the following Weierstrass equation: y2 = x^3 + Ax2 + B x + C.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This curve has been of interest in the study of QEC, and a proof of its integer points is announced in 2013 by H. Davenport, C. Lewis, and Y. Tang, but this result has not appeared in print to date.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper we announce a proof of this result, and we make available our manuscript in its entirety.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present numerical results on scalar field perturbations from a particle orbiting a rotating black hole.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We evolve the perturbation equations using numerical methods presented by previous work.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We evolve the perturbation equations in 2+1 dimensions in Misner-sharp variables, using an ingoing-null foliation in place of a tortoise-like radial coordinate.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We obtain quasinormal modes (QNMs) for various discrete values of angular momentum, $l$, and charge, $q$, for Schwarzschild black holes and for Kerr black holes with different spin parameters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The frequencies and damping times of QNMs are tabulated.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also discuss the computation for energy and angular momentum radiated in gravitational waves, using a new integral definition of radiated quantities for perturbations of any spin.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we apply our results from scalar field perturbations to an estimate of energy and angular momentum radiated in scalar waves from a particle in circular orbit around a Kerr black hole.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the emitted energy and angular momentum are both negligible compared with the mass and spin of the hole, respectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In experiments with ultracold atoms, quantum mechanics allows for effects that would be reversible in classical physics, such as quantum backaction or measurement backaction.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We observe quantum-measurement backaction of an ultracold atomic gas.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using state-selection spin echos, we detect atoms that experienced a unitary transform associated with the measurement of an operator that has no mean value in the system’s initial state.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We perform a quantum process tomography of this unitary transform and show that our measurements reproduce the dynamics predicted by quantum mechanics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results establish measurement backaction in an essentially pure system and withdB/dt ≥ |h|/τ, where dB is the change in operator expectation values and τ is the characteristic evolution time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results will enable new approaches to quantum control and precision measurement, with potential applications to quantum information and ultra-low light-noise measurements.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We observe quantum-measurement backaction of an ultracold atomic gas.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In experiments with ultracold atoms, quantum mechanics allows for effects that would be reversible in classical physics, such as quantum backaction or measurement backaction.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We perform a quantum process tomography of this unitary transform and show that our measurements reproduce the dynamics predicted by quantum mechanics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In general, quantum backaction occurs when a quantum system responds to a measurement.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Quantum measurement theory describes the statistical relationships of quantum systems and measurements, and the act of measuring an observable affects the state of the system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Measurement backaction occurs when the measured observable has no mean value in the system’s initial state, and it is defined as the rate of change of the expected value of that observable.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It may have a variety of forms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if an operator is the observable of a quantum system, the measured system will become entangled with a meter system in a process called quantum entanglement, and backaction corresponds to how the measured system and meter system evolve together in time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Alternatively, if the operator is a parameter of a unitary transform, backaction could enable control and measurement of the parameters of unitary transforms, for example in quantum process tomography.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Thus far, measurement backaction has only be observed in the presence of quantum entanglement or incoherent forces (e.g., gravity or the spin-force associated with magnetic fields).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We demonstrate measurement backaction by entanglement or additional incoherent forces.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Instead, we observe measurement backaction of an essentially pure system, without loss due to interactions with a large environment.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The dynamics are reversible because our experiment operates near the quantum limit of few-atom systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results establish measurement backaction in an essentially pure system and with dB/dt ≥ |h|/τ, where dB is the change in operator expectation values and τ is the characteristic evolution time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results will enable new approaches to quantum control and precision measurement, with potential applications to quantum information and ultra-low light-noise measurements.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Millisecond pulsars (MSPs) are fast-spinning, strongly magnetized neutron stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Binary MSPs were routinely detected in close orbits about their companion stars, and some of these systems become radio loud due to interaction between the pulsar and its companion star in a process known as accretion disk ablation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The very similar solitary MSPs are much less frequently detected, and have thus far been found in about half of transient gamma-ray bursts (GRBs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These systems, lacking companion stars, are expected to be radio quiet.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we report the detection for PSR J1453+1902, a solitary MSP previously known only at 1400 MHz, for which we obtain a 1.4 GHz pulsed radio upper limit that is more than an order of magnitude deeper than the average of other solitary MSPs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use the Large Sky Area Multi-band Transit Satellite (LSAM).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We compare the upper limit of the radio luminosity of PSR J1453+1902 with the distribution of radio luminosities for the much more commonly observed binary MSPs and find it to be a very high-luminosity outlier.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We therefore suggest that PSR J1453+1902 is the first solitary MSP found in a transient GRB.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Galaxy clusters are the largest known structures of the universe, containing hundreds or even thousands of galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Despite their importance, it is not easy to study the large-scale behaviour of cluster galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Most of the time one has to resort to studying individual galaxies or small samples.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A promising approach is to model the overall galaxy light distribution and use the resulting model to fit the light from distant galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Such an approach is proposed by Falco et al. in 1987 and implemented on large datasets by Gonzalez et al. in 2002.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Since then, several improvements and adaptations to different galaxy samples have be proposed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present the dataset of early-type galaxies in the WINGS clusters, a multi-wavelength catalogue with morphological classification, HST imaging and extensive follow-up data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The dataset has been modelled and fitted using three different techniques: non-parametric SFH modelling, bulge+disk decomposition and semi-parametric Boxy4 modelling.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results indicate that both star formation history and bulge prominence have varied during the lifetime of clusters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A large number of astronomical objects can been identified via their infrared (IR) emission, including YSOs and galaxies, which are often heated by massive stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As a result, the IR spectrum of the sky encodes information about the natal star-formation regions from which these objects arise.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These regions, in turn, dictate the stellar Initial Mass Function and so the number of stars which can form in a given environment.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Masers, in particular, may be of special interest to those studying the early stages of star-formation, as their characteristics (bright-energetic transitions and precise positional counterparts) make them excellent probes of very young regions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 I review the IR environment of 22 water and ammonia masers, associated with the early stages of high-mass star-formation, detected in the course of recent, sensitive IR surveys with the Spitzer Space Telescope.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 I discuss what can be learnt about the natal regions from the spectral energy distributions constructed from the data and suggest how such studies could be extended with future IR facilities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, we generalize the well-known Caldeira-Legget quantum Brownian motion model to an environment with an arbitrary spectral density and an external force.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The spectral density and the external force were both assumed to be general functions of the frequency.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By making use of the generating functional technique, we obtain exact solutions to the corresponding master equations in both the Markovian and non-Markovian limits.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The influences of the general environment and the external force on the quantum Brownian particle is discussed in detail.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Especially, we show that the environment with a constant spectral density and an external force can be treated as a special case of our general model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The influence of the environment with such a special spectral density and external force on the quantum Brownian particle has been investigated in many former literatures, which is therefore contained in our general solution as a special case.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also give a short discussion of the decoherence functional of our model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Optimizing scrip systems have been the focus of both praise and criticism in the cryptocurrency community for several years.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Scrip systems are plugins for cryptocurrency wallets that allow users to make incremental payments to pay people, services, and machines.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Many view scrip systems as a fundamental missing piece to cryptocurrency, enabling practical applications which are difficult or impossible without them.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Scrip systems can automate the task of paying people for things they produce, like content, labor, or data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They may also make it easier to manage large payments or payments to multiple recipients, which can be a challenge with cryptocurrency.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Critics, however, have warned that scrip systems can be vulnerable to crashes, can cause erroneous payments, and can create opportunities for abusive or unethical behavior by virtue of their design.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work, I compare three commonly used scrip systems: Bitwage, Libera, and Wagepoint, and describe several ways in which they could be improved.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 First, I describe design decisions behind each scrip system that I believe could been reconsidered.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Second, I discuss research into alternative designs for scrip systems that I believe will improve security and reliability.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Third, I describe ways in which scrip systems could be designed to reduce the opportunity for abusive or abusive behavior.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 I conclude by describing some ways cryptocurrency projects can adopt and fund this work, through development partnerships or sponsorships.

 A search of the radiative leptonic decay B+ --> gamma l+ nu is performed using a data sample of 672 fb-1 of pp collisions at s∽8 TeV collected with the ATLAS detector at the LHC at the CERN laboratory in Geneva, Switzerland.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 No evidence of this rare decay was found, and limits on the branching ratio were set.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These limits range between approximately 7.1×10-8 at minimum photon energy of 1.6 GeV to 3.7×10-7 at minimum photon energy of 100 MeV, depending on the assumed branching fraction to a specific final state.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These are the most stringent to date.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This research was presented in the paper: B. Tramontano, et al., Search for the Radiative Leptonic Decay B+ --> gamma l+ nu, arXiv:2004.08629

 The analysis focuses on the dimuon decay mode of the winos, resulting in a final state with two oppositely charged muons, at least two photons, and missing momentum from the decaying B+ meson.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recent discoveries of exoplanets has opened a new chapter in the field of astronomy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With the upcoming transit missions such as TESS and PLATO, the number of known planets is expected to increase by several folds in the coming decade.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Most of the known exoplanets are smaller and more dense than our Earth.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 When we look at the data from Kepler, it appeared that the surface of most planets was covered with water.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, when we observe the same planets with more accuracy, we find that the existence of oceans on those planets is uncertain.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 While the technology to detect those planets improves, the tendency of astronomers is to characterize the planet in terms of its atmosphere, not its surface.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This implies that in the future, we might only identify the existence of life, not the existence of surface water.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In other words, we would be oblivious to the existence of most planets.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Dynamical research is a key enabler in the detection and characterization of exoplanets, and this field can significantly benefit from state-of-the-art technologies in computing, data analysis, and system identification.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, we study a one-dimensional quantum dot in the presence of strong attractive contact interactions, which induce a local deformation of the Wigner crystal ground state.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using quantum Monte Carlo and density matrix renormalization group techniques, we determine the ground state energy as a function on system size and deformation amplitude, finding whether the ground state is a stable configuration for any amplitude below a critical value.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We characterize this deformation with a local density profile, from which we compute local charge and bond-order parameters, as well as identify a one-to-one correspondence between these parameters and the underlying deformation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also determine the effects from quantum fluctuations on this deformed state using path integral Monte Carlo and compare our results to large system size quantum Monte Carlo data, finding excellent agreement in the regime of stability.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss the experimental implications for our results and propose directions for future work.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work, we study a one-dimensional quantum dot in the presence of strong attractive contact interactions, which induce a local deformation of the Wigner crystal ground state.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using quantum Monte Carlo and density matrix renormalization group techniques, we determine the ground state energy as a function of system size and deformation amplitude, finding whether the ground state is a stable configuration for any amplitude below a critical value.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We characterize this deformation with a local density profile, from which we compute local charge and bond-order parameters, as well as identify a one-to-one correspondence between these parameters and the underlying deformation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also determine the effects of quantum fluctuations on this deformed state using path integral Monte Carlo and compare our results to large system size quantum Monte Carlo data, finding excellent agreement in the regime of stability.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss the experimental implications for our results and propose directions for future work.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recent advances in computer technology and algorithm development allow molecular dynamics (MD) simulations of strongly coupled dynamical systems over extended periods of time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to monitor the energy and momentum conservation over such long time periods, switchings of various force fields become necessary.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From this work we present a general algorithm for the energy and momentum conservation in MD simulations using force fields with switching potentials.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The general case was considered.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The switching potentials were obtained from analytical solutions of the corresponding equations of motion.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The general solution contains only parameters which have to be fixed by the initial conditions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, the proposed method is easy to apply and inexpensive with computational terms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We illustrate the efficiency of the approach on the example of the Lennard-Jones (LJ) potential.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Applying the proposed algorithm, we obtain the results for the energy and momentum conservation over 600000 time steps of the LJ system with a relatively low cost, which is ~27% of the cost for the same time step with the conventional algorithm.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Researchers have proposed many methods to identify unpopular or dead links on the internet.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These methods can be divided into three categories.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This first category includes machine learning based methods.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These methods train a classifier to identify dead links based on the characteristics of the link and the page it is on.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The second category includes reinforcement learning based methods.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These methods employ an agent to search for dead links by interacting with the network.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A third category includes homophily based methods.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These methods find links to dead and live pages based on their patterns of association.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recently, several research groups have proposed link curation algorithms to improve the quality of dead link detection methods.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Both methods analyze the pages that contain dead links to find similar pages that contain live links.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These live links were used to fill in the dead links.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These methods can be categorized as link replacement algorithms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We propose a vacancy localization algorithm to improve the quality in link replacement algorithms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our algorithm first detects dead links using existing methods and then investigates similar live pages to localize vacancies, i.e., live links that can be replaced by dead links.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The positions of these vacancies is recorded and used by our algorithm to replace dead links with live links.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We perform a large-scale study on the dataset obtained from deadlink detection track of D4M dataset and show that our vacancy localization algorithm improves the overall performance of link replacement algorithms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The simplest model of dark energy with constant equation of state (EoS) parameter equal to -1 is the cosmological constant (CC).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, according to experimental data it suffers from the fine-tuning problem and the coincidence problem.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Many modifications of CC have be proposed in order to solve these problems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One of them are the so called transient acceleration models.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this case, the EoS parameter is time dependent and CC only describes the early stage of the universe evolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The simplest model for this kind is the so called T model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper we consider the T-models with a vacuum component in the dark fluid.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This new model describes the universe evolution in the same way as the T-model but, in addition, it explains the observed accelerated expansion of the universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The article contains the solution of the corresponding modified Friedmann equations and the characteristics of the model evolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Additionally, we present constraints on the model parameters coming from latest observational data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In machine learning, one of the most powerful learning paradigm is ensemble learning where learning algorithm(s) is combined to produce better generalization performance than any of the constituent learning algorithms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Evolutionary algorithms (EAs), especially evolutionary computation (EC) based EAs like Genetic Algorithm (GA), have become successfully applied to many machine learning problems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, we explore the use of EC based EAs like genetic algorithm (GA) to solve the machine learning problem of hyper parameter optimization for ensemble learning.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We design a single GA process to automatically search over multiple hyper parameters (such as number of base learning algorithms, K, and the weight factor for each learning algorithm, w, in a weighted sum of base algorithms) of a given base machine learning algorithm for achieving best generalization performance on the training data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We test this GA based GA (GABGAS) algorithm on five benchmark machine learning problems where GA has not be previously tried.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results show that GABGAS will automatically find good values for K (between 1 and 20) and w (between 0.1 and 0.9) achieving significantly better generalization performance than the best known hand-tuned values for K and w for each of the benchmark problems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also show that GABGAS has significantly lower computational complexity than existing approaches.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Monte Carlo (MC) simulations have been performed to investigate the dynamic response of a silver (Ag) monolayer adsorbed on Au(100) to an oscillatory variation of the chemical potential.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With an increase of the chemical potential, the Ag atoms adsorb at sites with higher coordination, leading to a compactification of the layer.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Upon a decrease of the chemical potential, the Ag atoms desorb, leading to an expansion of the layer.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that the dynamic response of the Ag monolayer is strongly dependent on the heating and cooling rates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, at slow heating and cooling rates, a sizable hysteresis was observed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This behavior was analyzed in the framework of the generalized Lindemann parameter, which accounts for changes in the coordination of the adsorbed atoms upon heating and cooling.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was known that small changes in the chemical potential of components of a complex system may cause large excursions of the correspondingGibbs free energy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Depending on the heating and cooling rates, these excursions can induce dynamic phenomena such as hysteresis.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here, we report the for the first time observation of hysteresis in the dynamic behavior of a Ag monolayer upon an oscillatory variation of the chemical potential.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our findings have important implications for the modeling and interpretation of experimental data, and for the control of surface diffusion in chemical vapor deposition (CVD) and molecular beam epitaxy (MBE) growth processes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The von Karman flow with mass loading is a standard benchmark for studying turbulence.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It consists of an ensemble of non-interacting vortices, with energy concentrated in enstrophy and well-defined packets of each vortex sign.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The vortices are self-similar and exhibit scale-invariance in the high-Cascade regime.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From this paper, we develop a simplified 2D dynamical model that captures the essential features of the high-Cascade state.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The evolution of the vorticity, Omega, is modeled by a diffusion equation with no-flux boundary conditions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Dissipation of enstrophy arises primarily through two distinct processes: direct viscosity, which leads to local smoothing of the vorticity field, and cross-helicity flux, which transfers enstrophy from near-core vortical zones to outer regions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We demonstrate that these two processes lead to a scaling solution with time-independent enstrophy and energy dissipation, in agreement with the dynamical model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We then show that the evolution of large-scale kinetic energy was controlled by the rate at which enstrophy is transferred to the outer regions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We derive an evolution equation for the scale-dependent enstrophy flux and perform a linear analysis to compute the scaling of the flux.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This analysis, which neglects quadratic enstrophy-flux terms, gives excellent agreement with the full dynamical model in the high-Cascade regime.

 This work was supported by the U.S. Department of Energy under award number DE-SC0019468.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Large Magellanic Cloud (LMC) is an dwarf galaxy satellite of the Milky Way, approximately 163,000 light years (56,000 kpc) away from the Galactic Center.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The LMC has a distinct halo of neutral hydrogen gas that extends for many tens of thousands of parsecs (about 160 kpc).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Studying the distribution and characteristics of this neutral hydrogen gas can give us insights into the formation and evolution of the LMC, its halo and the surrounding intergalactic medium (IGM).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Previous catalogs of the LMC neutral hydrogen gas have been based on single dish telescopes with small fields of view.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From this work we present a new catalog of LMC neutral hydrogen clouds using the MeerKAT radio telescope.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This is the largest and most sensitive catalog of LMC neutral hydrogen clouds to date, and may be useful for studies of the LMC impact on the IGM and the structure and evolution of the Local Group.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper we study the cohomology of affine Artin groups.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that the first reduced cohomology group with integer coefficients is infinitely generated.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We give an explicit infinitely generated subgroup of the first reduced cohomology group.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also study the second reduced cohomology group with coefficients in certain finite dimensional representation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We prove that this second cohomology group is zero in some cases, and give an upper bound for it in other cases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As an application we show that the mapping class group of a surface of large genus has infinite cohomological dimension.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also study the cohomology with local coefficients.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We describe the cohomology groups of local coefficients in the regular representation in some special cases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that the local cohomology group with local coefficients in the regular representation is isomorphic to the incidence cohomology of the corresponding Artin group, generalizing the result of Mimura and Toda for the classical Artin groups.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also calculate the cohomology with local coefficients in the standard representation in some special cases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our study of cohomology groups with local coefficients enables us to solve a famous conjecture of Bass on the rank of 2-cohomology groups of arithmetic groups.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 More precisely, we prove if if the corresponding Zariski closure of an arithmetic group has no simple factors of exceptional type, then the rank of 2-cohomology group of this arithmetic group is divisible by 2 and by the constant part of itsbsd fixer.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also discuss the combinatorics on these cohomology groups with local coefficients, in particular the effect of the schensted correspondence on these cohomology groups.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we give a new realization for the canonical mixed building of the special orthogonal group as a non-symmetric space, which enables us to calculate the cohomology of the special orthogonal group using the corresponding result for the orthogonal group.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As a consequence, we give an alternative proof that the special orthogonal group has cohomological dimension 2.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, all representations are complex representations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The cohomology groups with local coefficients studied in this paper are all with integer coefficients.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They can be studied with rational coefficients by a standard localization argument.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we mention some possible extensions of our results to other Artin groups, such as the classical and braid Artin groups.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This paper is joint work by C. J. Delingpole, Y. L. Pan, and Y. Zhou.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Thank you for your interest in our paper.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We hope this paper will shed new light on the study of affine Artin groups and have potential applications to geometric group theory and modular representation theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As this paper presents several new techniques and approaches to existing theories, it will be very helpful to the experts in these fields and will be of interest to the broader mathematics community.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We thus encourage comments and suggestions from both audiences.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We will keep our paper updated with responses to comments and new results while we progress on our research.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Thank you for your interest and support.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With this paper, we propose a novel hierarchical approach for dependability analysis of a commercial cache-based RAID storage architecture.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed approach combines fault detection and isolation techniques from Markov Chain analysis and Bayesian network analysis to evaluate the impact of different types of faults on the availability and response time of the system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The effectiveness of the approach was illustrated using a set of real-world experiments on a high-availability production cluster involving over 2000 virtual machines and hundreds of file transactions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results show that a large number of faults can occur without any adverse impact on the availability of the cluster.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Furthermore, the response times in the system are also unaffected by many of the faults that occur.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, a large number of faults can affect the response time of the system and this can have a significant impact on the overall user experience.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using the proposed approach, we are able to identify and quantify these faults and their impact on the dependability of the cluster.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A diagrammatic category for the representation theory of U_q(sl_n).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This defines a compact closed structure on the equivariant K-theory of a nilpotent Hamiltonian reduction, generalising the Springer correspondence and its recent categorical extensions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the combinatorics of lattice paths, it allows for a uniform treatment of (a) type A, (b) type B, and (c) arbitrary quantum groups.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 There are several exciting applications of this in the form of conjectural categorifications of classical multiplicative preSchur functions, and generalised Kazhdan-Lusztig polynomials.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Applications to finite type representations, categorified combinatorics, quasihereditary modules, and quantum groups will appear in later work.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The diagrammatic category under question is the path category P(N-1, N) of the symmetric Laplacian; this gives it a uniform treatment of types (a) and (b) (as well as (c) when N is a integer).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present a model for QCD at high density and large quark mass which will explain the quantum Chromodynamics (QCD) phase diagram.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The model is built around an infinite dimensional Polyakov gauge theory that reduces to N coincident 1+1 dimensional SU(N)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Yang-Mills theories at high temperature, to N coincident 1+1 dimensional U(1) gauge theories at low temperature, and to three spatial dimensions at infinite temperature.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The parameters in the model are the temperature T, the quark chemical potential mu, and the temporal extent of the 1+1 dimensional theory L(T).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We obtain three phases as T is decreased: a high density deconfined phase at low mu and high T, a confined low density phase at high mu and low T, and a crossover phase in between.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The confined phase at high mu was expected to have a dual description in terms of a superconductor at low temperature.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The model provides a plausible scenario for the continuous crossover between these phases as T is decreased.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The stability of shock waves in a transonic gas flow was studied.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The inviscid and isentropic case is solved and a transcritical shock wave is found to be most unstable.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The result was confirmed by a stability analysis for viscous shock waves, which are shown to be stable for all possible wave numbers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The stabilizing effect of viscosity was discussed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The equations of isentropic gas dynamics in one spatial dimension reduce to a nonlinear wave equation for the pressure in case of inviscid flow and to a semi-linear degenerate hyperbolic equation in the viscous case.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A shock wave is thus stable to viscosity for the inviscid case and stable for all wavenumbers for the viscous case.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results are of interest in several areas of astrophysics and gasdynamics, where shock waves appear as a result of e.g. nucleosynthesis or star formation, and viscosity can be an important effect.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Stars throughout their evolution exhibit a wide range of magnetic field topologies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The evolution of magnetic fields have been relatively understudied in comparison to the evolution of other stellar properties such as mass, radius, and rotation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To study the field’s evolution, we analyzed high-resolution, spectropolarimetric observations of five active magnetic stars in the upper main sequence.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The five stars were chosen because they span a range of effective temperatures and characterize a variety of surface field strengths.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The majority of the sample exhibit predominantly radial fields with small-scale irregularities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Two stars, HD 485A and HD 37402, have dipole fields with stable emission cores.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The remaining star, EK Cep, exhibits a highly complex, non-axisymmetric magnetic field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This star also exhibits a long-lived emission core within its longitudinal field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the distributions of the different field topologies across the sample are statistically indistinguishable.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We observe dipole fields with stable emission cores across the sample, even in the rapidly rotating HD 37402.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We discuss the implications of these stable dipole fields on mass-loss rates and angular momentum evolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Costas property (CP) of the unit circle, also known as the circular rotation property, states that the complex exponential function Θ(t)=e^{it}, where i is the imaginary unit and t is a real number, rotates through 2π radians or 360 degrees when operated on around the origin.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This article generalizes CP in the following way: let f be a differentiable function that is injective on an open interval I with endpoints a and b, such that f'[a]≠0 and f'[b]≠0.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Then, given all t in I, the equation f(x)=t has at most two solutions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The authors call a function that satisfies the preceding conditions CP-generalizing.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A number of properties of CP were inherited by this general definition.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For particular, the constant function f(x)=c is CP-generalizing for any real number c.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The authors give a number of examples of functions that are CP-generalizing but do not share any other properties of Costas functions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The article concludes on several open questions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A simple phenomenological model is presented to interpret the cosmic-ray electrons (CRe) electron spectrum in the galaxy cluster Sersic 159-03 discovered by the the Fermi-LAT.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is shown that both the gamma-ray flux and the radio upper limit can be well accounted for if the spectral break of the CRe spectrum is below the energy threshold of the radio telescope used (1.5 PeV).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Compared to hadronic models which suffer from the extreme high density discrepancy problem, this model would naturally explain the relatively low gamma-ray luminosity for the observed hard X-ray tail while keeping most of the CRe population in the halo of Sersic 159-03.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The model is also shown to be compatible with the tentative detection of the lepton asymmetry between the north and the south of the cluster.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we briefly discuss the detectability of such a model with the current and future IACTs and CTA.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In astrophysics, rotating black holes (BHs) are a source of observational signatures across all length and time scales, from gamma-rays to radio to optical bands.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The most readily observable manifestation of a rotating BH is the apparent ellipsoidal modulation of the light of the companion star passing behind it, as seen in an astronomical object known as an X-ray binary.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Such an X-ray binary comprises a normal star that forms a close binary with a compact object, a black hole or a neutron star.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This normal star is surrounded by an accretion disk that is fed by the normal star's winds and ejects the matter of the stellar envelope into space, forming an X-ray binary system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If the compact object is a rotating black hole, the surface of the black hole will be disrupted by frame dragging, resulting in a large-scale magnetic field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This magnetic field can warp the trajectories of particles in the disk, causing them to precess.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The closer the companion star is to the black hole, the more powerful the magnetic field was expected to be.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This allows us to potentially measure a black hole's rotation rate.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Interstellar dust is composed of a wide variety of submicron sized carbonaceous and siliceous grains arising from different types of parent bodies with a composite size distribution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The smallest observed interstellar grains, with a minimum size of 4.6 angstroms, are most likely arising from low temperature carbonaceous asteroids.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The majority of interstellar grains, with a radius of 0.1-0.3 μm, have most likely sporadic formation from carbon rich gas clouds or volatilized polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 While the sizes of the majority of the observed interstellar grains range from 0.1 to 0.3 μm, they appear to have an arbitrary cut off around 1 μm, with a probable aggregate of denser aggregates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The characteristic sizes for these aggregrates ranges from 0.3 to 1 μm.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is not clear if these aggregates form through agglomeration or some other process.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, the surfaces of these aggregates are coated with a thin layer of polar non-volatile material that provides a second cross-section of hydrogen bonding sites.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is believed that this layer of non-volatile material provides the cementing mechanism for the aggregates, binding them into larger structures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The typical size of these structures ranges from 0.5 to 5 μm with a preferred size of 2 μm.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The dominant composition of these larger interstellar grains is likely going from silicate cores to graphite overlayers as this provides a high transparency to infrared radiation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The abundance and size distributions in globular clusters (GCs) are key diagnostics of the formation processes of galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 GCs are primarily old, self-gravitating systems around stars, thus providing a fossil record of the star formation events that gave rise to their constituent members.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As such, the GC systems (CGCS) of galaxies offer a valuable tool with which to study the formation and evolution of galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study the CGCSs in 13 massive, X-ray selected, optically dull galaxies (SDGs) with masses 1.3 - 4.5 x 10 11 M⊙, redshifts z = 0.02 - 0.33, and 13 - 105 Gyr of age using Hubble Space Telescope (HST) WFC3/G band images.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that 7 of these SDGs exhibit bimodal or multimodal GC systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We compare our observational results to predictions of the classical early-major merger scenario, the delayed-merger scenario, and a novel merger-binary-spiral-component scenario.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We argue that the SDGs likely formed through a variety of pathways.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In low redshift, these pathways included major mergers of comparable-sized galaxies, as well as more minor mergers and accretions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 At high redshift, SDGs likely experienced more minor and major mergers, as well as purely dry minor mergers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, we suggest that the late-stage mergers of gas-rich spiral galaxies formed the dense central GC systems of the SDGs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The lack of strong rotational support in the nuclei of these galaxies likely reflects the gas-richness of these mergers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For this scenario, we expect to find kinematic signatures of recent or ongoing major dry mergers in galaxies with predominantly diffuse GC systems, and we identify 3 such galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using our spatially resolved color data, we show that both the SDGs and their constituent GCs have intermediate-age to old stellar populations, with the fraction of young stars increasing with distance from the center of the galaxy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the spatial distribution of the GCs is more extended than that of the old stars and that the GC systems exhibit truncation radii (average projected distances within which half of the GC system’s GCs were found) and power-law slopes consistent with the predictions of recent major merger and purely dry minor merger scenarios, respectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We argue that this suggests that either a major merger or a purely dry minor merger has already occurred within the truncation radii of at least 5 galaxies.

 By February 24, 1987, the smalland the Sun were close to coincide in the sky.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Consequently, SN 1987A was easily visible with the optical telescopes and appeared as one of the most intensively studied supernova since.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 observations by the Chandra X-ray Observatory confirm the explosion center location as inferred from optical observations and provide the first reliable measurement of the physical extent of the supernova shockwave.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The derived angular size is 0.5 milli-arc-seconds and the blast wave is radiating at approximately 1053 erg/sec.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These measurements provide key constraints to the properties of the supernova shockwave and the material between the star and the shockwave at the time of the explosion.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Supernova 1987A was a typical Type II supernova.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Early spectra showed strong lines from the H and He nuclei.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As the ejecta expanded, the lines evolved into features from stripped nucleons.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 (In Type II, the star will not become a neutron star.)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, the spectrum became featureless in late times, revealing the nature of the exploding star.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Supernova 1987A was extraordinary because it was within 50 parsecs of the Sun and was one of the closest Supernovae to Earth in nearly two decades.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Consequently, details of the shockwave propagation and the early emission could be studied in great detail.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The blast wave reached the center on the star in under 20,000 years (the time it took the light to reach Earth).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The derived explosion energy is 1053 ergs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first X-ray emission was observed 390 days after the explosion.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was a faint point source, much dimmer than the stellar optical emission.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As the shockwave propagated, the radio, optical and X-ray emission increased in intensity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 On day 800, the X-ray flux was 8 x 10^-17 W m-2.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As the optical emission peaked, the X-ray emission was 5.5 x 10^-17

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 W m-2.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The light curves show a slower rise for X-ray than for optical and radio.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The peak optical and radio fluxes was reached around day 400, whereas the peak X-ray emission was reached around day 800.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With rapid increase of human population and development of industry, water shortage was becoming a critical issue for human beings.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is estimated that by 2025, about 58.5 million people will be affected by water stress.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By addition, most of the world’s population relies heavily on fossil fuels to meet their energy needs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This trend of energy consumption can significantly increase greenhouse emissions and global climate change.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These factors raise the question of how to use water and energy from the air, which is the most abundant substance in the universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Water vapor is the most abundant solute in the atmosphere, and can be captured with existing technologies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The captured water vapor can be used for numerous beneficial applications, such as: production of fresh water, production of hydrogen fuel, and etc.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This process can been implemented at a large scale and is economically feasible.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Meanwhile, the captured energy can be used to vaporize the water and generate green electricity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Thus, the dual use of water and energy from the air can significantly alleviate water shortage and decrease carbon emission simultaneously.

 Theory of Two-Photon Interactions with Broadband Down-Converted Light and Entangled Photons entangled photon pairs produced by spontaneous parametric down-conversion (SPDC) are widely used for demonstrations of quantum non-locality and quantum entanglement.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 SPDC, which was also known as frequency down-conversion, occurs when a single mode of the electromagnetic field is excited in a nonlinear crystal to produce photons of different frequencies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Two photons produced by SPDC have some unique properties, such as correlated amplitudes and phases and anticorrelation of their frequencies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These properties can be used for quantum information processing and communication.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, two-photon interference based upon these properties is difficult to perform.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, we propose a theory for two-photon interference based on broadband down-converted light and entangled photons produced by SPDC.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use a general model that can describe two-photon interference with broadband down-converted light and entangled photons.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This model can be used to simulate and optimize the setup for two-photon interference with broadband down-converted light and entangled photons.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We derive a phase-matching condition, which limits the frequency range for SPDC.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also introduce broadband down-converted light generated by quasi-phase-matching and describe the down-conversion processes in the bandwidth limit.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present the theory with detailed calculations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Heterogeneity and increasing returns can drive socio-economic transitions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Industrialization often begins on the periphery of a system, where diseconomies of scale are present, but centralize when innovations enable improvements in scale efficiency.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Increasing returns can drive centralization.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Another example is the Industrial Revolution, where major innovations included the steam engine and factory production, combining heterogeneous components.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Concurrently, emerging market indicators point toward increasing returns in several sectors, including transportation, finance, and waste management.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These increasing returns may reflect granular heterogeneities, e.g. in the transportation system, where shorter distances and broader networks of roads and airports may present increasing returns.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These heterogeneities may interact with innovations, as improved transport and communications reduce the costs of scale improvements.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These interactions may lead to systemic transitions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Applying these ideas to historical systems, this paper suggests that the Industrial Revolution began in the periphery of Europe, with significant improvements in transport and communication that enabled the adoption of the steam engine and factory production.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Conversely, emerging market transitions often begin in the interior, where innovations appear local, but are generalizable across the system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These interior transitions present increasing returns, but eventually lead towards system-wide adoption.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These ideas may also explain the challenges of incumbent economic sectors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This dynamic can explain the successes and failures of incumbent companies, as their focus on incumbent improvement delays but does not prevent systemic transitions.

 Recent infrared surveys have uncovered a population of brown dwarfs with effective temperatures greater than 1300 K, for which previous detection techniques in the optical and visible are insufficient.

 We have performed new broad-band Y, J, H, and Ks photometry of the Pleiades open cluster, spanning 5-22 μm and including two newly identified members of this young coeval population near the TWA moving group boundary.

 This model presented has no discrete symmetries, and is hence potentially realistic.

 It provides a self sustaining late-time cosmology that can explain the near epoch expansion of the universe, and naturally generates small density inhomogeneities without the need for a cosmological inflationary period.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Simultaneously, other events took place in the scientific community, such as the reemergence of smallpox for the first time in over 20 years.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
