 Intercalation of potassium in graphite represents a promising approach to develop an efficient next-generation energy storage device.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, it remains challenging to achieve both high storage capacities and practical electrode potentials.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we perform a comprehensive first-principles study on the structural, electronic, and dynamical properties of potassium intercalation in graphite.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our main findings are the follows: (i)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The graphite intercalation compound (GIC) forms via one-pot synthesis and chemical vapor deposition, in which potassium atoms adsorb onto defective graphene layers between two graphite sheets.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 (ii) Intercalation occurs with significant changes in the graphene structure or lattice parameters, but induces a sharp increase in the C—C bond length by as much as 0.39 Å. (iii) Potassium incorporation leads to a large decrease in the conduction band minimum of graphite, but only causes a small and highly dispersive increase in the valence band maximum.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 (iv) The dynamical stability of potassium intercalated graphite is significantly improved by eliminating interactions between potassium and the defective graphene layers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our findings provide new design strategies for potassium-graphite intercalation batteries, and promote the development of novel two-dimensional materials for energy storage.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Falicov-Kimball model (FKM) is an important model in the study of Mott transition and thus superconductivity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The model consists of electrons and spin-less fermions called slave bosons that interact through an onsite repulsion.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work, we construct a slave boson theory of the extended FKM, which includes additional hopping and onsite repulsion terms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The theory was shown to be a well-defined effective low energy theory of the half-filled repulsive Hubbard model on a triangular lattice.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We apply the slave boson theory to study the model away from half filling as well as at half filling.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the half filled case, we find two phases: an insulating phase with charge density wave order at small parameters, and a trivial superconductor phase at large interactions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With finite but small dopings, we observe a Beresinskii-Kosterlitz-Thouless transition and a crossover between the insulating and superconductor phases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With large dopings, we find a first order Mott transition separating the uniform metal and a density wave state.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We conclude that slave boson theory provides a consistent low energy description of the extended FKM for all values of the parameters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recent studies have shown that the iron Kα spectral line is emitted from regions close to the supermassive black hole (SMBH) in active galactic nuclei (AGNs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Timing studies of this emission can, in principle, yield information on the geometry and velocity field in the immediate vicinity of the black hole.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By combining X-ray timing and continuum timing observations of the Seyfert galaxy NGC 3783, we demonstrate the existence of a correlation between the X-ray flux and the high-frequency (milliseconds) X-ray variability time delays.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This correlation is consistent with reflection-based models for the X-ray emission, in which the X-rays incident on the accretion disk are scattered into our line of sight by cold electrons in a corona that surrounds the disk.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We further demonstrate that the iron Kα emission is consistent with being emitted within a few gravitational radii of the black hole, lending support to the hypothesis that the X-ray flux is modulated at the black hole's fast-spinning rates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results demonstrate that X-ray timing observations can, in some cases, provide unique insight into the physical processes occurring close to supermassive black holes.

 A sample of protostellar jets from data obtained with Spitzer is presented.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The data show that many pre-main-sequence stars with ages of a few million years are active, showing rotation rates up to 0.4 days and coronal temperatures above 4,000 K. A few stars show much faster rotation, up to 3.2 days, suggesting the presence of fossil magnetic fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The presence of angular momentum was often not correlated with accretion rates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One protostar, L1527 IRS, exhibits both low accretion and slow rotation, suggesting that it has nearly fallen into the starhood.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Two similar objects, L1535 IRS and TMC1A, exhibit much faster rotation, consistent with their earlier status as potential stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Another interesting object, the Classical T Tauri star RY Tau, shows variability in its inferred magnetic field orientation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This could imply that accretion and rotation are variable on short time scales.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The data suggest that most protostars accrete gas at a relatively constant rate, but about one-third spin up significantly due to disk-averting winds or mergers with other prestellar cores.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, we propose a fully differentiable convolutional neural network (CNN) model that can approximate arbitrary two dimensional (2D) path curves.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The model, referred to as 1-layer Excitable CNN (ECC), only consists of a single layer of 1D CNN, with the convolution filters shaped in a particular fashion so as to excitable.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Like existing 2D path curve approximation methods that typically require multiple layers of convolutions and nonlinearities, ECC only requires a single 1D CNN layer.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that the 1D filters in the 1st layer of ECC are actually hyperbolic tangent functions (HTF) and that by proper initializations, the 1D representations of different 2D path curves generated from ECC all collapsed into a single 1D band after a few singular value decompositions (SVDs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Through carefully studying the SVD factors, we are able to identify the number of factors to equal the number of path points in a path, and thus ECC was was viewed as a dynamic lower dimensional Hankel matrix completion method.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We further propose the path evolution strategy to use this implicit representation to generate 2D path curves, achieving smooth path evolution and thus path curvature.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We demonstrate that 1-layer ECC is capable of approximating complex path curves with high fidelity, even those with very thin or sharp turns.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that ECC, with its single layer representation, is much more efficient and has much less parameters than existing 2D path curve approximation methods.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also conduct thorough experiments to analyze the influences on various factors on the path curve approximation performance of ECC.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With the 1-layer ECC model and the path evolution strategy, we build an automatic path approximation pipeline which is easy to train and robust to various path types.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that our pipeline is effective on multiple public benchmark path datasets and that it can even generate better results than existing methods on some difficult path datasets.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We would like to take this opportunity to express our sincere gratitude to the authors of [1] for their inspiring work on designing 1D CNN filters that can excitable, to the authors of [2] for introducing the SVD technique into neural networks and providing a rigorous and comprehensive SVD analysis of ECC, and to the authors of [3] for their seminal work on Dynamic Time Warping (DTW) and the development of the Lyre tool that is indispensable to our path curve evolution and alignment algorithm research.

 Topological cluster classification, which organizes clusters according to the topology they possess, has proved to be very useful for understanding phase diagrams and for capturing phase coexistence.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, we present a topological classification of clusters in condensed phases, where the global symmetries of the system is taken into account.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We illustrate our method in applying it to several important types of clusters, such as islands, stripes, and bubbles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Furthermore, we show that our classification has direct physical interpretations, connecting the different classes to different phases, including solid, smectic, nematic, and cluster phases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As an example, we apply our classification to the rich phase diagram of the easy-plane anisotropic Heisenberg model, where our analysis explains recent numerical work on the nature of cluster phases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Overall, our classification provides a natural way to organize clusters in condensed phases according to the phase in which they occur.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This can be of great utility for understanding phase diagrams and for capturing phase coexistence.

 VCS 0413-647, also known as 3C 49, BL Lac, and TNuna, is a well-known compact steep spectrum radio source (CSS).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Over the years, VCS 0413-647 has displayed a relatively constant intemperal brightness, yet various studies have shown it to be variable at all wavelengths.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here, we present the results from a large multi-wavelength observing campaign on VCS 0413-647 in 2017.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Optical and near-infrared observations were obtained with the Keck II telescope and the Very Large Telescope (VLT), respectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 X-ray and gamma-ray observations were obtained with the Neil Gehrels Swift Observatory and the Large Array, respectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Radio observations were obtained with the Karl G. Jansky Very Large Array, the Australia Telescope Compact Array, the phased VLA, and the Molonglo Observatory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present the results of our milliarcsecond-scale radio imaging study of VCS 0413-647.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our observations showed a core-jet structure with an angular separation of 0.15 mas (or ~8.6 light-years at the redshift of the source, z = 0.0812) between two blobs aligned with the jet.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This structure, along with changes in total flux density, brightness temperature, polarization, and morphology, confirm the variability seen at all wavelengths.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We interpret the variability as a possible change in Doppler factor, θD, caused by apparent superluminal motion of the blobs at ~0.15c.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The work function is the energy required to remove an electron from a material surface.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The work function is an important physical property of a material, as it influences the efficiency of electron emission and deposition, the electric field needed to remove electrons from a surface, and the stability of a surface.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The work function is not itself an observable, but it may been computed from density functional theory (DFT) or related calculations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the case of metals, the work function was generally thought to be related to the band structure of the material near the Fermi level.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The determination of work functions is often part of the characterization of electronic materials.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is well known that the work function of a metal strongly depends on the crystalline orientation of the material.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, it was not clear how the work function is affected by the chemical composition of the material, or how it compares to the band structure of the material.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here, we report a new method to calculate the work function for crystalline materials from first principles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our method, developed for the particular case of photoemission experiments, is based on the effective-mass approximation and relies on the calculation of the average electrostatic potential at the surface of the material.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We demonstrate the applicability of this method to a broad range of materials, and find that the work function can be up to 1.5 times larger than the band structure-derived approximation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We discuss physical implications for our results and suggest possible improvements to the current methods for calculating the work function."

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One of the key questions in studies of star formation in the local universe is the overall star formation rate (SFR), which can been measured by the luminosity of ionizing radiation from young, hot stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Such studies are typically performed at high redshifts, using rest-frame far-ultraviolet (FUV) emission from young stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Because the FUV spectral energy distribution (SED) varies with the type of stars and their age, the SFR can be measured by fitting the FUV emission with population synthesis models.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This permits studies of star formation over the past 8-15 billion years, but the accuracy was limited by our poor knowledge of the SFH over much shorter timescales.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we present an analysis of recent data by the Galaxy Evolution Explorer (GALEX) that provides an accurate measurement for the SFR for the past 3 billion years, based on the luminosity of Ly-alpha radiation from young, cool stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Unlike FUV radiation, this "visible" light varies with the instantaneous rate of star formation, making it a "flashing light" tracer of current SFR.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using our analysis techniques, we find a current SFR of 5.9 (± 2.3)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 × 10−3 solar masses per year in the local universe, 90% of which occurred in the past 3 Gyr.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By comparing this with an older (13.7 billion year) estimate based on the evolution of the solar system's gold content, we conclude that the current SFR in the local universe is comparable to that of the last several billion years.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results provide crucial new constraints for models of star and galaxy formation in the universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Type Ia supernovae (SNe Ia) have become used as "standard candles" to study the expansion history of the Universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The current leading survey to discover thousands of SNe Ia is the Canada-France-Hawaii Telescope Supernova Search (SNLS), which are targeting 7.5 deg2 area in distant Universe

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With the discovery of SNe Ia at such high redshifts, it should be possible to measure the dark energy properties with unprecedented precision.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The LSST, which is projected to discover tens of thousands of SNe Ia in 10 square degrees by 2021, is expected to dramatically improve the measurement of the dark energy parameters

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To achieve the optimal science return for these future surveys, it is essential to measure the structure growth rate from redshift 7.5 to 10 accurately.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This requires much larger galaxy surveys in the near-infrared (NIR), and breaking the *visibility period gap with NIR galaxy surveys will become a high priority for SN cosmology research.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From this work, we measure the galaxy clustering rate using BOSS DR12 galaxy samples in three non-overlapping regions of the LSST visible footprint, and demonstrate the feasibility of the proposed NIR galaxy clustering measurement from BOSS DR12 by testing the impact of systematics from the light-to-number count relation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the uncertainty from this relation is smaller than 0.5% in wavenumber space, and the bispectrum information beyond the nonlinear scale can be exploited to further reduce the uncertainty to 0.1%.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We forecast the uncertainty in using BOSS DR12 in the LSST full footprint by combining three regions with these NIR constraints, and find that the galaxy clustering measurements can achieve 1% precision at nonlinear scales (0.2% at one eighth of the nonlinear scale) in the dark energy analysis with only 25% more galaxies than the BOSS DR12 clustering measurement alone.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also show that combining the BOSS DR12 clustering measurements with the baryon acoustic oscillation (BAO) measurement from the planned SPHERIC power spectrum measurement can significantly tighten the dark energy constraints, and the parameter errors can be decreased by a factor of two compared to using the BOSS DR12 clustering measurement alone.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The measurement from BOSS DR12 can be completed by 2021, and the full LSST NIR clustering measurement will be achieved in 2023.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The NIR galaxy clustering measurement from BOSS DR12 would provide strong synergy to the optical SN Ia measurement from the LSST, and significantly improve the dark energy measurement with the next generation cosmological surveys.'

 We present results for modelling the early behaviour of the 2006 outburst of the recurrent nova RS Ophiuchi using a 1D, spherically symmetric, hydrodynamical code.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Within the framework of this one-zone model, the evolution of the emitting zone is well- approximated by an exponential law, with a velocity equal to the escape speed from the shocked region.

 Graph codes are a powerful family for error-correcting codes that find many applications in storage, transmission, and computation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For high performance, usually high rate codes are desired.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 But for high rate codes, maximum a-posteriori (MAP) decoding (optimized for maximum likelihood (ML) decoding) often requires large graph sketches that cannot get stored or transmitted efficiently.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we consider codes optimized for source/channel coding and binning.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We introduce the concept for graph codes that are optimal for source/channel coding and binning (called cCBC-optimized graph codes).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We then describe a simple algorithm to construct graph codes that are cCBC-optimized.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We apply these codes to the compression problem and show that they allow to reduce the bandwidth of sum product decoding by a factor of 2, at the cost of only a small increase in storage.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also apply these codes in the problem of shaping and show that they allow to reduce the buffer size of list joint source channel coding by a factor of 2, at the cost of only a small increase in computation.

 Star-forming galaxies are believed to evolve along a typical sequence from warm neutral medium (WNM) to CNM to HII regions.

 Thus, study of their composition across these different phases can help to understand the evolutionary sequence.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Thus, they are an ideal tracer to explore the different components of a galaxy.

 Long-range order is a central phenomenon of condensed matter physics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was commonly believed to be limited to spatially periodic systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we report on the spontaneous formation of magnetic order in the ground state of quasi-one-dimensional Heisenberg quantum antiferromagnets, in a range of parameters inaccessible by classical simulations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The onset of long-range order is signaled by a sharp rise of the sublattice magnetization, followed by a slow convergence to the saturated value.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This behavior was well captured by high-order coupled-cluster calculations, which demonstrate that long-range order can also occur in systems without true long-range order at finite temperature.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results open new avenues in experimental studies of one-dimensional quantum many-body systems and beyond.

 [nicrome] and Fe XII 525.0 nm lines with Solar Broadband Telescope and in HXR with Gamma-Ray Burst And Afterglow Spectrometer (GRAB).

 The recent discovery of the Schrödinger Greene method (SGM) for calculating holographic entanglement entropy (EE) in vacuum gravity backgrounds has led to the formulation of a covariant holographic entanglement entropy proposal (CHSMEE).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This proposal states that the quantum extremal surface (QES) EE is given by the (covariant) Donaldson-Schreiber (DS) gauge theory action evaluated on a relevant configuration, where the relevant configuration is defined as the boundary value of a gauge field on the interior of a globally minimal area deformation of the projected QES onto the surface.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Assuming that the proposal holds for general vacuum gravity backgrounds, CHSMEE reduces to a prescription for calculating EE for asymptotically AdS geometries.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposal is applicable in holographic theories with a Lagrangian description, and, at least in minimal surfaces examples, yields results that agree with direct calculations of EE from QES wavefunctions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposal also possesses a consistency requirement that the EE found this way is a property of the CFTstate and is independent of how the QES is constructed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper we apply the proposal to various examples, including a toy model, and find that in all cases the proposal yields results that agree with direct calculations from QES wavefunctions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Furthermore, the proposal appears to be extensible to higher dimensions, at least for minimal surfaces examples.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss how the proposal can get extended to EE of covariant flux operators and propose tests of the proposal for such operators.

 The Amati relation is the correlation between the width of the optical afterglow of a gamma-ray burst (GRB) and its fluence.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The afterglow is produced by the forward shock ionizing the circumburst medium (CM).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The fluence is the total energy emitted from the GRB in the gamma-ray band.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is a very useful tool to study the high-energy emissions of GRBs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Amati relation is linear for the ordinary cosmological evolution scenario.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The slope of the Amati relation is related to the circumburst density, which is an indicator of the the type of the progenitor of the GRB.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If the Amati relation changes slope at high redshifts, this would imply that the circumburst density increases with redshift, i.e. that the progenitors of high-redshift GRBs are significantly different from the low-redshift ones.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This is contrary to the expected cosmological evolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The hypothesis of a selection effect, i.e. that high-redshift GRBs with larger energies are also more peculiar (i.e. have different progenitors), may explain the Amati relation changing slope at high redshifts.

 Flavour-dependent type II Leptogenesis provides a possible explanation of the observed neutrino masses and bi-large neutrino mixing.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The seesaw mechanism of type I implies the light neutrino masses are proportional to the smallness parameters in the Yukawa matrices, which can been understood from the perspective of flavoured Leptogenesis.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this theory, CP was violated in the see-saw process, producing a stochastic energy density perturbation in the effective potential for leptons, which is trans-Planckian and leads to a later problem of inadequate cosmological perturbation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, the flavoured Leptogenesis has an additional weak symmetry which can ensure that the flavoured CP asymmetry vanishes at leading order, and a small but non-vanishing contribution to the net asymmetry can be achieved through higher order contribution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this way, the trans-Planckian problem can be naturally avoided, and the necessary baryon asymmetry can be obtained.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Type II Leptogenesis could thus explain the observed neutrino masses and bi-large neutrino mixing simultaneously.

 Trans-Neptunian objects (TNOs) are a heterogeneous population for objects, most of which are likely scattered disc objects (SDOs) that formed within the trans-Neptunian region of the Solar System.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Their existence is predicted in 1664 by Johann-Heinrich Schroter, and the first such object was identified in 1801.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 TNOs are considered a key testbed for theories of planet formation, as their current orbit distribution provides evidence of the processes by which the Solar System evolved over time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recent high-resolution images from the Hubble Space Telescope (HST) have revealed that a significant fraction of TNOs are in fact in compact multiple systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This fraction is particularly high in larger TNOs, with about 15% of 2499+ objects with diameter >50 km being in multiple systems, and as many as one third of trans-Neptunian objects (TNOs) with a diameter of 100 km or more being part of multiple systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Although many of these observed companions are likely remnants of shattered embryonic asteroids, several systems with centaurs, comets, and classical Kuiper belt objects were also clearly identified.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Chaos-assisted capture (CAC) has been proposed as a mechanism to form these companions through resonant interactions with the giant planets, but recent theoretical work suggests that resonant capture may not be sufficient to explain the existence of so many multi-chained systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, we propose another mechanism by which TNOs in the trans-Neptunian region could have been members of multiple systems: fission.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that the sudden merger of two SDOs in a near-contact configuration can lead to the formation of a third SDO thanks to an instability that creates an additional gravitational torque.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This mechanism, which we dub chaos-assisted fission, has the advantage of explaining the high observed fraction of binary TNOs without the need for planets to be responsible for their origin.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that this dynamical process is likely to occur frequently in the trans-Neptunian region, especially during close encounters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By conducting a series of N-body simulations, we show that the instability that creates a new companion tends to occur for SDOs with a diameter of 100-150 km that are dynamically caught in an inward migration region between 35 and 40 au.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Under the conditions typically found in the trans-Neptunian region, the instability occurs more frequently for SDOs with an initial orbital radius of 30 au than for those with an initial orbital radius of 50 au.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we show that two SDOs with initial semi-major axes of 300 au and 1.5 au could have been members of a binary system through this process.

 Radio waves traveling through the atmosphere scour the sky, revealing the shape of the celestial sphere.

 Because stars are warmer than their surroundings, they preferentially emit into these cooler regions, creating the well-known temperature inversion in their atmospheres.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For the most part, AGB stars emit most strongly at shorter wavelengths, so this provides a way to detect them.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We collected photometric data from the U.K.’s White Mountain Array and analyzed it with a machine learning algorithm trained on data from the IRAS satellite.

 We then used this catalog to measure their radiative mass loss rates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We found a strong correlation between these rates and spatial extinction, which can be used to trace mass loss in three dimensions.

 Contrary, the applied magnetic field spatially distributed in the form of "ring" transforms the system from an insulating to a metallic one.

 The Orion Nebula is one among the most famous regions in the sky, and a jumping off point for many observing runs with both amateur and professional telescopes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Originally thought to be an example of a low-mass star forming region, it is later found to actually be a compact stellar cluster with an apparent emission temperature of over 10,000 K. The primary luminosity of the region comes from two massive stars within the inner region, also known as the Trapezium, but it is this nearby that can lead to significant analysis of the region's dynamics, surrounding gas, and galactic background.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The region has also become used as a testbed for many different astronomical techniques.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first infrared imaging study of the region were published in 1955 and in 1956, Russell H. Bowey described the region as "a tiny globular star cluster" with a density between 1022 and 1023 m−3.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In 1962, van den Bergh was the first to suggest whether the cluster was in fact in an early stage of gravitational collapse.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By 1964, Daniel Kerr described the region as "a concentration of some 50,000 stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 forming a beautiful, expanding cluster of nebulosity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 almost certainly once a part of Orion's Nebula."

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In 1968, David Whitmore detected an infrared counter-part to the Trapezium stars and in 1970, Walter Baade and Fritz Zwicky independently suggested that the Orion Nebula was in fact a star cluster.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By 1973, Whitmore published the first deep survey of the region in visible light, detecting of an additional 60 stars, and in 1974, the first infrared survey of the region was published, reaching a limit of 15 Myr and approximately 2000 stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By 1977, Alfred Landoldt and W. J. Moons independently calculated the age of the cluster to be between 2.1 and 2.5 million years, in close agreement with the most recent calculations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Orion Nebula is now regarded as an example of a very young, massive star forming region and this has significant implications for its subsequent interaction with the interstellar medium.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The region is within 1,200 light years of Earth and the Orion Molecular Cloud Complex, the nearest large molecular cloud, is approximately 1,000 light years across.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This close interaction has profound implications on the radiation and winds from the Trapezium stars, the feedback this has on the region's interstellar environment, and the potential for disruption of the entire region.

 In this paper, we study a two-component symmetric exclusion process (ASEP) on a one-dimensional lattice with open boundaries.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The boundary sites were injected and extracted with species-dependent rates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This system can be realized as a lattice gas model with one type of particles (ASEPs) that hop to the right and an other type of particles (holes) that hop to the left.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the ASEP without extraction, the system exhibits phase separation: ASEP particles form domains surrounded by a gas of holes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 When the extraction rate exceeds a critical value, the system undergoes a phase transition to an active state: Active sites become depleted and holes rush to the boundaries and accumulate at the extraction sites.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A pair of density and flux gap is identified at the transition point.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The model with two components generalizes the ASEP to asymmetric exclusion processes (ASEP(2)) in which both ASEPs and holes hop to the right and left with different rates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The behavior at the open boundaries with two species of particles is much richer than the previously studied cases with one species.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As example, the two-ASEP(2) system shows three phases: gas, coexisting liquid, and active liquid.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The density and flux gaps exist only for the liquid phases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We identify the order in the phase transitions using spatially resolved kinetic Monte Carlo simulations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 SCF methods, also known as self-consistent-field methods, are an important class of techniques in quantum chemistry for solving the electronic structure problem.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Hartree-Fock method, proposed by Paul Hartree and Robert F. Service

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [1] and later developed with Robert Marshak

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [2], was the first SCF method and remains widely used.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this technique, the system is approximated as a collection of non-interacting electrons, or, more accurately, a set of orthogonal orbitals, called Slater determinants, that describe the system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 TheHartree-Fock equation, wherein the energy of the system was expressed as a functional of the orbitals, is then iterated to self-consistency, that is, to a solution in which the orbitals do not change between iterations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Several generalizations of the Hartree-Fock method have since been developed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The coupled perturbed Hartree-Fock (CPHF) method, proposed by Gilbert

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [3] and developed by Freeman and Subbaswamy

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [4], is one such generalization.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this approach, the orbitals are allowed to change between iterations, and the energy is still expressed as a functional of the orbitals.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, the functional is approximated by the sum of the Hartree energy and a Fock energy expressed as a functional of the orbitals.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Variational iterated perturbation theory (VIPT) is a similar generalization, proposed with Edward

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [5] and developed in Hyberts and Wood

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 VIPT also represents the energy as a functional of the orbitals, but differs from CPHF in the manner by which the functional was approximated.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The energy is expressed as a sum of a Hartree energy and a "free-energy" functional, which involves only perturbation theory within a given order.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Variational perturbation theory (VPT) is another generalization to the Hartree-Fock method.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was based on a similar functional, but the functional is minimized with respect to the orbitals, as opposed to being treated as a fixed parameter.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 All of these generalizations of the Hartree-Fock method share the feature that the energy of the system is expressed as a functional of the orbitals.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This review focuses on the development of the Hartree-Fock SCF method, as well as some of its generalizations, over the past few decades.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We begin with a detailed description of the original method, outlining the various approximations that underlie its derivation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Next, several variants of the method are described.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We then move on to describe the development of related ideas.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, the CPHF method and its generalizations are described, and connections between these methods and Hartree-Fock are established.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, some challenges for the Hartree-Fock SCF method and its generalizations were discussed, including the need to develop efficient parallel algorithms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Overall, this review is intended as a resource for researchers interested in quantum chemistry and computational physics.

 In this paper, we perform a detailed comparison between several low-temperature and high-temperature approximation schemes for the stationary solution of the Ornstein-Zernike equation involving friction and hard-sphere interaction.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We compare these schemes with numerical solutions of the corresponding integral equation and with Monte Carlo simulations of an effective hard-sphere (H Obamacare) model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also show that our results can been used to obtain low- and high-temperature approximations for the solution of the Lado-Swift-Hohenberg equation, which is widely used to study patterns formation in evaporating drops and films.

 The rest of the paper is organized as follows.

 In the next section, we present the main equations and approximation schemes.

 The non-Gaussian characteristics of the cosmic density field induce scale-dependent effects that can be measured through the gravitational lensing of the Cosmic Microwave Background (CMB).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These effects imprint themselves into the two-point statistics of the temperature and polarization maps.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We quantify how the detectability of these effects is impacted by the intrinsic levels of non-Gaussianity measured by Planck in the Synchronous scenario as well as by the presence of additional cosmological parameters, in particular the presence of early dark energy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here is an excerpt of the paper: A remarkable property of entropy is its monotonicity under statistical mechanisms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if two random vectors are statistically independent, then their entropies add.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 The entropy power inequality (EPI) and the entropy rate (ER) entropy power inequality are fundamental and well known results in information theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The former states that the entropy of a random vector cannot be greater than the sum of the entropies of its components, while the latter states that the entropy of a random vector cannot be greater than the entropy of its mean.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Both these inequalities hold for any random vectors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 The Kohn-Sham (KS) scheme is one among the most important and widely used methods in theoretical chemistry and quantum physics to solve the Schrödinger equation for the system with Coulomb potential.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The efficiency of KS scheme relies on the choice of the approximate electron-electron interaction.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For strong interaction, one has to use more elaborate KS-potential, which is numerically expensive.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One among the efficient and low-cost approximations for the KS potential is the so-called exact exchange (EX) potential.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This potential was constructed as a functional derivative of the exact exchange energy with respect to the electron density.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The density obtained by the KS equations with the EX potential as a part of the exchange-correlation (XC) potential is very close to the actual one.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, the KS equation with the EX potential as the KS-potential yields a very large gap in the excitation spectrum, which may not correspond to the experimentally observed excitability of the systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This discrepancy is referred to as the paradox of the correlated electrons.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is shown by Vydrov and Scuseria in 2008 that the gap in the excitation spectrum of the KS system with the EX potential can be made closer to the experimental one by introducing an artificial dependence of the potential on density, which they called the non-local dependence (NLD).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we show that the existence of NLD in KS potential is a consequence of the fact that it is obtained as a solution of the KS equations with the XC potential containing a non-local term.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The non-local term appears due to the dependence of the Fock operator on the electron density.

 For two dimensions, we find a zero-temperature phase of the two-dimensional (2D) XY spin glass that exhibits a spontaneous rotational symmetry breaking and concomitant long-range order in the chirality degree of freedom, namely, the direction of the net chiralities of the spins in each small volume of the system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our findings suggest the possible existence of a discontinuous phase transition to a disorder-dominated phase at nonzero temperature.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The direct calculation of θ_{EA} and A_{chiral} have not been possible so far in two dimensions, owing to the extreme computational cost of existing exact techniques.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We expect that similar techniques will allow us to prove the existence of this phase and of its associated critical exponents, as well as of its continuum limit, in the general case of d dimensions and general lattice models of correlated electrons.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is a (net) rotation angle in the spin structure (e.g. left or right spin).

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 However, we found that, in the XY model on a lattice, chirality spontaneously appears at zero temperature, with very good accuracy.

 Graphene, a single layer of carbon atoms in a hexagonal lattice, is one of the most exciting two-dimensional materials.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Its electronic band structure presents two points of non-dispersibility, the so-called Dirac points, which are directly related to its intriguing transport properties.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recently, this material has attracted a great deal of attention due to its response to strong magnetic fields, which is reminiscent of the Aharonov-Bohm (AB) effect.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For particular, the transmission coefficient of charge carriers in graphene rings exposed to a uniform magnetic field exhibits a step-like dependence as a function of the Fermi energy, which is a characteristic signature of the AB effect.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Similar behavior has also been observed in other carbon allotropes such as bilayer graphene and boron nitride.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Despite its potential interest, to date, there have been few rigorous works exploring the response of graphene to a nonuniform magnetic field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Furthermore, when the radius of the solenoid is comparable to the magnetic length, new degrees of freedom, namely, the so-called topological valley, emerge.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that the conductance spectrum is completely different from the AB effect, even in the limit of a strong magnetic field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we extend our findings to propose a realistic device that implements the AB effect in graphene.

 More precisely, we show that the Bohmian position of a test particle is a local constant of the motion for any wavefunction that is a nontrivial entangled discrete or continuous superposition of product states.

 We also discuss an application to quantum computation.

 Quasars are highly luminous point sources of the universe, primarily found in the nuclei of large galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is generally accepted that active galactic nucleis (AGN) are powered by material falling into a supermassive black hole at the center of the host galaxy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As material falls into the black hole, it generates bright lights called quasars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These quasars are are observed over a broad range of distances from the host galaxy, corresponding to various stages in the growth of the black hole, and are valuable tools for understanding how black holes and their host galaxies form and evolve.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using a large cluster catalog in the Sloan Digital Sky Survey data release 11, we select a sample of 43 quasars at a redshift of 0.3 < z < 2.6 that is located in the projected vicinity of a cluster, with a projected separation of less than 1 Mpc.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We compare the radial distribution of these quasars to that of a control sample of 43 matched quasars at similar redshifts that are not in the vicinity of a cluster.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use a maximum likelihood method to fit for the mean separation between quasars and their host clusters, and find no significant radial offset between the two samples.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We conclude that quasars do not preferentially reside in the centers of their clusters, and that any preference for quasars to be found near the centers of clusters is less than 5% at the 99% confidence level.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results are consistent with previous studies that had either examined significantly smaller samples of quasars, or have not separated quasars into central and satellite galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results indicate that satellite quasars are not primarily be fueled by the hot gas in the clusters, but are instead forming their own massive reservoirs of cold gas, which are likely the primary source of fuel for future growth.'

 The vibrational spectrum of nitrous oxide has been studied in solution, for the first time, using an infrared (IR) laser as the source of vibration.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The OH and NH2 anti-solvent refrigeration technique was used to produce samples of nitrous oxide in diethyl ether solution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A range of data analysis methods were used to analyse the spectra, and it is found that the global minimum nitrous oxide conformer in solution has a gamma-proton resonance as a single hydrogen bond and a symmetric CH2O hydrogen bond between the two molecules.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This is in contrast to the vapour, where the global minimum has two strong NH.O hydrogen bonds, leading to the resonance form.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The reorganisation energy for the gamma-proton resonance in solution is 18 cm-1, very close to the value in the gas phase.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The calculated am1g-frequencies for the two strongest NH.O and gamma-proton hydrogen bonds are 3650 and 3300 cm-1 respectively, and are found in the infrared spectrum at 3520 and 3220 cm-1 respectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The calculated lifetime of the gamma-proton hydrogen bond in solution is 44 ps, and was found from the linewidth of the frequency range corresponding to this hydrogen bond, which is 10 cm-1.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The linewidth is used to calculate the vibrational lifetime of the nitrous oxide solution molecules.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The nitrous oxide solution has a weaker gamma-proton hydrogen bond than in the gas phase or other solution conformers, and this has was proposed to be one of the causes of the strong inversion, general anaesthesia, produced by inhalation of the solution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The gamma-proton hydrogen bond in solution has a lifetime which is less than that in the gas phase or other solution conformers, and this has implications for the theory of general anaesthesia produced by inhalation of nitrous oxide solution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The nitrous oxide spectrum in solution has been found to be in good agreement with previous gas phase studies, with a combination of methods for analysing IR spectra.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The global minimum nitrous oxide solution conformer has a much lower energy than the observed gamma-proton resonance form in the gas phase, and this may be one of the reasons why general anaesthesia was only produced by inhalation of the gas form.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results could be relevant to understanding nitrous oxide general anaesthesia, and the differences could be used to characterise solvents and correlate with trends in anaesthetic potency.

 The light-cone power spectrum (LCP) has been proposed as a novel statistics to measure the large-scale structure (LSS) in the universe1.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the standard rulers and clocks (SCR) approximation, the LSS forms a light cone due to the recession velocity of the galaxy or the sound speed of the baryon field2.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using the LSS as a natural ruler and clock, we could measure the geodesic distance and the expansion rate of the light cone respectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By this way, the LSS provides a unique test bed to study gravity in an highly anisotropic universe3.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recent observations of the LSS show that the universe is dominanted by dark energy with 73.8% of the total energy density4, while the density of matter is only 26.2%.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result became known as the cosmic acceleration.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The nature of dark energy is one of the most important open questions in fundamental physics and astronomy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Since the equation of state (EOS) of dark energy strongly correlates with the expansion history of the universe, a precise measurement of dark energy EOS can been achieved by using the LSS as a natural ruler.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work, we build a model-independent LSS statistic by measuring the anisotropic multipoles of the LSS.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 After using a cubic-mapping formula to interpolate the LSS in simulations, we measure the multipoles up to the order of 10 in the anisotropic case.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To test the efficacy of this statistic, we apply it to the most precise simulation produced by the IllustrisTNG project.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the measurement of the first two anisotropic multipoles can break the degeneracy between the EOS and the parameterized post-Newtonian (PPN).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Furthermore, the ratio between the first two multipoles is independent of the bias between the LSS and the dark matter.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, this LSS statistic provides a promising method to study gravity and shed light on the nature of dark energy.

 Recent progress in the understanding of the properties of diffusive SNS junctions was was achieved by investigating their transport properties as a function of the nature and the position within the junction of the involved interfaces and by considering the limit of strong spin-orbit coupling.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, we present an analytical treatment of the non-equilibrium properties of such diffusive SNS junctions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we focus on the supercurrent flowing in the junction, which was generated by a non-equilibrium pairing mechanism.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We discuss the dependence of the resulting supercurrent on the interfaces, and in particular we focus on the effect of nonideal interfaces, scattering at impurities and potential fluctuations at the interface.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that for realistic interface conditions and spin-orbit coupling strengths, the induced supercurrent is of the order of 1% of the equilibrium critical current, and that a reduction of the induced supercurrent due to the scattering at impurities or potential fluctuations at the interface can been partially compensated by tuning the shape of the order parameter interface profile.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Historically, it was thought that these outflows were powered solely by energy lost by stretching of the GRB jet, which launches at nearly the speed of light.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, we demonstrate that collimated outflows can also be powered by baryon-loaded winds from a magnetar, and that the majority of observed GRB central engines are spinning down rapidly via this mechanism.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If enough energy are coupled to the winds, then the outflow is mildly relativistic (Gamma > 2).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The combination of baryon-loaded magnetar winds and ultra-relativistic jets remains a viable model for the observed diversity of long-duration GRBs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A rapidly-rotating neutron star (NS) known as a magnetar is a popular model for the central engine of long-duration gamma-ray bursts (GRBs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 During a GRB, the surface of the magnetar would emit gravitational-wave (GW) radiation, which could power a cosmological population of highly-relativistic jets, in addition to baryonic winds.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 While some baryonic-wind models produce mildly-relativistic jets that could account for some of the diversity of long-duration GRBs, these models tend to over-predict the amount of energy that can be extracted from the central NS.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We demonstrate that a better coupling of magnetar energy to baryonic outflows via neutrino annihilation or Poynting flux can solve this problem.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we consider a combination of a baryonic wind from a magnetar with a mildly-relativistic jet, and find that the total energy coupled to the winds can account for the majority of long GRBs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We conclude that a model with a baryonic-wind component and a jet remains a viable model for the long-duration GRB phenomenon.

 NGC 7679 is a luminous infrared (LIRG) composite Seyfert 2 galaxy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It has a broad line region (BLR) and a narrow line region (NLR) at a very large distance of 12.2 kpc from the Earth.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It also has two nuclei with separation of less than 10 pc.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The distance between the nuclei and the physical size of the two nuclei are all really small compared with the distance between the two regions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We name this galaxy as a close Double Nucleus Galaxy (DDNG).

 They are all at the level of LIRGs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 This is usually interpreted as dust heated by young stars.

 There is also an active galactic nucleus (AGN) with a bolometric luminosity of 9.1×1039 [W].

 The discovery and characterization of new nearby white dwarf (WD) systems is important for many fields of astronomy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The minimum mass of each WD orbiting a solar-type star, the binaries were called white dwarf binaries (WDBs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The frequency of WDBs is a critical input to tests of planet formation and for determining the distribution of stellar mass in binaries.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Furthermore, WDBs have cooling times that span many Gyr, and by studying their orbital parameters and spectra, one can learn about WD physics, evolution, and asteroseismology.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper we report the discovery and parameters for 33 new WDBs, increasing the total to 90.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Atomic arrangements and compositions lead in different properties.

 Single point mutations (SPMs) in protein sequences has long been of interest to biologists and engineers, due to their capability to affect protein stability and function.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Historically, SPMs have been characterized with binary classification approaches, whereby proteins are classified as either stable or unstable based on some SPM-specific stability metric.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Although this metric-based approach has been useful, it has several limitations, including: i) the metric must be pre-calculated for the SPM of interest; ii) the metric typically analyzes the entire protein sequence rather than individual sites of the protein, and therefore loses site-specific information; and iii) the metric is based on an abstract protein representation, making the interpretation of stability changes difficult.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recently, a new SPM characterization paradigm had emerged, known as "energy decomposition analysis".

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In essence, this method first characterizes the wild-type protein with a high-level method like molecular mechanics energy decomposition analysis (MM-EDA).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For each SPM, the method then decomposes the total energy difference between the wild-type and mutant proteins into residue-level contributions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This method allows us to capture site-specific contributions of the mutant and wild-type proteins, and therefore may be a better tool for understanding the stability impacts of SPMs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We tested this paradigm on the recently published CO-BRASS data set (1).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this dataset, the authors experimentally characterized the effects of 402 alanine mutations in flavodoxin (a 7.3 kD protein).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Each mutation was examined in both the oxidizing (oxidized) and non-oxidizing (reduced) states.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The authors determined that 220 mutations resulted in significant stability changes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using the energy decomposition method, we were able to accurately predict whether a SPM would impact stability (i.e. be positive or negative).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As shown in Table 1, we were able to achieve 91% accuracy on the test set.

 Within this paper we present results from an investigation of the structure and properties of dark matter (DM) halos in the largest Lambda Cold DM model (LCDM) simulation to date, a hydrodynamical resimulation of 4 billion particles representing a (570 Mpc/h)3 region of the universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We identify DM halos in this large volume simulation using a technique combining friends-to-friends (FOF) with a high-order multivariate filter and characterize their inner structure using the radial distribution of their DM and substructure (stellar and gaseous) components.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that at all masses, DM halos can become cleanly separated into two primary structural components: a relatively smoothly distributed "central" region and a more clumpy "substructure" component which comprises a distinct secondary distribution having an asymptotic power-law slope of -3.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The fraction of substructure within a halo, and the power-law slope of its structural distribution, is both significantly correlated with the halo's maximum identified gravitational attraction: the more substructure a halo has, the stronger its central gravitational pull.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We refer to these two distinct structural components as the "core" and "fossil" distributions, respectively, and suggest that fossil groups, comprising a halo with a significant fraction of central substructure, may become identified by an algorithm combining the FOF halo-finder with the inverse of this power-law slope.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We apply our algorithm to a selection of clusters and groups from the Bolshoi simulation, finding that, while the scheme correctly classifies most clusters as fossil or non-fossil groups, it fails to identify some fossil groups with diffuse stellar components and halos having shallower central cusp slopes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we propose that the fractional abundance and clustering properties of fossil groups may provide a useful probe of the normalization of the galaxy cluster mass function and the dark matter power spectrum at high masses.

 NAND formula, also known by N-ary NOR function, is a compact representation of a relation between a large number of binary variables.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 NAND formula consists of a few burden hard-coded gates, and some sum and product variables.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Modern NAND circuits contain tens of millions of such variables.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is crucial to develop efficient circuit simulation algorithms for profit analysis, design validation and hardware/software co-design.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present a compilation flow for NAND formula evaluators with a small number of burden gates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main idea is to do peephole optimization and bit-level rewriting to gradually simplify the NAND formula.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This technique will greatly reduce the number of sum and product variables.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We applied our technique to two widely used NAND models and achieved over 90% reduction in the number of sum and product variables.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our techniques can be readily applied to other complex circuits with a small number of burden gates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Lorentz transformations form a group that shows how the laws of physics change when things move at constant speed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A group is a set of transformations, with an identity, that can be composed with one another.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this sense, the Lorentz transformations express how things change with velocity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, if one knows the velocity of an object, one can use the Lorentz transformations to find how it changes with time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In turn, this allows one to find the spatial transformation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This article shows that, although the Lorentz transformations were introduced a very long time ago, they can still provide useful lessons for how to approach mathematics and physics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, it discusses the finding that it is useful to distinguish between first and second order equations in physics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The article then explores the origins of the Lorentz transformations and shows that they can be derived from more general transformations, which in turn can be derived from the requirement that certain laws of physics should not change over time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From this more general perspective, the Lorentz transformations can be considered a specific case, whose use can lead to confusion.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The article then considers an example in special relativity of a person measuring the speed of light in two different inertial frames of reference.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was shown that this requires one to consider both the spatial and the temporal component of the Lorentz transformations, as the speed of light is a function of both.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this example, the temporal component of the Lorentz transformations can been interpreted as a change of reference frame, which alters the rate at which clocks in the different reference frames move with respect to each other.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From this, the authors find that if one specifies the spatial transformation between the two reference frames, one can in turn find the temporal transformation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the second part of the article, the example is generalised to two inertial reference frames that move with respect to one another, leading to a situation called the Relativistic Doppler effect.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This again requires the consideration of both the spatial and temporal components of the Lorentz transformations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The article then considers the situation in which the observers in the two reference frames agree that light should travel with a fixed speed, and that this should remain true regardless of their motion with respect to one another.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this case, the temporal component of the Lorentz transformations reduces to a simpler transformation rule for the light’s frequency, which can then be interpreted as a standard way to compare the observers’ own reference frames when they move with respect to one another.

 A tool for computational cryptography known as Rime could establish security of communication over a channel by use of ideal lattices.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A strong R-matrix is a non-linear operator that, together with a related linear operator (the S-matrix), yields an associative product that defines a finite-dimensional non-commutative ring of unity, known as a finite braided commutative algebra (FBCA).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From this work we describe computation of R-matrices for eight binary QC codes using the RIME framework.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use the abelian setting where the S-matrix is a diagonal matrix to compute R-matrices that are also diagonal, and give examples for non-abelian R-matrices for the same codes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We discuss how the R-matrices interact in RIME to establish ideal lattices for each of the codes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The eight codes we study are optimal two-level codes, two-level extended Hamming codes, and five four-level codes commonly used for surface-code quantum computing.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our computed R-matrices have many nice properties, like compatibility with the abelian setting and simple structure when viewed as a lattice over the real numbers, rational numbers, or complex numbers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For particular, we describe the case where the R-matrix is a real diagonal matrix as a families of real numbers (depending on several parameters) where each number occurs with multiplicity one and each occurs exactly twice.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also show how to compute R-matrices corresponding with non-abelian structures when the S-matrix is diagonal.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The RIME framework of computing R-matrices in the abelian setting makes use of an appropriately modified quantum chess problem, the Hamilton Pfaffian QC-polynomial.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For particular, each symmetry of the chess problem corresponds to a permutation matrix in the R-matrix, and these permutations satisfy a precise lattice-theoretical restriction.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the non-abelian case, no analogous check for R-matrix structure appears to be known, so alternative techniques must be used to establish non-abelian R-matrices.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From this work, we describe a non-abelian RIME framework that similarly uses a modified Hamilton Pfaffian but with the permutations no longer required to satisfy a lattice-theoretical restriction.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Instead, an ad-hoc method for establishing non-abelianity was used.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we present a few experiments using RIME to establish security in communication over common communication channels (such as WiFi or cell-phone networks).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that our computed R-matrices are strong and that ideal lattices produced using the R-matrices are the best lattice-based schemes we can find for each of the codes we study.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The runtime for each computation of R-matrices and the resulting lattice was less than 12 hours on a standard laptop.

 Co oxides have recently attracted much attention due to their possible role in the recently discovered phenomenon of high temperature superconductivity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One particular cobalt oxide, Na$_x$CoO$_2$, has received considerable attention due to its resemblance to high Tc copper oxides in many physical properties.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Despite this similarity, the material is particularly unusual in that charge and spin variables are both almost perfectly balanced, giving the material the nickname “bad metal.”

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A common approach to understanding the physical properties of these materials has been to introduce electronic correlations by treating the cobalt 3d electrons as a localized effective degrees of freedom.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we introduce a fermion lattice model that incorporates strong electronic correlations without explicit treatment of the local cobalt orbitals.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using dynamical mean field theory we calculate the electronic and thermoelectric properties of the model as a function of doping, and find that while intermediate correlations enhance the electronic specific heat, they also give rise to large thermoelectric responses, making the material a good metal.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work, we develop a microscopic theory for toroidal moments in bulk periodic crystals.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By employing a systematic, momentum-space approach, we derive the general form of the effective Hamiltonian in the presence of magnetic-anisotropy and Dzyaloshinsky-Moriya interactions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The theory is then applied to describe the nature of toroidal moments in magnesium diboride (MgB2) and dichalcogenides with either orthorhombic (TMDC) or polar (WS2) structures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our calculations demonstrate the coexistence of symmetric and antisymmetric toroidal moments in MgB2, whereas in TMDC and WS2 only antisymmetric toroidal moments are allowed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that the antisymmetric toroidal moments in MgB2 and TMDC are equivalent and induce an effective magnetic field that modifies the dispersion of surface plasmons.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In WS2, we predict the emergence of a new circularly-polarized plasmon mode that is protected by symmetry and not affected by the inclusion of Coulomb interactions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These predictions could become experimentally verified by means of spectroscopic techniques such as Raman scattering and infrared optical absorption.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our work provides a solid theoretical foundation for engineering toroidal moment couplings in periodic crystals and for exploiting their emergent electromagnetic properties in plasmonics and excitonics.

 The acceleration of the universe is still unknown.

 One of the most popular explanations is the dark energy, described by a cosmological constant or by a dynamical form (quintessence).

 We introduce a variant on the Simon games called Entangled Simon games.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For Entangled Simon games, two players, Alice and Bob, take turns to send predetermined unitary operations to a joint quantum system, where the joint state is an entangled initial state.

 Explanations of the alignment of the major axes of galaxies with their spin axes, such as observational biases, imply that galaxy discs are not randomly oriented in space.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, previous measurements of the orientations of galaxies have been averaged over large volumes and are therefore not ideal for detecting coherent alignment on small scales.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We calculate the orientations of galaxies within their large-scale cosmic environments using a sample of 50,000 bright galaxies from the Sloan Digital Sky Survey Data Release 7.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use the positions of satellite galaxies around these galaxies as a probe of their local cosmic environment, and find that the distribution of satellite galaxy locations is strongly anisotropic.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This is consistent with previous observations that galaxies tend to be aligned with the large-scale structure in which they are embedded.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the major axes of satellite galaxies were preferentially aligned with the direction of the large-scale structure to which their central galaxy is most closely bound, but that the distribution of orientations is only consistent with isotropy at the 98% confidence level.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This anisotropy was most likely caused by interactions between galaxies and their dark matter hosts, as the alignment with the large-scale structure persists even when controlling for galaxy shape and other properties.

 “Weak gravitational lensing of (2+1) gravity.”

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Physical Review D, 83.8 (July 2010): 084047.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Unlike (2+1) gravity, which describes the spatial section of gravity in three dimensions, gravity has two propagating degrees of freedom instead of three.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The lensing properties of (2+1) gravity was not studied before.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, we calculate the deflection angle and the shear of light in (2+1) gravity and show that the theory allows for strong lensing, which could be tested with future astronomy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use the exact solution of the (2+1) gravitational field generated by a point mass as a lens.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We obtain an explicit expression for the deflection angle by the point mass in (2+1) gravity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 At a point mass in (2+1) gravity the deflection angle is equal to two thirds of the inverse cube of the distance from the point mass to the source.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also calculate the shear of light in (2+1) gravity and show that the theory allows for strong lensing.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our findings can be tested with future astronomy and could be used to test (2+1) gravity.
